cvPacKFnBHzLSkbkd46quw.text: We had our daughters rehearsal dinner here. It was such a great experience! The managers did everything to accommodate our needs before the event, including gluten free options for a few guests. Any questions that I emailed to them were answered promptly. And I have to say, this was not the case with other places. We had the upstairs and our own bar. The food was hot, abundant, and wonderful!! If you have a large party,this is the place to go. The price was great too!

vIl3H1RbAbZ5mhiZbwDTyw.text: Chips & salsa are really good! Cheese crisp is awesome! The margaritas are to die for! The strawberry margarita is my favorite! It's a little loud, chips & salsa doesn't come out right away you need to ask, the decorations are great! it's a very chill atmosphere good lighting, plenty of TVs to watch sports on Sunday!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry margarita! So good

4OrjtSRq-qPlQ-1HMawPyQ.text: Never been so unsatisfied with tacos...the pops were flat, the chicken tacos were burnt..the sour cream was really thin.. when asked about paying for the flat pop, they had to go talk about removing it from the bill.. we had a bigger group for work... we will never recommend  or go back here again..

gyAEhYbXijDnvcoZd0ephQ.text: Great pitchers of margaritas and the patio is excellent. Kyle is a spectacular individual, as are the bartenders. Great place for drinks and appetizers, definitely try the guacamole, it has pomegranate seeds, so you won't be disappointed (unless those aren't your jam).

P1-4DnEQpHAv7EqCcLZlQQ.text: It's Friday afternoon beautiful day out decided to walk down the street from our home in old town! Took the kids out enjoyed a walk so we decided to come in here. It was busy, had to give the hostess number of party and our number to call. So finally half hr later. Went back. The hostess had to find a table. She said "ok we have a table upstairs" mind you it's three adults and two kids. So we go upstairs. She literally seats us in a table of 4 ALL the way in the corner like we were on punishment. These tables are super small and good for 4 people. My husband  is a big guy there was no way we can all fit in. So finally we decided to just get up and leave. When we told the "hostess" how can she seat 5 people in a 4 seat table she said that was all they had. Are you kidding. You couldn't tell us this the moment we decided to be on the waiting list. The hostess are terrible. They need to change up whoever is in the front dealing and figure out a better communication with the customers. It was pretty disappointing that was her answer instead of helping and wanting to make us happy.

9y3fD7FWAnR92LycJNhwYg.text: Do yourself a favor and don't go in the last hour they are open because I just had a very mediocre service and the thing was our server was friendly her name is Kylie but it took forever to get greeted forever to get chips for ever to get refills and she never even bussed our tables left our dirty plates there the entire time.   The food was really good otherwise it probably get it one or two stars in fact I got the extra third start just because the churros Sunday was so amazing  Someone did say in Kylie's defense she was the only server in the whole restaurant I don't know but that shouldn't be my problem anyways. There was a Giants night game so they should of staffed accordingly

u-vOPxVQrWU0aij2GWjq7w.text: I don't know why you would go here.  Barrio Queen is super close and much better food. Help was nice.  Cheese crisp was tasty, as was salsa/chips.  Guacamole tasted like it was out of a salt-can.  Queso had lumps of cheese in it, not even melted.  Taco's were terrible - who puts cheddar cheese on taco's?  Really dry meats, not much of it on there.  Just a few frozen shrimp laying on a bed of dry rice?  Seriously?  The chicken tortilla soup tasted like chili.   It was a rough meal.  So, I guess if you just want a cheese crisp, come here.  I wouldn't touch anything else.

XYKnUIz-F4b_AJ-7tJF5xQ.text: Excellent food and service. The patio is excellent seating. The three taco deal is a good deal for $13.50. I told the server (Caitlin) to bring  me her three favorite tacos and she chose excellently. I had the Carnitas -- smoky and spicy, Island shrimp -- sweet and sour, and  a breaded fish taco that was excellent.the house margarita is good but they have a huge selection of margaritas and tequila. Excellent grub and value. Do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Same
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Island shrimp and fish taco with house margarita. Excellent food and service!

_adkWkwBMAw5i62Q2K9D8A.text: Very, very good Mexican food! The good first...! Their specialty is tacos & they have all sorts to choose from. Best shredded beef taco I've ever had. The papas & chorizo taco was tasty too. I didn't care for the Diablo shrimp taco (which is odd because I LOVE guajillo chiles) but my husband thought it was great...to each their own! Fabulous & flavorful black beans.  The bad next...! I have never waited so long for chips & salsa at a Mexican restaurant ever in my life. In fact, I thought maybe we needed to order them but our waitress assured me they'd be right out. Ten minutes later we had to ask another waitress, who brought them out right away. Then we waited even longer for our appetizer guacamole. It was a little too tangy and topped with pomegranate seeds...just okay. Neither of my kids liked the food here. Both thought the Tinga chicken rolled tacos were too spicy. (I didn't think so.) They don't have any gringo items on the menu for kids or other picky eaters (& no ketchup). Of course, if everyone in your party digs Mexican food, this isn't a problem. We ordered 2 flour tortillas for the kids since they didn't eat any of their food. Then we had to wait 20 minutes for the tortillas to be delivered, but the waitress took them off the check due to the long wait. I don't know why she couldn't just call out the order instead of waiting for them behind big meal tickets, though. (I used to wait tables at a Mexican restaurant years ago.)  My husband and I will definitely be back. We'll just leave the kids at home next time!

BDnhsnNtxa_8Y8NoEcYXRA.text: Great atmosphere! Their mango tango margarita was delicious! Staff was nice. Food was great. I didn't make it on time for their happy hour when I was in town this time. Prices for drink wasn't bad without happy hour. I did get to peak at thier happy hour menu and I would deffinetly recommend. The prices looked great. This is a place I would make it a point to visit when I am back in town again.

DG7yTeu7bb2S7hQfIhWBlw.text: I've never written one of these reviews before but after our experience here I felt I needed to. For those of you who don't want to read my rant, food is awful and made us physically sick.  My boyfriend and I split the chicken fajitas and his dad had the chili relleno, which he said was mediocre. There's no other way to say it, our fajitas were horrible! There were a total of 8 small pieces of tough non-delicious chicken. I kid you not, EIGHT PIECES! And I swear there must have been a whole large onion in it. That, paired with the canned beans and dry rice, had both me and my boyfriend sick all night and part of the following morning. And to wrap it all up, the waitress forgot my boyfriends drink which isn't a big deal but she also forgot she was at work and literally had to flag her down from playing on her phone. The only thing we liked there was my mango Margarita. Props for that I guess...

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The chicken fajitas that gave us food poisoning, that&#39;s a piece of chicken sticking out of the mound of onion

ZwKTGXd1XG5KGfMhfRR7xA.text: Great spot! Was looking for a spot close to where my kids were taking a class and was sold when I saw the name. The tequila menu was impressive and I will be back to try more! The green salsa was amazing, I think my friend wanted to slurp it straight from the bowl. We both had a variety of tacos that were delicious. It's a bit far from home but will return anytime we are in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Herradurra Tequila Flight

iaLe3f-eW2b5z-3YFGknnQ.text: Close to 5 stars.    Food was good, I went w the 3 taco plate.  Battered fish, carnitas and el pastor .  My wife had hashtag veggie bowl w chicken, which she loved.  Staff was on the move and service was quick & solid.

DemrIjSKrxrWFW6SZ2pcHw.text: None of their staff seems very excited to be there ever!  I have been here at all different times and it is always the same humdrum.    This last time I went with a friend of mine for a late dinner.  There was still 40 minutes till close, so it was not like we skipped in at the last second.  You could tell the bartender was not too happy about us showing up.  He offered us drinks and I had to request a menu, then he stood there staring at us while we decided what to order.  We ended up ordering 3 different kinds of tacos.  He failed to ask us if we wanted flour or corn tortillas, and they came out with flour tortillas; I am not a fan of flour tortillas.  It was just not a pleasant dining experience aside from my company.    I can say they have a great taco Tuesday Happy Hour, but otherwise, I would never come here for anything else.

c2ZEkKsLgRfjx6vKi_yu_A.text: This aint' the Ritz, but it is a cool place to grab grub after a Spring Training Giants game.   My son and I had nachos (high quality, btw) and beer after a game.  Perfect.  We'll be  back next year.  Go Giants!

vAlG9NFVYqyJKk5XG2FK0A.text: *Better than your typical Mexican Restaurant.  *The service was fantastic.  *Best happy hour *Try the house made margarita *Great for groups or eating alone *Located in a cute area that's great for walking

V8iq3yyC4X98Dn7REZaKmA.text: This is a fun place to go for casual Mexican food. Their margaritas are amazing. It's nice to see them use fresh lime. The staff is fun and I always have a good time when I go here with my friends.  The chicken tacos are my favorite

ZKW7zbc-GdaOcdorEy2phQ.text: Took a good friend's recommendation and tried this Old Town landmark. An outstanding Happy Hour with really good appetizers and house margaritas!!! Service was quick, efficient and very friendly.  Definitely returning!! Excellant value for the money!!

VP_fbivK93BdxRelGhmX1A.text: This was my first stop in Old Town. I really enjoyed the atmosphere.  Three resultant was quaint and well appointed.   The staff was really friendly.    The pork salsa verde was amazing.     100 tequilas oh yeah.   Got there in time for happy hour.   Will definitely come again!

3AOMhe9DMEhBpb8trQuY4A.text: Visiting from FLORIDA, read the YELP reviews... they were all right.  Delicious, fresh hot food served with a smile and great service.  Be sure and try the KALUA FLAN.  Highly recommend this place.  Gets busy early, a fun happy, crowd.

FKNVru_qm-w0puMRzfyrkQ.text: Ok, so I understand that there are others that don't agree with this rating, but I think this place is amazing!!!!  I have been here several times and their taco's are delicious.  On top of that, they have great appetizers and margaritas.  Hit this place up during happy hour and try the guac and ceviche.   Let's not forget the best item at Cien Agave which is their habanero margarita.  Absolutely amazing!!!

-dXMVDBLIpKQGDKvsnRU4g.text: Four stars because I've only been here once and I've become a bit careful with the doling out of stars.  That said, my husband, mom-in-law and I had lunch here last week and we thought the tacos and the margaritas were spot on!   I lived in Phoenix some 20+ years ago and the *good* Mexican restaurants in Phoenix became my benchmark for Mexican food.  Granted, all we ate here (at Cien Agaves) were the tacos, rice and beans but, it's surprising how easy it is to mess up a taco.  I sampled the grilled ono, shredded beef and I think the carne asado taco.  All were good but my favorite was the shredded beef... I had a moment with that one.. (picture the scene in Disney's Ratatouille when the food critic samples Remy's ratatatouille).  I was transported to 1986. The margaritas we had deserve their own paragraph.  They use fresh ingredients and it shows!  One look at the first page of the menu and you know THEY know their tequila.  Find out when happy hour is as we learned you can get some very good deals.

dtfxpk1mukVFJ7dIp8Mqug.text: This is my husbands and I go to place for great Mexican. Excellent happy hour, tasty margs and large portions! I love the pork chili with a fried egg on top, also the Mexican pizza with pork is HUGE! Love the patio in by the fire place in the winter and the bar area is a great place to kick back and meet up with friends. Tacos come a-la-cart or with rice and beans and there are about 30 different kinds to choose from! If your into tequila they have just about every kind. Staff is friendly and fast. All I know is when I suggest this place for dinner, everyone always is excited to go!

9oMxr02QhXX66LAjBhZGIA.text: It's been a few months since I've been here, and what a change, not for the better. I usually get the same thing to start with, ceviche and pollo asado. Both are usually quite delicious, not this time.  The ceviche had absolutely no flavor to it. As if the chef tried to make it as flavorless as possible. I did not finish it as it was not enjoyable in the least. Now for the tacos. Stale taco shells, dried and overcooked chicken, slopped on guac and no pico de gallo. The tacos were so bad I tried to rescue them by asking for pico de gallo, since they did not put any on, and then I was charged $1.00 extra. Of course, no manager was anywhere in sight. This place simply doesn't care. On the bright side, the margaritas and salsa are still good, but the chips were stale.  Not only will I not return, but I can no longer recommend this place to businessmen from out of town. I see dozens of new business people every day who stay in Scottsdale and they always ask for Mexican food, and I've always said Cien Agaves. No more.

RamIjKjddTTH8qzi6QjYFQ.text: they have great Mexican food! always come here when we visit for spring training. the margaritas are the best! they have many flavors and even more tequila options. super good!

5pCulYXCjggGG6yX7Yc8AA.text: This was our first (and last time) going here. We wanted a taco Tuesday. A friend recommended it to us. We sat for at least 15 with nothing. Got our drink order filled. No chips or water for us. Food was just okay. Couldn't order desert cause nobody told our server the kitchen was closed. Too many other places to go than to go through that again...

S1EKSngF9LVvFQ08Pye59Q.text: What a cute little place in Old Town!  We went on a Sunday during football season, so there were a bunch of food and drink specials.  Their margaritas were good as well as the food.  The servers were friendly and attentive.  We don't get into Scottsdale all too often, but we'll definitely stop back in this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Cg6n9fQ0wt6sAt3yBbOh6A.text: Stopped in for a drink on our first visit here. We live in Litchfield Park and are exploring the area. Old town is touristy but cool.  I'm a big tequila fan and Cien Agaves offers over 100 tequilas! I was tempted to try them all but only had the house margarita which they claim is the best in town. I'd like to say it was the best house margarita I've ever had.   I also ordered the happy hour special tacos. They were well made and delicious. We were pleased with this pub and will return very soon.

Z6s4bL39GlMFR8A2A1j-jA.text: Had a great night here. Happy hour is great!  Seven of us ate and a few drank for under $100. Appetizers were delicious and half off. We had Olivia as a server and she did great for such a demanding group.

nBY98tZt3TNcjSrOvqboiA.text: This place is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale. They have a great wait staff, great food, and great drinks. You cant go wrong here. My favorite are the Tinga Chicken Tacos, and I like to wash it down with a Cadillac Margarita! If I'm with my girlfriend, we like to share the "Gigante" with is a 56 ounce margarita for $20! I take all my friends here who come to visit!

APNk7yymOoitRW6hOE1jsA.text: Met girlfriends for drinks and appetizers. Drinks were fair, and they actually did make a special order for me, although not as good as I had at other restaurants. Food was less than mediocre. We only ordered veggies quesadillas. It was cut in four pieces and the two end pieces had cheese and no veggies. We asked for extra veggies on the next order and it was a tad improved but nothing special. Service was fair to bad. The server forgot silverware, forgot extras we asked for three times, forgot to ring our check had to ask twice to get the check and she said she wondered what was in her pocket. It was the clipboard with our credit card and cash.The worst part though was sitting on the patio two of the people in the party had to face the alley and the garbage cans which, well, smelled of garbage. Won't be back anytime soon. Very disappointing.

Og-WUb8jOqoJMlHjZHK4nA.text: This place has a good vibe to it.  Their food is okay, nothing too special.  They do have specials during different days of the week.  I went on Tuesday for their shredded beef taco special for $1 a piece.  Like I said, nothing too great, but decent for what it's worth.  So when you go on a day they have a special be prepared to wait a few minutes.  For it being my first time there, I would have enjoyed it more if the waiter was a little more kind to the customers.  I'll give her the benefit of a doubt and say she was having a bad day.

J4EtUS9v-lyZw-DfnQqinQ.text: I have been to cien agaves many times. Last night was extremely disappointing to me. My boyfriend pulled a long black hair out of his fajita, which, our waitress had her hair down, and had long black hair. We informed her about the hair, she said, I will be right back. Only to go see, that she put her hair up before speaking with her manager about it. He comes up to the table. Is completely rude to us. Asks us to show the hair after my boyfriend had flinged it to ground in disgust. Needless to say, after how rude they were about it, I will never be going again

aoWi2dAQb_4ymS4ES1Iflg.text: Absolutely love their tacos and happy hour!!! happy hour every day so come early to get a good spot! the crunchy tacos are the best! Try the house margarita too! Will deff be heading here at least  2-3 times a month for happy hour!

jQrDLPGgpmzhZE0ol_oMzQ.text: First time ever eating at this place great food for taco Tuesdays two dollar tacos I will be back.  I was in town watching the world champion San Francisco Giants

NwbfeWOcC5yAw70bA6RtoA.text: The food here was very good.  They also have an excellent tequila menu.  The service was a little grumpy but I found that in almost all of the restaurants in Scottsdale, must be a Scottsdale thing.

qFSPEgakq9TYL6QQF5eMhQ.text: Killer taco selection & happy hour.  You can't go wrong with cheap tacos & beer.

frkDu_8-DzKR0lWogJO3aA.text: Came here not knowing what to expect. I don't drink, so the abundance of alcohol (mostly tequila) was not something that enticed me about this establishment. Customers who drink would probably enjoy it more. Pretty cool design inside though. The tacos are pretty good, the rice isn't great, but the black beans are delicious.

K-kkoA8APHrGPxk8RcXHrA.text: Cien Agaves is definitely our favorite Restaurant, we celebrate graduations, baby showers, birthdays Mother's Day and other special occasions there.  You can order anything off the menu and be assured it will be delicious.  We always start off with their perfectly fresh guacamole, Cien Agave's guacamole is soooooo delicious it has the perfect blend of fresh avocado, onion, cilantro and topped with refreshing pomegranate seeds, so mouthwatering.  But our "go to" is the 10 taco platter, you can mix and match any tacos off the menu and you can request your tacos be on soft flour tortillas, my favorites though are the DIABLA SHRIMP, Shrimp sauteed in Guajillo sauce on a bed of Mexican rice, ISLAND SHRIMP,  Beer battered shrimp tossed in their sweet and spicy island sauce on a bed of crispy cabbage. CARNE ASADA, Citrus marinated skirt steak mixed with pico de gallo and topped with homemade guacamole. Of course you wash it down with the perfect habanero margarita, this margarita is the perfect sweet with that kick of the habanero chili chasing, and this is incredibly refreshing.  Cien Agave's has the perfect vibe, a good looking restaurant.

orv4_FHB2InVa91iJ4FjUw.text: Tequila tasting can we taste some tequila next time.. was a fun experience but the tequila wasn't even a half a shot

JDB4GvNdKPwwjk8jaJCy7w.text: Margaritas are to diiiiie for ! Go on margarita monday! They're 50% off. Taco Tuesday is ok except they only have beef on special.   Deina is the BEST. ask for her section! Super nice and on top of her game.   I highly recommend this restaurant !

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_HfmnD95pX904qQxNzJFYg.text: Ok, I think 9 years later is sufficient time to update my review. I've been here a couple of times over the years, but was never really impressed.   Went again last night with a friend. I'm sad to say it just wasn't good. We sat at the bar. We had margaritas, which weren't good. It's supposed to their thing, so I was surprised they haven't evolved over time. It's so easy to get quality, fresh lime margaritas, that I thought they'd be on par with other places in town. They aren't. I've had better at several places including Blanco & CRUjiente Tacos too.   Another odd thing is that the chips weren't good. I can't explain it, but they tasted off for tortilla chips. We also ordered the street corn, but service was spotty the whole time we were there, & we never got it. We finally gave up & asked for the check. It wasn't on there. Nothing says bad service like it even getting your food order. Like they just forgot to even put it in. It's just odd.   Overall, I guess this place appeals to someone, but it sure isn't me. There too many places in town with better margaritas & service.

Nqx7t1McjEK7cLC_zN1EcA.text: So many tequilas so little time!!! Great times!! Awesome margaritas! I highly recommend the Cadillac Margarita!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6UqfqdG8Im0mh3pIZEOcVA.text: Nice place though it can get loud. Very good food and quite popular with locals as well as tourists.

x3Nhw4I_rA4mwewZ6sBXLQ.text: The tacos, the margaritas, the atmosphere, and the service were all awesome!! We especially loved the beer battered mahi mahi taco and the frozen coconut margarita.

DNws4jmlm3Wi0Knp3ffW5g.text: This was our 1st Stop for dinner when we arrived in Scottsdale.  Taco Tuesday and Happy Hour!   We were not disappointed.  Tacos were delishous.  Drinks Outstanding. There is something on the menu that should please all who live Mexican food.

Rn_Ck1wnbPCYmCoLDT5LWA.text: Went here for my sisters birthday and was kinda of disappointed in the place. We had a larger party and our servers were so mixed up and didn't come back for our drinks and forgot to bring out our appetizer.  I'm not one to like spicy food and all the food was extremely spicy to me(personally, others at the table said it was great flavor). However, instead of beans I would totally recommend the corn! Also the prickly pear margarita was delish! Great atmosphere and art. I would like to go back with less people and during happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prickly pear margarita

iidVMSNCpvlTyQ8OM_DIeg.text: If you're a tequila lover like myself, this place is a must! There are so many options on the menu to choose from. Taco Tuesday or Sunday Funday, this is the place to go too!

Sa3_2guOeOKh8njw3PNWRQ.text: ZERO stars; this review is strictly for the server's nastiness. We have a 1yr old and the hostess seated us in a precarious place for his seat, after me asking she said it was fine. Our waiter then greeted us with attitude, and the first thing out of her mouth was that we couldn't have the high chair there, and it needed to be placed in the corner away from the table. Anyone with a kid knows that won't work, so I asked for another table in which she rudely told me they didn't have any. And to top it off the high chair was covered in food and gross. Needless to say we left without eating, and went to our favorite place around the corner, Barrio Queen.  Beware, this place is obviously not kid friendly!

7V8kCbFWMog5OVBkkJ54Sw.text: This place is freaking awesome. Kohl as a waiter was excellent. His recommendations were on point. The Cruz Blanco tequila made an amazing margherita. The tacos from Carne to Tinga to shredded beef were all amazing flavor. The tecate fish taco was so flavorful. The table side guac was one of the best ever.

NnHAtCwyLoOd7Q7wtunQBA.text: One word, AMAZING.  If you're looking for a great experience with amazing food, try this place out.   Almosphere : 10/10 Customer service: 10/10 Food quality: 10/10  We arrived at 1pm and only waited a minute to be seated. Everyone was friendly and the waitress took our order right away.   My girlfriend ordered the shrimp tacos while I ordered the carne asada. Both came out in a timely fashion and were very tasty.   YOU HAVE TO TRY THEIR GUACAMOLE. IT'S TRUELY ON ANOTHER LEVEL.   Pro tip: order the churro Sunday and you won't be dissapointed.   I'll definitely be taking my entire family here in the future as it's now my go to spot in Scottsdale for some amazing and authentic Mexican food.

iCxX6dbV-QBKAAl9S-vFpw.text: The atmosphere of this restaurant is so cool! They have amazing margaritas and I had 3 different tacos there and each one was filled with so much flavor! We really enjoyed the service and the feel in general here is awesome!

3ytY30Adgex1QkH4wL0e0w.text: Their fajita bowls are my fav healthy-ish meal in old town and it's still very tasty! Monday's have great deals as well!

ySqtc__I7fc3fSEtbp9Vmw.text: Absolutely atrocious service, very disappointing. Never again. The chips were soggy, the service attitude was absolutely terrible. We left after 20 minutes, didn't even want to stay.

B2xCIARuxaSeDJ-T_lg7Vw.text: The service is generally good, but the food can sometimes come out slow when it's busy. Despite this, I have returned several times because the tacos are delicious. The Carne Asada and Island Shrimp Tacos are my favorite. The chips and guacamole is my favorite part though! I've never had pomegranates on guac before but it works perfectly! They also have great margaritas! The restaurant itself is a bit small and the tables can feel a bit confined, and it does face some competition with other great Mexican restaurants in town, but Cien Agaves are more than capable of being a top 3 contender.

F1Mley8TyULt0hZOIwCJuA.text: Went to this place on a recommendation from someone who knows one of the owners. This place was fantastic from the atmosphere to the awesome tasting food! Yum yum! The Diablo shrimp burrito was awesome. The chips we received were fresh. They didn't come out ahead of the meal  but  for our first time that was fine with me because we didn't want to fill up on chips. Service was great considering that it was a busy Saturday night. Great place and we plan on coming back!

01yC2qwh_mRSLxqrprxyhA.text: Good traditional food and extra bonus for some unique items. Loved the brussel beet salad.

cnhLpuY6UxICR6FHW-B21Q.text: Ok, so maybe I do things wrong. I start with a place's Happy Hour to see what a venue is like. I have to give the wait staff at Cien Agaves 5 stars. They were awesome, but the experience was less than memorable. They had some issue where they did not have chicken tinga. Coincidentally a Happy Hour item. But then, it took 20 minuets to get guacamole. In the mean time my party ordered a quesadilla with grilled chicken. Guess what?  We had steak instead. I understand the sh** happens, but the management can't make substitutions?   Maybe try it again, but, maybe not

l2IIGee318LIrWVsM7Bocw.text: Went there for cinco de Mayo - very busy but have to say food was good. Guacamole 5 stars! Chimichanga beef was a little dry but flavor was good. Used to refrained beans and rice just as a tag along but not in this plate. Some rice was in chimichanga but still a bit dry-- service was great!

uUK6vcPmv2jjCLGhiP61TQ.text: Stopped in for dinner while visiting Scottsdale with two friends. While the tacos were alright, the guacamole and fajita salad are what earned this place four stars. Additionally, the staff was very kind and we were seated promptly on arrival without a reservation.

h2b79FRIRghJTWDnEKezwQ.text: Was not impressed.  The specialty margs were very pricey for a small glass, but they were tasty. - just small. I ordered a taco with a corn tortilla and it came out with a flour tortilla.  We said something about it and they brought out another one. However, the new one was also with flour. I also ordered a beer and requested a glass. It took 15 minutes to get the glass.  No apologies. And no compensation on the bill. Pretty disappointing.

8JqaLZ223nlsVh3ETBKAQQ.text: Loved this location in old Scottsdale.   Marg options are many!  Cute side patio to sit out on when the weather is cooler.  Have been back a few times.

Vg7kzrq3DyIoPX-wEdiTTA.text: Love this place! Best happy hour deals in the area. Great food and great drinks. Had the new and improved tinga taquitos on my last visit! It's my new fav! Happy to see they stay busy during the summer...

p50kF6EcdtV_64PK9q2hLQ.text: Im no longer a big fan of getting Mexican food since my mom makes the best, and every restaurant is just second best to her. I found this place and made reservations online, since one sister wanted Mexican and the other sister that came along loves tequila I figured it was already a homerun.   Walking in its a very cool little joint. Very colorful and vibrant which I liked, and super clean. We got seated right away and I ordered a Guacamole and our drinks to get us going while we figured out what we wanted. They brought out salsa and the guacamole and chips. I love Salsas and as long as you don't try to get too nuts you can make some of the best just with a few ingredients. Unfortunately, these 2 salsa mild and hot were neither hot nor good... They were very sweet and yugh! The Guacamole was very bland. I feel like they just mashed Avocado with some pomegranate drizzled on top, it needed some lime, cilantro, some salt.. You know the basics!   We got our tacos and yes!!! They were actually pretty damn good. I got 2 shredded beef and 2 carne asad and they were delightful. We asked if they had some salsa in the back that was HOT (which most Mexican restaurants do). They did bring some out and with the chips it was pretty weird tasting, but inside the tacos it was delish! It was super spicy just like I love it.   Last thing that surprised me was the Bill... I have never been charged for salsa... Like ever....... This place charges $1.50 for a small cup of Hot Hot salsa, and we had 2 of them. Its not that I cannot afford 3 dollars its just seriously.... $1.50 Each Salsa!!! I was just surprised by this. I would have gotten it anyway if they would have told me up front its just more that I have never been asked to pay for the chip salsa.... At least it made out Tacos complete.

NtIwpXNEuGp2vGy-7HON5Q.text: The food was great! The margaritas were excellent, and lots of options! They have happy hour until 7pm every day which is awesome! Our server Delaney was the best and gave great service. My new favorite place.

TUkxym1GpYKZq2dwd-25xA.text: Taco Tuesday they have shredded beef tacos $2 can't beat that I love the chorizo cheese crisp to die for

XCSwhSDCtOLwEXQTNVIE5A.text: Best place ever! Street corn is so good! Prickly pear margarita is a must! And the shredded beef in the tacos is marinated to perfection! Can't get enough! Don't get me started on the guac and salsa!

i3pJpsraOXUPOYyLgxwJkg.text: I love the decor, music and food. Its a casual spot with an amazing menu. I love the taco stand menu. The margaritas seem like there isn't any sweet and sour which is awesome because that syrup stuff makes my stomach hurt. The service is always attentive and prompt. I'd say the only area of improvement would be supplying guests with eating utensils. Nothing is worse that getting your food without something to eat it with. Its happened to me almost every time i go.

SwFENH1h7FV6oeyxwb21-w.text: Amazing happy hour deala!! They have happy hour every day from 3-7pm. Half price appetizers & $4 house margaritas!

0FvN8x9Novu8L-DMGHlOCQ.text: The Queso Verde here was pretty good, and given what I've tried, their appetizers in general are up to par. However, the Tinga tacos were not completely cooked, and the corn tortillas were a bizarre consistency (not as soft as flour but not very crunchy either). All in all, definitely not a go-to for Mexican food.

NeprY1iMxmVQzSDzhSDAlA.text: Decent but not great...The shrimp on my Diabla Shrimp taco were cold, but decent flavor. Tinga Taco just OK.  Guacamole was pretty good...but portion should have been larger given price. Rice side dish was pretty bland...and my kids mentioned this too (ok, being from San Diego maybe I'm a little spoiled with some great Mexican food). There is probably better for the money.

y8LgQlD8Kkvpl0LLCdR4uw.text: We just love the taco's here and the House Margaritas are awesome!  Great staff and a great environment.

1rAKXgl8jpXPP6QSLvQnQg.text: Really good tacos and margaritas. I'll be back. The beans were great and the rice was good. Becca was so friendly.

nxv_a1DL5N_xPm9bjv5biA.text: I have came here multiples times and it's always just as good as the last... amazing margaritas, tacos, and nachos... it goes without saying that the Mexican decor and sugar skull accents make for a neat experience!!!!!

IzqCaRUnHWzdYSrKNicRrQ.text: Went here several Sundays ago for a brunch. Gotta say, LOVE love LOVE all of the decor! Think Latin American culture crossed w/gothic shit (i.e. colorful skulls and masks), plus it's before Halloween/Day of the Dead, soo you can see eery blood stained-stickers on the tequila posters in the bathroom. Love that touch!  I ordered the Hangover Burrito (even though I didn't have one). Was not disappointed! It weighed about 2.5 lbs (I swear) and looked like a toddler's leg. I pumped 3 solid meals out of the fried piece of heaven. Had everything AND MORE stuffed inside.  Service was ehhhhh. Maybe the gal was new, but just kind of felt she was bothered by our table and sort of "sneery" tude/vibe coming from her. Dunno but I still gave her decent tip.  Will be back for more fried goodness. Soon.

VZGbWrAWgtor4__qeCnUCQ.text: We went here before a Spring Training game after also finding this place last summer. Good margaritas and price is fair during happy hour for the house marg. The chicken tinga taquitos and crisp on the appetizer were great and for 4 people enough to keep us full for a bit. I wish for HH they maybe took $2 off other full priced margs if you wanted to try some of there more creative concoctions but all in all a fun place. Patio was nice in March!

QBdXsNTQVYNbOPGvplsO7Q.text: Guac, Tacos, and Fajita Bowl were all amazing. Booked an open table reservation and was immediately seated. Our food came out super fast and was delicious, our waitress was really sweet, outdoor seating was nice, and portion sizes were a nice size!

ritykWIijGpmzYzFKWngNw.text: We went during happy hour on a Friday, so it was pretty busy but we were still seated right away. We each had a house margarita (which was half price) and split the nachos (also half price). We probably could have stopped there and been full. We got a burrito and chimichanga as well. They were both amazing! Had to take those home because we were stuffed. The service can be a little slow due to the crowds but the food is great.

hCeuHgsuwhrwvCxcnS8BFA.text: This place is awesome! Love coming here and getting their prickly pear margaritas, they are the best! Service is always pretty quick and friendly as well. Really nice place to stop in Old Town and have a few drinks on a Sunday and hang out on the patio with the misters. Food is incredible, especially their tacos and queso is TO DIE FOR!!

VDXAu4XlCneL3Z76LeBZKg.text: Our go to Mexican place - happy hour every day from 3-7!! Their margaritas are my absolute favorite and their food never disappoints. We love this place!

2oepfVZBvjxdcI5LiMOErw.text: I'm a Mexican food fanatic, and have been having issues finding a place that isn't so BLAH lately. Well, luckily I had the privilege to try out Cien Agave for a promo video we filmed and I was impressed!   First I was able to try out the shrimp ceviche...a-ma-zing. It was so fresh and very light in the citrus. Too many times you get a ceviche that is over-powering in the lime juice, but Cien Agaves' is perfectly refreshing.  Then we were able to try out the shredded beef taco, lobster taco, and the Taco Al Pastor. I'm not usually a shredded beef taco fan, but let me just say that I've been craving it ever since. And what's even better is you can get them for $1 every Tuesday! And the Taco Al Pastor (marinated pork and grilled pineapple) was to die for. Yum yum yum. Can I go now please???  And of course the margaritas...they have reeeeeeeaaaaaaaaalllllllllllllyyyyyyyyyy good margaritas. I enjoyed the award winning house margarita...its a really great classic margarita, where they freshly squeeze the citrus, no pre-made crap in it at all. So good. And the cucumber margarita was amazing.   Cien Agaves is just a really great little treasure in Old Town Scottsdale. They have a great atmosphere and a great staff. Go check them out.

TEpCfpAbflmysOrjvk_v3w.text: Are we getting a few more visitors this year, or are my poor old ears deceiving me?   I think we are getting more visitors, based on the accents I'm hearing and the number of people clogging the entrance to my little lunch spots...reading the menus...gawking around...discussing all of their personal peccadillo's and preferences..."I dinna wanna fookin taco...I wanna go ta the fookin Breakfast Club" :-)  I think they were Scottish tourists, if I'm any judge of kilt's:)...and maybe soccer hooligans, too...although no soccer is being played in Scottsdale right now...spring training hooligans? :-)  I heard all that and more on Taco Tusday at CV, yesterday...an "elderly" lady from Baahstaahn (probably this side of 100, but well north of 90) complaining in a loud voice that the beef tacos were "tooo hawt...spaahcy hawt!"...imagine that...spicy food at a mexican joint:)  After detoxing with a pleasant little 6 miler along the mighty Scottsdale River, my buddy and I decided that we needed a little retox at Cien Agaves to put a spring back in our steps...I had 3 of the darling little $1.00 shredded beef tacos...my buddy had 11...that's right...11...at a sitting...for lunch:-)  He's 30 years younger than I am and he's a professional athlete... I remember the days before my MC4R gene started misbehaving and I could eat like that...damn genetics! :-)  If I did that kind of thing these days, you would need to chain saw out the wall of my home and use a crane to get me out of the house and onto set of "Biggest Loser":)  Yesterday was a nice day for a taco tuesday retox...great weather for the tourists...I heard a number of un-Scottsdale accents, dialects and languages on the street (as befits a tourist mecca like Old Town Scottsdale) and it looked like the turquoise and tee shirts were flying off the shelves so things are starting to pick up again:)  It's put me in such a good mood that I'm even willing to up my rating of CV to a solid 3.5 stars...although I still don't round up...sadly:)

QaIlZCkHfFxay6ZnsjTteA.text: We go here for dinner about 1-2 times a month and decided to have our wedding rehearsal dinner here a couple weeks ago.  There were about 30 of us.  We were impressed, and didn't expect everything to run as smoothly as it did.  Not only was the food fantastic, but the service was exceptional.  Amanda took great care of us, she knew exactly when drinks and food needed to be refilled without reminders.  The tinga tacos were delicious and the chocolate churro tower was amazing!

tI6bNeukjtVNVNfu6JkNjw.text: Outstanding happy hour and fantastic food.  This is a regular place for me and my husband, visiting 1-2 times a week.  The "local" margarita is by far my favorite, not too sweet!  The grilled Ono taco is also my favorite thing on the menu! :)

jADooK_8PVGMjL5935ML3g.text: this place is good, simple and fast. Tuesdays they have deep fried beef tacos for 99 cents so I stay away from here on that night. The Al Pastor tacos are super super gooooooood. I havent ever had a bad thing on this menu. The fish tacos, are nothing special, but still not bad.  The owenrs are always walking around, checking on tables and super nice guys.  Really cool art on the walls

k72gGHDamS2RdSd189z_Gw.text: If they serve tacos and margaritas in heaven, they'll probably be like the tacos here, delicious! The Al Pastor tacos are about as close to authentic as you'll get this side of the border. Great friendly bartender too!

WCbKpZ6yNMHyEyIDejnxZA.text: My office and I have been hitting up Taco Tuesdays for a few month now.  There tacos are good for a dollar but you will have to contend with some HORRIFIC service to get them.

nDV2ijPT-7M5HTpM0FPYQw.text: We were really pleased that we stumbled on to this place. It happened to be happy hour & the prices were very good. For dinner we had a ahi, shrimp, and grilled fish tacos & a chipotle chicken quesadilla. The habenero margarita was delicious and not as hot as I expected. Loved  the up beat atmosphere. We will definitely be back.

TnxznNHKGEhWFsQAUqF-7A.text: Average food, awesome alcohol.  I think my experience here is why I have yet to even attempt the food at bar/restaurant fixtures like Loco Patron or Salty Seniorita.  Maybe Cien Agaves tries to shoot for the restaurant aspect a little more - they might have to with their lack of a patio to rival their competitors.    One thing I've noticed about this place is that it's usually dead except on Taco Tuesday.  There's something charming about eating shredded beef tacos and drinking cans of $2 Tecate with a bunch of affluent white people.  That being said, for a buck the tacos aren't bad and there's live music sometimes which I'm a huge sucker for.  The margaritas are good and strong, which is another of my weak points.  If you don't have to work the next day, I'd also recommend the Tequila Flight, which is $18 for three shots of really good tequila.  Speaking of tequila, they have over 100 kinds!  The only place I've seen come close is El Zocalo in Chandler but I don't think they hit that and they certainly don't have an entire page of a menu devoted to the delicious, cactusy drink.  Skip the food, hit the tequila, and don't plan on making a night out of it because it's often dead.

mGXoFmthfoyl2YX_BvYmNA.text: My brother-in-law had a Groupon for a tequila tasting event Thursday, 9-27.  Great atmosphere with bright colors, Dia de los Muertes theme, luchadors, and sugar skulls.  The tequila event was upstairs and was run well.  Nice to see Roger selling his own wares (Mexican Moonshine)!  Decided to hang out after event and have cigars on the downstairs patio.  I was initially vary of the service from earlier reviews, but our waitress was attentive and made out taco selections for us.  Tacos were fantastic.  The breaded fish was cooked well and not oily.  The carne asada was tender and the guacamole was fresh.  Even on regular hours the price was right.  Definitely a place to go back for during happy hour.  Only giving four starts since I have not tried more on the menu, but that extra star is around the corner!

jSIPZaXDS7eF43BmJXY9HQ.text: Great tequila list, good happy hour/appetizers. Variety of tacos was disappointing.

S_hSxWq0VibF3kf9sVXvEg.text: Taco Tuesdays cannot be beat...$1 shredded beef tacos and $2 Tecates all day!    If you're there on any other day, the food is delicious and in decent proportions.  Aside from having authentic Mexican dishes, the Margaritas are sensational.  This place doesn't cut corners when it comes to making top notch margaritas.  If you are a connoisseur of tequila or just prefer tasty stiff drinks then Cien Agaves is the best place in town!  Definitely try to go on a Tuesday, but if tacos aren't your thing then I suggest the Fajita Salad.

fRHJaiUt7S3Yu4lKEV0Y_Q.text: Just not so great. The tacos were dried out with just meat and cheese. I didn't eat them but the server didn't ask if anything was wrong. Margarita was not great.

VXlSJNWhJKJpeWoMyaRHMw.text: I went into Cien Agave last week because I've heard so much about the margaritas. My server, Anne, gave me an excellent recommendation! She suggested the Cadillac margarita which knocked my socks off it was so good! The food was okay but I would definitely come back for the well crafted margaritas and the fun, perky service! Anne insisted that I try the avocado margarita next time so of course I have to come back!

K9d6yjW0AQx6LT_L3pUdtA.text: Visited on April 28 with a party of 7. Arrived at 7pm and should have paid attention to the fact that the place was only about half full. It wasn't a bad meal, it just wasn't a great one.  Drinks-house margaritas are half price until 7pm. We were able to take advantage of that which was a good thing since they were not very strong.  Food-chips and salsa (green and red) are complimentary, but are not brought to the table automatically, you have to ask. And you have to ask for refills on the salsa. Both salsas were very good, nice and fresh. The red salsa was spicy, which I love.  The chips were sub par in my opinion. Some crunchy, some chewy and tough.   Everyone at our table ordered a variation of the two taco meal. The variety of taco options was very good.  I had a carnitas one and a shredded beef one. Carnitas one was very taste, and I liked that I got the option of a soft corn tortilla instead of flour. The beef taco was served in a special shell, I did not care for it. It was a fried corn tortilla that was a little hard to bite into, and did not have a very good taste.    I love trying New Mexican places when traveling, this one unfortunately was a slight disappointment.

DBJ-iN-lXTyy_INfhUQAJQ.text: An excellent happy hour value - great food and drink options.  I was there after a spring training game and they were slammed with customers. The staff all pitched in to help each other and make what could have been chaos a positive customer experience.

vo1v1lJ-EnWGolGQGXWKig.text: Fajitas!! We were obsessed with everything! Had the Organic Marg, Guacamole app, and shrimp fajitas!!! Husband had the Prickley Pear Marg, pretty looking and yummy as well! Was here a couple weeks ago and will be returning!

Q5uVa1KnscizKKl23MQeeQ.text: So being in AZ for the weekend - I'm for some reason being taken to only taco restaurants.. I'm OK with that... cuz obviously I LUV FOOD!   So Saturday night we pull up to this little spot in Scottsdale to meet up with the rest of the crew and sit and have a drink - I ask the bartender give me your best 2 tacos - so I get the carne asada and the mahi mahi-   The carne asada was delicious, it was tender spicy and just melted in your mouth- i instantly gobbled that one up right away- The girl sitting next to me advised me that the mahi mahi was the best she has ever tried at the restaurant. So i drink my drink and talk with my friends, after about 10 min I decided to dive into this scrumptious mahi mahi taco.. only to be left disappointed- if i wanted to have dessert on top of my dinner i would eat it that way- to say the least i wash left unsatisfied with the taco.   My good friend said here try a little bite of this... it's the lobster taco... i said OK why not..   OMG! The flavors were amazing it was spicy, soft and succulent, and just melted on my tongue.. my tongue actually woke up and my mouth was exploding with flavor! This is what i was waiting for...   This is a good little spot - i would definitely come back again- the service was great! friendly and perfect.   my tummy was happy!

w4FeF64sl9w6z_aYWt33Yg.text: Cien Agaves does not know anything about Mexican food!  The chile verde is bland and the rice was burned!  Also the fish taco was dry and so were the carnitas!  All in all I personally did not like Cien Agaves.   I think if I would have had  a margarita, my review might have been different but I was having lunch on a Friday.  This is typical old town Scotttsdale food that has bad quality and high prices meant for the mid-west tourist that knows nothing about Mexican food.

z2KHOa-ZA_fDZ2j9N6aBjw.text: Two words. Taco Tuesdays. Big night for the carnivores. And even though I'm now a vegetarian, I can still appreciate the beauty (from afar) of a $1 shredded beef taco. And did I mention the $2 Tecates and Dos Equis and $4 house margaritas all night? If your regular happy hour spot is packed, I'd recommend visiting Cien Agaves.   And apparently, each night is devoted to a different taco, with specials all week long. With an entire page of delicious taco options (including some yummy veggie-friendly options), this is your one-stop taco shop.   The chips and salsa are also tasty and plentiful. They bring you both the chunky, mild red salsa, and a slightly spicier tomatillo version. And the chips are reminiscent of those served at Aunt Chiladas, fluffy and delicious!

lfj-I3yPJbu15qGYqyxCLg.text: My family comes here 1-2 times a month but my latest visit was horrible.  Treated poorly by hostesses which they are probably just doing their job the best they can given this reservation rule.   Four tables were OPEN but we were told we could only sit outside due to the inside tables being reserved.  After all these years I never knew they took reservations.  Realize most places like Cien Agave do not take reservations in AZ.  I won't be coming back to Cien Agave as I'm not one to make reservations for a restaurant like this.  Blanco has better food and atmosphere and therefore I'll drive the extra mile to avoid the reservation hassle and lack of tables available.

CveHi8by_AvT8OUT-kXBUg.text: This is a great spot in old town Scottsdale... Particularly if you time it right and get there for happy hour. Even better, taco Tuesday! Nice margaritas, great food, and good service. It is a little busy and loud, but that is testament to the Fine job they are doing... Definitely worth a visit when you are in Scottsdale!

jCr0JI4GmdsuYFzx_tvjsg.text: Have been here a couple times and the service is really quick, place is clean, and food is great! I recommend the green Chile cheese crisp with carnitas!!

-SWJQVm1Y3x-zyYZEnX77Q.text: this place is great! walked in and omg so happy there was a regular parking lot, spaces in front of bar. i come from the east valley (where we have parking lots and dont pay to park) so i hate having to find parking garages and parking meters in scottsdale or phx cuz im used to hassle free parking. this place had hassle free upfront free 3-hour parking. Food was delicious, server (Danielle) was efficient, quick, checked on me a lot, friendly and a great server. food was tasty, hot and great they had wonderful proportions, server was fully knowledgeable about menu, poured&served perfect cadillac margaritas i asked for. other customers were friendly and chatted with me. 100% will be coming back next time im in old town which is often :)

5ISge8dyo2U-QltRVsHVEw.text: Go here for happy hour! They have the best chicken Tonga taco you'll ever have! Their guacamole is a dream too. I've had their bowls, nachos, and drinks too which never disappoint. So yummy! This place is always a win!

Wv78GC6JARDz6yY8HDbP4Q.text: Food was excellent, a little pricey but delicious. The service was adequate, nothing to write home about either good or bad, but that's ok. I would probably go back again next time I'm in Scottsdale, although it's been about 15 years since I was last there so it probably won't be anytime soon.

zAjjZ5KcLR2uFRPcytzqnQ.text: This place is fantastic. We came here to celebrate a birthday party and were able to reserve the entire top floor of the restaurant. Everyone loved the margaritas, but if you want to get a bit more bold, try the beer-garita.   When I came, I was starving and the chips and salsa were seriously incredible. I really love the salsa Verde, and everyone around me loved the salsa roja.  Despite my hunger, I wanted to have something a bit on the lighter and cheaper side. The fajita bowl fit the bill and was a great mix of vegetables, rice, beans and cheese. Nothing too fancy but still great.   The waitresses were super nice and with such a large group, handled us really well. Definitely check this place out if you're in old Towne and looking for some quality eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enchiladas
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fajita bowl

aazcTlZYBxOiORJd3nAD8Q.text: Went in for a late lunch. Service by Nathan S was impeccable, patio seating was welcoming, and the food was better than expected seeing that this was a touristy area. I ordered the nachos w a side of guacamole first. Guacamole was great but the nachos were flavorful and fabulous without it. For my entree I had the three taco plate. Really enjoyed the cheese retried beans and the shredded chicken and shredded beef tacos were really really good! Bonus points for that crispy flaky shell. Would definitely recommend & would not hesitate to come back the next time I'm in Scottsdale

38XBsi0EQRyO3WatmN54gQ.text: Easily the best bang for your buck happy hour in Scottsdale. Great atmosphere and unreal food.

KSc537p2Zl0SjVxAhD8Dsg.text: Wait staff was super friendly.  My drink and the food came out not long after I ordered.  Kudos to the wait and kitchen staff.  And nice ambiance.    Needs improvement:  Personal preference, I prefer my guacamole to have more texture.  It had the consistency of lumpy pudding.  But the flavor was okay.  Thank you for not over-salting it.  The pomegranate seeds were a nice touch.  To improve, I would recommend showcasing the ingredients with a medium dice of the avocado,  small dice of tomato, minced garlic, and chiffonade the cilantro.  Maybe a dash of Tajin Clasico seasoning or a light chipotle powder dusting to make it your own.  It can still be creamy by folding the aforementioned ingredients with a little dollop of what you have now.  Like...4:1 ratio.  For me texture helps make a dish like this.  The fried Fish taco needs something wet to balance the dry slaw and fish.  I recommend a lime tartar sauce.  At second look on the menu, I think the Baja sauce was accidentally left off my taco.  Too bad because that certainly would have helped.  The good:  I enjoyed the Skinny Margarita and the Shredded Beef taco.  There's nice variety on the menu so I probably won't order either again.  I want to try something new.  They have something for everyone here.

CuGkQechzAzvngIPqo-0iA.text: Cien Agaves is one of my favorite places to go in the Old Town Scottsdale area, and definitely stands out to me as one of the best spots to go to for Mexican food and tacos :) the service has always been great, and it's in a great location -- just a little bit off the main Scottsdale road.  As for the food, I can't say enough good things! They actually offer complimentary chips and salsa (I don't think enough places do anymore), and the salsa is delicious! Their Queso Verde appetizer is a must-have as well, my boyfriend and I tried it our first time here, and we have never not ordered it since. We love queso in general, but the slow roasted green chile pork they add is amazing :)   I will say that the tacos here are a bit expensive, most are $4-$5 each. They're much better quality here than most taco places though, and are served with a ton of meat and cheese, not just filled with lettuce. My boyfriend and I have tried a ton of different ones, and they've all been really good. I also really like to order the Fajita Bowl with Chicken, I think this is the best way to get a lot for your money. The bowl is only $7 and comes with a ton of rice and veggies, and it's only $2-$5 to add meat.   I definitely recommend trying this place if you're looking for Mexican food! Happy hour lasts till 7 which is nice for after work, and there's a ton of free parking. If you can't find a space right in front, there's a huge public lot not too far down the street.

Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fajita bowl with chicken

EQo4Fcc1G1b1eRfcgvQ_Eg.text: Some friends and I came in wanting margaritas Friday late afternoon (7/19/19) and sat at the bar. The restaurant was not busy and there was only a handful of people at the bar. The bartender(didn't catch her name) literally was doing side work as we sat for a good 8 minutes before she finally acknowledged us from a distance saying "I'll be with you soon." When guests sit at a bar, your first gesture as a bartender should be greeting them with a simple "Hello, how are you?" and if you're busy a simple "I'll be with you in a minute but hey here's a menu to look at". Maybe she was busy doing whatever she was doing, but you shouldn't leave customers sitting and waiting to be acknowledged while we clearly see her ignoring us. We didn't have the patience to wait for her any longer so we walked out. The hostess asked if we were leaving on the way out out and we said "Yes", and she asked "Why?" And we replied "Your bartender sucks". Well, she did so we got our cocktail fix across the way at Hula's Modern Tika and got greeted and served right away. What a concept! 2 stars, because the food looked good and at least the hostess greeted us. Thank you hostess.

3nlcSmZ0FrIJpEURoXLE4g.text: Amazing margaritas and amazing tacos!! The happy hour prices are so good and the service was great! Both times that I dined there I ate outside. They keep the outdoor seating comfortable with fans so you can enjoy the sun but not be too hot!

vugHurBRDsW6x5TL5looSw.text: Gave us the complete wrong order, called to see if we could possibly pick up the correct order. The manager Christina proceeded to be rude and said she had to ask (and promised to call me right back). I waited 20 minutes before I had to call her back and she said there was nothing she could do. I proceeded to ask if there could be some sort of compensation since we give them our business all of the time.. She told me she was busy doing waitress checkouts and there's nothing she could do. Awful management. My friends and family will no longer be using this establishment for Mexican fare. You've lost a loyal and patient customer.

phUlWkm1_G89wFMo8hUa8Q.text: This is a good tex-mex restaurant! They have a cute environment and a patio area. I got the chicken tostadas and they were more sweet than spicy. Still very good though!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

v56LDrsB_ABQIXtUTguwhg.text: Stopped in for a quick drink and grabbed a 50% off appetizer chicken nachos, which hit spot for the finger food while you enjoyed a beer. Micheal Ann (or michealina) was a great bartender. She took the time to give me a tequila education, so I was more than happy to try a couple other selections. I could see this place getting very busy, so I'm glad I hit it up around 4(ish). From my lack of knowledge I'll definitely have to do research or simply come back for the in-house Ciene Agave education!

jUpGsnKBnexWJlfm2lC0aw.text: Toco Tuesday was amazing! $2 shredded beef tacos were incredible! Highly recommend for every tax Tuesday for the rest of my life Hahahaha but seriously great food!

euFu5xAvvbaYR2lrdN2aBA.text: I went for taco Tuesday around 7 pm, just a 10 minute wait. Taco Tuesday deals included $3 beef tacos, $5 pineapple tequila shots and $3 Tecate beers. It was good food and a nice outdoor seating atmosphere!

p3h8V8i4rk3sNCzZuvJPtA.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant that I have EVER been to. The chicken enchiladas were to die for. The service was amazing and the atmosphere was extremely pleasant. Will definitely be back!

zqusCAZ6j5d3Vr7_QJfoiw.text: We had a green chile cheese crisp and the guacamole with pom seeds and those were great! I also got the poblano soup which was ridiculously tasty and nice and spicy, and my friend got a chicken tinga taco which she said was great. Even the lemonade was delicious. The red salsa was yummy as well, but the green was way too heavy on the cumin and tasted like a dude's armpit. The service was efficient, friendly, and cheerful. I imagine it would be too loud at peak hours but it was just before the rush and was moderate when we were there. I want more of everything now!

urjgaAI-leXgHLP2hD28XQ.text: I got the carnita burrito that was huge. It could have had more meat inside but it was still good. The salsa is tasty as well. My buddy got three tacos and said it was really good. The atmosphere is great as well.

rJYRtk6uIqowQxU1VzvIdA.text: One of the best tequila bars in around! The food is amazing, service is fast, and the drinks and margaritas are BOMB. Bartenders are always quick and friendly , with the best handmade margs ever. More selection of tequila than anywhere around!

e1IQrPJssHx4Z-eBk7vC3w.text: Shrimp and steak fajita was a good portion and tasty. Happy hour from 4-6:30 7 days a week is great w half off appetizers. We got the guacamole and ceviche... both were very good.

ql_V3aV32habHdzpZWEmTw.text: Taco Tuesday, half off appetizers and Cien Agave Margarita. Food was really good. The hostesses were not very friendly or helpful but once we got to a table it was worth the hassle. Tingas tacos, beef tacos, tostada and guacamole. YUM!!

cTssANBRirAjGJVgGITXEg.text: Great food, happy and helpful staff and fantastic happy hour prices! A must see anytime you're in Old Town Scottsdale!

yHj5kW-U6LzQrDF028IZew.text: March 2018:  GREAT PLACE ... we were there on a Monday night and got seated with no wait (and they were busy).  We ordered margaritas and a beer-rita, a margarita with a beer in it (it was good and only $6 on Monday's).  We all ordered the shrimp tacos ($3 each on Monday's), four shrimp in each taco .... GREAT ... but watch out for the Sauce ... HOT.  Great service and good food.  Try it, you'll like it.

JY58T-kat-Sp3JlvL8sm9w.text: Amazing food and awesome happy hour. If you're looking for somewhere relaxed and trying to have a fun time with some good foo, this is your place !
