aXQRlhlP0Agy-Ad0i7OtWQ.text: This was disappointing.   Service was very slow.   The food mediocre.   The "steak" burrito had a lot of rice.  But there was very little meat.   The street corn is served cold.  I wouldn't ever come back here again.

WsBCBt38TJiWUFWaS5eYWA.text: OMG the happy hour special is great, and their tacos are DELICIOUS!  Not to mention the tequila selection.  KILLER shrimp taco.  I could have eaten my weight in those suckers!  Nice service.  Its dark but spacious.  Nice place for a quick meal and some venom...

fy00n8XGA-J4Zvjg8dW5Dg.text: A very cute Mexican Restaurant.   The service was great, had a great waitress. What we really loved was that I asked for her to charge our phone and she brought a portable charger to our table (A - M - A - Z - I - N - G).   We really enjoyed the Guac, which had pomegranate seeds on top .... So delicious.   I had the chicken fajitas .... which had a good flavor but a bit burn :(   But the food was pretty good.

alNDQdSbsL5oOK9GZsSD_w.text: Please give this restaurant a try. You will not be disappointed. I had the Mahi-mahi Burrito Bowl and it was delicious. Try The Local and The Cadillac Margaritas. Siobhan B. Is a great waitress. She was nice and made great food and drink recommendations. It's good

QqEUVMDUWOv4d78R29xH8Q.text: I had my first Coronarita here any OMG it was sooooo good.  So good.  Now it was 115 degrees outside so that may have had something to do with it.  Our table loved the variety of margarita flavors, including the avocado flavor.  The chips and queso were outstanding, and my carnitas burrito was very flavorful albeit a little on the dry side, even though it was enchilada style.  We had a really fun time here, group of 7, recommend it.  It's not fast, don't come here if you're in a rush.

R5obyxh2UaZlh7NCAC_m1w.text: I found this place on Yelp when I typed in "Mexican Food" when we got into Scottsdale after our flight from KC.    To start - the margaritas were quite good! The BF ordered the Cadillac and I had the skinny margarita but added strawberries to it.  Both were delish.  We started with the chorizo cheese crisp and it was HUGE. So good though! I had a carne asada taco along with a side of rice for dinner and the BF had the pork tacos. We loved everything.  It was a little pricey but I guess that's what you get for having 3 margs on your bill! We'd come back though!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huge margs! We were excited to be in Arizona :)
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chorizo cheese crisp. As big as a pizza!

RMPnDm8CQ-GgHqjANDKe6g.text: Being a Mexican I love me some tequila and mezcal and margaritas. I've seen cien agaves on my yelp a few times so after the crushbrew fest this spot was walking distance I figured it was the right time. The place is small and super cool with all the decorations and paintings on the walls it definitely catches your eyes so I was stoked to try the food and drinks. The salsas are bomb specially the Red ill give that 5 stars. The food I was disappointed big time. The carnitas were dry and were not carnitas they were more of a machaca dried shredded beef and was way salty. The beans and rice were ok. The drinks again disappointed the margaritas were very sour and watered down,no wayyyyy these are the best or even close. The service was good, amy was friendly and did a great job but, food wise and drinks they were below standards. I think just because they are in old town they have a good rep but there's a lot better and more authentic Mexican food and drinks in 90 percent of phx or scottsdale and cheaper. A lot of hype and not enough substance.

qyEFwLLJrpIO42GF2sWi1A.text: I went on a Thursday evening with family around 7:15 pm.  We had a fairly large group (about 25 people).    Cool atmosphere and the server was nice, however the service was very SLOW.  I had to ask 3-4 times for water before I received it.  It would have helped it there were more servers assigned to our group.  The food was decent. I liked the chips and salsa. For an entree I had a fish taco on a flour tortilla, it was fried fish (just ok).  I asked for extra sauce and that made it better.  I also had an ahi tuna taco on a flour tortilla, that was also good once I added the extra sauce.  My husband and I both ordered a house margarita, it was good.  I think the entire meal from start to finish ended up taking about 3 hours.  I really wanted to try the flan but since it took so long to get the meal, I was sleepy and ready to leave. Even getting our bill took longer than expected.

TYdP-MT_pyEgy8UgYv2kbA.text: Possibly the best taco place in the Valley. I was really impressed with the variety of sauces, of which I know I like the beet one the best. Definitely coming back!

L7EpWmUaCdZ_Ztrhnwaz7A.text: Definitely a MUST try! Great service! Awesome HH from 3-7 with half off apps and hours margaritas. Join me next time!

2RCtK-RKdvfSX7mWh19xtw.text: Outstanding taco's and tequila here!  They have over 100 brands of tequila and some of the best taco's I've had in a long long time.  I kind of expected it to be good, but not amazing, but I was wrong.  The food was way better than I expected.    I tried 3 different taco's from the 13 they offered, and all 3 were incredibly good.  The free chips and salsa were very good.  They had 2 different salsa's as well, the red was very good, but the green salsa was just incredible.  The bartender said the red just recently won a "Best Salsa in Phoenix" award from someone, but I was way more impressed with the green salsa (which I almost didnt try, as just by looking at it, you wouldnt think it would be good).  Pretty friendly environment inside and great staff.    I went for lunch, but it seems like it would get pretty busy for the bar crowd after dinner on the weekends, especially being right next to Patty's 1st Avenue Lounge.  Definitely a cool hangout, and a little nicer on the inside than I expected at least in terms of the tables, but then the booths and the bar seemed like more chill areas and more casual for sure.    I hope this place makes it and stays a long time.  They could use another TV or two in the bar area (at least downstairs), but thats hardly a complaint.  I was very impressed overall.  Definitely worth your time to go check out.

wfZA2fsAzKyV1hbQpPO_Mg.text: NIce afterwork spot. Went here to watch the NBA finals. Great margaritas and had the seafood enchilada, which came out great. The servers were attentive as well. The crowd skews a little young for the area, but then again its old town Scottsdale, so there was the obligatory 50-year old playboy sprinkled with a spat or two retirees.

ObjwisKjnvj0e03DhrTr9w.text: We are from Portland, Oregon and spent a week in Scottsdale during December 2013.  Of the 7 nights we dinned out, we went to Cien Agaves 4 nights.  Everything is absolutely excellent- including the service, prices and especially the quality of the food and drinks (the Happy Hour food menu and drinks are fantastic!).   The atmosphere and seating offer something for everyone.  Indoors for the music and energy, outdoors for the wonderful desert air and a little more quiet while enjoying the warm heaters.  My only regret:  that Cien Agaves is not in my own city!  Check it out, you won't be disappointed!

SZ_3A_1NwivHt7wdLY4DhA.text: Looking for amazing flavor, this is the place. Great food amazing prices and large portions. Their pico is amazing. Great place to eat! Really good salsa also. Try it. You will Like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Main lobby area

9sba6u1FhhHD_uICeRYFOQ.text: Ordered:  al pastor, shredded beef & carne asada (& churro sundae) A+ for all 3!  The pineapple in the al pator blended great with the smokey taste of the pork.  Both beef tacos were superb.  We wanted to try the spicy shrimp one, but decided to save room for the CHURRO sundae : ) YUM! and good thing we did - it was excellent! BF liked the green sauce more, it was sweeter.  On the flip side I preferred the red sauce - it was a bit spicier, and a real treat since I normally ALWAYS prefer green salsa. Also got the grilled corn which was a bit of a let down - it seemed boiled, not grilled, but oh well.  They have lots of specials and if it were later on the evening (as opposed to the early lunch when we were there) we probably would have sampled some of their tequilas/margaritas. Would definitely go back/recommend. Service was great too - no complaints!

Iw52Zzzu4fsGzz8gOKXKCQ.text: The tacos are outstanding! Especially the carnitas - just a little heavy handed on the cilantro though.  Came for lunch so didn't get to try their yummy sounding margs sadly. Next time! Good and friendly service as well. Great atmosphere and clean.

BWGCYzlw79RZi9giK9RBZQ.text: Katrina L and I dined at the very same table and her dead-on coverage of Cien Agaves' strengths (recessionista-friendly) and weaknesses (atmosphere, "margs") has tempted me to chime in. The vibe here is pretty blah. If they invested a little in some art/curtains/less bright lights, I think this place could be considered a fun date place, as opposed to a destination for a grande groups.  Maybe my time back on the East Coast has made me desperate for any kind of edible Mexican, but I did enjoy the food. The queso was a huge hit (turns out chorizo in melted cheese can change lives) and the dos tacos especial (2 tacos- you can mix and match any from the menu + rice + beans = $8.95) made the menu muy caliente to me.

hYBx2WB0dc-97wJIG1OzSw.text: I have been eating here for about 3 years and there is one thing that keeps bringing me back. The Tinga Taco.   The tinga is the single best taco I have ever had. Shredded marinated chicken thrown into a crispy shell then the whole thing deep fried. Throw in there fantastic chips and salsas and you got my favorite place to go in the valley for tacos.

DH9MvKsiN9q9cLBsXWz-1g.text: I've been here twice now, once for a birthday and once for a date night, and been impressed both times.  I've tried their house margarita and their hibicus margarita - both were very good, but there really wasn't much of a difference in taste.  They have a great variety of tacos on the menu for about 4 bucks each.  Their fish tacos are delicious.  They have a 2 taco combo with rice and beans for I think 8.95.  I've come on a weekend night both times, and both times the place was pretty empty.  I'm not sure why!  They've got a great selection of drinks and this would be a fun place to get a night out in Old Town started.  I will definitely come back!

ywgjW4nI3MXMw_8086xs1w.text: Decent food and service..did a tequila tasting and the vendors were extremely stingy..maybe next time they ask the vendors to give at least half an ounce?  I'll give them one more chance..

pMBeVmbJyL9FNSChnMG6yA.text: Went to dinner for the first time over halloween weekend. Our server was great! She was very attentive, knowledgable, and fast. The tacos were rather spicy. With all the Halloween dressed individuals, the service was still great, and I will definitely be back!

26fYTsJiAztlPaYk6oebww.text: My wife and I chose Cien Agaves for lunch during our visit to Old Town Scottsdale.  We found it was a great spot for lunch.  I found the interior very bar-like and pretty loud but that's fine for lunch.    I was really impressed by their tequila selection and we had two fabulous margaritas during lunch.  My wife absolutely loved the cucumber margarita.  I was a bit skeptical but I did enjoy it.  Especially considering it was 108 outside!     The ceviche was really tasty but the shrimp could have been cut up smaller.  It kept falling off our chips and was much larger than the rest of the ceviche.  We had three different tacos and all were really good and not your typical fare.  I'd say the Taco al Pastor was my favorite but my wife really enjoyed the veggie tacos with the sauteed veggies for the filling.  The other thing to note about the tacos was that there were at least 10 different types.  I wanted to try them all out (just like the margaritas) but that'll have to wait for another time.  Don't know how this place would do for dinner.  I'd highly recommend it for the margaritas and the tacos were good but it's more of a casual place.  The price also seemed okay considering how good the margaritas were but it's not cheap.  We spent $50 for 2 margaritas, 3 tacos and the ceviche.  We had good tequila in the margs so there were in the $9-11 range.  We would definitely come again.

HExCoQ6JJp2CTD2w5Tkt0g.text: This place is definitely 5 Star's.  Traditional Mexican food with your average atmosphere seems to be the standard here in the valley.  Cien Agaves goes above and beyond and really doesn't even compare.  Their taco's are amazing!  Except for a few apps, I haven't even tried anything else that's how good their tacos are!!  Their fresh squeezed lime Margarita's are mouth watering.  Atmosphere and Service were both top of the line.  Trust me... I'm a native of AZ and have been to many Mexican Food Restaurants... GO TO CIEN AGAVES!!!  You wont regret it!

rYfurI0Ucc4NOp4cbjb6GQ.text: The food was good, the wait staff very attentive and a big flirty (good thing!), but they have over cien tequilas! The diablo came robes was very good....spiccccccy!

gAqxr7OXy6uL_pVpTBmbZA.text: I really wanted to love this place.  I am really not trying to bash Cien Agaves, but I do hope this review will be looked at by the establishment and make improvements.  I attended the tequila tasting last night and decided to eat here.  I'll give a pass on the drinks. The service and food were NOT good.  Our waiter/server was not attentive as he should have been.  The place was not busy and there was not clear reason for the lack of service.  He practically snatched the menu out of my boyfriend's hands.  I ordered the Chile Relleno with rice and beans. The beans tasted like they were from a can. The rice was dry and flavorless.  The chile relleno was not fresh. My boyfriend ordered tacos and the tortillas were cold, not impressed.

TiQDw0xmeETnsLWfbpl7NA.text: I have just moved to the area, and was looking for a place to grab a bite to eat.  I was strolling around old town and came across Cien Agaves, and I'm glad I did.  I sat at the bar and the bartender was great, quick service and friendly.  I grabbed the menu and began to peruse the menu.  I saw that they offered many types of tacos and you could do a mix and match of the many different types.  I thought that this was awesome.  I selected Island Shrimp Taco, the Carnitas and the Carne Asada.  I really enjoyed all of them especially the shrimp and carne.  The Carnitas was a little dry, but oh well.  I'll definitely be back and with the many different choice, I look forward to making my way through the taco stand.

gwhTuJztNfS10df8XI1LmQ.text: I like this place. It has a good feel and delicious margaritas. If I were back in Old Town, I might stop by. But I am sure every neighborhood has their own margarita spot that is quite similar. There is no reason to drive for miles to get here.

IvYSRYPXMNGZehxnertRUA.text: Great tacos, especially the carne asada.  Took advantage of the happy hour specials, half off.  Great atmosphere, highly recommend!

oe0PQLGOw0TI-TG15Gw7vg.text: My Husband and I were here a couple of weeks ago.  It was 8:00pm on a Friday night and the place was pretty empty, maybe two or three tables were occupied.    We were there with another couple and ordered several margaritas, their combination platter and a side of guajillo mashed potatoes.  We ordered several different tacos, but the ones I was interested were the Camarones a la Diabla and the Fresh Lobster tacos.  The shrimp was WAY too spicy to enjoy.  I like a lot of heat in my food, but not when it overwhelms everything else.  On the other hand, the lobster and jimaca was bland and lackluster.  I would have to say their selection of tequilas are nice.  I had their Cucumber Margarita and it was very cool and refreshing.  We may come back if I get a hankering for margaritas, if nothing else.  Also, I thought we would be in for an inexpensive night, but I guess with the combo platter, four margaritas and a couple of beers, it came out to be just over $80 a couple.

iAzA8ia74cEF3LZBfZXN4g.text: My girlfriend and I love CA.....but have a problem w staff that has an attitude especially Bartenders! This issue has surfaced quite a bit lately and overlooking it has become more difficult.  Hopefully mgmt. can see an opportunity to heighten the experience by finding people who enjoy their job BAR TENDING!

S9_MagYytqPFdyQti7ZGAA.text: I went here for lunch on Taco Tuesday for the $1.50 shredded beef tacos and they were delicious! I will definitely be going back for future Taco Tuesday deals

lvPHrIVM9pYIb513dz-iLA.text: Great place in Old Town Scottsdale!  The food is great, the service is good and it is in a good location!

C13kMYi9O-GSEUHD6guFHQ.text: Came here to try something new. Maybe we should have stuck to our favorites. The water they serve here tastes like it came out of a garden hose, no amount of lemon could save it. After ordering drinks, we waiting what seemed to be a lifetime for the waitress to come back to ask questions about the menu and order. My bf ordered the shrimps tacos but got fish tacos. He ate what he continued to eat them because the waitress never came back to check on the food. He thought they were the worst tacos he had ever had. He did not finish them. Something had got to be pretty bad for him to leave food on his plate. The only time I would ever come back here would be for happy hour but even then probably not.

ylkJqmbHanOcEBTMJGAUyw.text: Hibiscus margaritas...oh how I love you!! Haha   So I was in Scottsdale last weekend, visiting friends and going to the Interpol concert Saturday night. My friend Chantage and I arrived in Scottsdale early afternoon and were immediately whisked away by our friends to Cien Agaves for margaritas and tacos. (I have the best friends in the world!) With so many margarita choices, yes, it was hard to narrow it down to one to start with. But the hibiscus is my favorite flower, so why not try a hibiscus margarita?? Yum, yum and more yum!! And they were in very generous glasses, too! I want one right now and it's only 11am! On the second margarita, we decided to order some tacos. Again, the choices...uh, I wanted them all! But I opted for the Dos Tacos Especial which was my choice of two tacos, beans and rice. I love mahi mahi, so that's what I ordered. Fabulousness, I tell ya! The mahi mahi was grilled to perfection, the beans were smoky and woody but the rice, eh, was okay. Not my favorite. The third hisbiscus margarita made up for it, though! My friends had seared ahi tuna tacos, lobster tacos and carnitas tacos which by the sounds of their 'mmm's and 'ohh's' I can tell you were just as awesome as my mahi mahi tacos!  Our bartender, Blair, was cute, friendly and funny. I hope he enjoyed serving us as much as we enjoyed him! We'll be back to see him (and try other tacos and margaritas) again soon...thanks, Blair! :)

zQCOdoFAvZCVjWz3IObhxg.text: The food was reasonably good but not good enough to prompt us to return. This restaurant's location make it a tourist eatery; we felt rushed through our meal. We ordered guac and chips and drinks to start, 5 mins later ordered dinner. The drinks & guac/chips (which were good) arrive 15 mins after we placed the order & our dinner (which was fair) arrived 2 mins after that. There was barely room on the table for the food, but what was more disappointing is we sensed the restaurant/server was more interested in quick table turnovers. She didn't even ask if we wanted dessert, but just brought out the bill. There are plenty of other Mex-themed restaurants in this city; the food here is not that special. This is not the place to chill and chat.

TWrUDjstBIml4CqfqL-R7w.text: I love the atmosphere in this restaurant but I think the food is pretty bland.  I've been here twice, I tried the big ass burrito with chicken and the carne asada tacos, I've had better though.  I do like their margaritas though especially the happy hour $3.50 margarita, you get the bang for your buck with the drinks.

X0A1ZbbHkb0fGTXNOXndMw.text: This place is a good spot for happy hour.  Tuesdays are taco Tuesdays, so you can eat for a reasonable price for the entire family.  Service isn't the greatest, but overall, it is a place that we would return to.

fQUOvF9RKimwU7HujgOdqg.text: Highly recommend. Great drinks and tacos.

OYLuO3IKNRCjkwpsAXX8cQ.text: We came here with the local recommendation of our hotel concierge. Good place to get tequila with delicious tacos, he said. We came during lunch on Saturday so no happy hour and no drinks to vouch for.   We ordered the Pollo Asada Burrito and Tres Tacos combo. The burrito was good, not spectacular in the marinade. They kinda went light on the cheese and guac, but the black beans were delicious. For the tacos- we ordered Lobster, Mahi mahi, and shrimp. The shrimp tacos were my favorite. Extremely flavorful, and cooked perfectly. This place can add a little more lobster to the taco, and the mahi mahi was okay.  The service was quick and all the ladies were very nice. Food was mediocre though.

HsBsmYdl9X3S5f_rK2WcEg.text: Holy Tequila!  Luv the margaritas here!  House margaritas are the best.  I highly recommend the Cucumber margarita!  Its cool and refreshing with the perfect amount of tequila.  Great drink for the hot AZ summer!  Tinga tacos are my absolutely favorite.  Great crunchy chicken taco!  Great place in OT for some awesome food and drinks.  This is one of the best happy hour locations in town!

f9LNZIThWxbda6DhLYTeGQ.text: Horrible!! The food was gross, and after bringing me the wrong item twice the server didn't even offer to take my meal off the tab. We were the only table in there and the server messed up everyone else's order too. When it was time to pay he got every bodies tab wrong, he handed me my tab at 8:00 and then grabbed it out of my hand. By the time I payed it was 8:30 and I'm sure it was the wrong amount but by that time I just wanted to leave. Also they brought the birthday girl her cake after most if the party left.

Kcd4FCoWtkYinyPGpgvHYQ.text: solid tacos i love coming here on taco Tuesday for taco deals.  Great hard beef tacos for cheap

X7aRfrG6Fvwxh0o5NyXCEQ.text: This is actually a 2 1/2 star review. Visited for lunch on  9/15/15 after looking at the menu and restaurant reviews on Yelp and Trip Advisor. We live in Payson and the Mexican restaurants up here are pretty bad. Unfortunately, Cien Agaves was disappointing. The restaurant is kind of a Mexican Steampunk decor but we liked it well enough. We found a high-top table & server arrived in a minute or two &  asked what we wanted to drink. I asked for a minute to look at the menu. She walked away without a word. We placed our drink order....a house Margarita for me. She never asked, or provided,  any Chips & Salsa...so I had to ask for them. They have a great selection of Margaritas and tequilas as well as types of tacos. I ordered the 3 taco platter....Shredded Beef, Shrimp Taco and a Fried Fish Taco on corn tortillas...the Fish in the taco was flavorless...needed salt. The cabbage in the tacos was plain old cabbage,, not dressed with anything, bland but I liked the sauce on the Fish Taco. I couldn't eat the Shrimp Taco...just too spicy and the shrimp were just small, frozen shrimp...nothing spectular. The Shredded Beef on the taco was hard, dry and stringy...inedible. I think the Kahlua flan was old. It was way too firm...not creamy and light but I liked the flavor of it. The Green Salsa was enjoyable but the Red Salsa was too watery and too spicy for me. The House Margarita was good but needed just a bit more sweetness.. Our server was unfriendly and spent more time in the kitchen than tending to her customers. Twice I  had to ask another server to find our server...she seemed totally disinterested in providing a good experience to customers. Unlikely to return or refer anyone to Cien Agaves...

KvEI0ZjF1xP0fHOEg8RAFw.text: The food at Cien Agaves is really good.  I had the ceviche, which, despite containing shrimp as the only seafood, was really well seasoned; and I also had the ahi tuna tacos, which were delicious and filling.  However, I only gave 3 stars because the drinks were not that great.  I had a strawberry mojito and a mango margarita, and neither was memorable.

zfUMQMUwRy_JBwFNGNIIsg.text: I went to taco Tueday last night and started off with a house margarita for half price during happy hour. ($4)  It was very fresh and tart you could tell they didnt use sweet and sour, which is a good thing.  I ordered 2 shredded beef tacos and the Guacamole. The apps are half off also during happy hr which is till 6 pm.  The tortilla chips are A-Maz-Ing, delish.. the red salsa is pretty fab too. The guac is a NO WAY JOSE'. Doesn't taste like fresh avocados, tastes like processed green mush. the tacos were decent they come with shredded cabbage, cheese, sour cream and shredded beef for 1.50 each on Tues all night. I prob wont return didnt really make that great of an impression.

e1nw7DCBUfQ0Sp9-pyp5yA.text: Great place for grabbing a taco in the center of old town. Cool art on the walls, not very expensive and figgen bangin tacos. I've had about 5 different ones and was not dissapointed in any- including the seafood ones which the majority were. Impressive, since we are no where near an ocean and the fish was grilled. I hear the margaritas are weak, which may or may not be a good thing depending. Would totally recommend it, especially since its next to one of my favorite bars, Patty's pub.

0fQB5M2Y6O2eM0pgj4P_WA.text: Heard they had the best tacos in Scottsdale. They were good - not great, but good. Great selection/choices. Chips-salsa weren't impressive (though the red salsa was noticeably better than the tomatillo). Tried 5 different tacos between 2 of us and found them to be just OK/good.

QasYIBcq92mXk2qM7t4z7g.text: Friendly, airy place. Modest menu, ok quality, spotty service, ok prices according to the people I was with. LOUD. I mean LOUD. Don't go there if you want to have a conversation.

bnU2g0hN8v2_lBC_78_aMQ.text: I was introduced to this place by Groupon, and couldn't say no because I am such a big fan of Margaritas. It was a great place for lunch with some friends. It's probably great for dinner with a few friends, too. Service was okay, not spectacular but acceptable. I wouldn't recommend walking in with a large group unless you called ahead (if you can) because they don't seem like they could quickly get stuff situated for you.  I had a breaded lobster taco, shredded beef taco, and Prickly Pear Margarita. My friend had the same, but with a POM-rita instead of the Prickly Pear Margarita. All the Margaritas here are made with fresh ingredients (fresh-squeezed limes, etc.) and not some mixes that have been sitting in bottles in the fridge forever. I honestly like the POM-rita better than the Prickly Pear Margarita, but they were both very good and quite large. However, the Margaritas are really expensive. I would recommend coming during happy hour because they are all half-price during happy hour. Plus, appetizers are half-price then, too. And on Mondays, the house margarita is only $3.00 ALL DAY long. I'll definitely be back for some happy hour margaritas and on a Monday off. As for the Tacos, the breaded lobster taco was really disappointing. The sauce they put on it didn't pair that well with the fried lobster, and the pieces of lobster were overcooked and a bit too chewy/dry for my tastes. However, The shredded beef taco was AMAZING. After I started eating the shredded beef taco, I knew I would be coming back for more of them. It's just a classic shredded beef taco with the classic trimmings in a crunchy taco shell (the shell seemed like it was fried very close to when I ate it, yet wasn't oily and they didn't salt it), but they must be doing something a little different because it was just too damn good.   To sum up, I will be back and definitely recommend this place, but if you want to drink margaritas with some of those awesome shredded beef tacos, I would stick to Happy Hour, because the prices are pretty steep.  **Edit: Just found out from a fellow Yelper that they have $1.00 shredded beef tacos on tuesdays. That just moved it from 4 stars to 5 in my book and I will probably spend way too many tuesdays here. Thanks, Lindsey!

tm8sQkFL4Us9o3YcX8kdqQ.text: I recently dined here with some friends on a Sunday, and it will definitely be my last time.  The food took FOREVER to got.  The drinks were mostly mixer...I saw one previous comment on here that said they were "virgin" drinks. That's a great description. Our waitress was a despondent little grouch who definitely had an expression on her face suggesting that she had somewhere better to be. Maybe she did.   I also don't know why people keep saying "great" prices.  The Margaritas are $10 dollars! The fast food chain Chipotle is a better mexican food experience.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY AT CIEN AGAVES!!!!

vzRno8MEk-h23OJS8caocA.text: Food was good. We sat outside in the little alley way which was super cute! The food was good. Our waitress was sweet but she kept forgetting about us. We had to ask other servers to help us a few times:(

J_4YND7epV7_sWoRtNokJw.text: Been here several times always had good service and great tacos. Today my wife ordered veggie tocos and they come out cover in grease or butter and smothered in cheese. She had told the no cheese. She could eat them so I tried and they were to greasy for me to eat. The funny part I order pork and chicken tacos and my tortillas were not buttered or cheesy but hers were floating butter.

InOK0aDDPqowWdfot3WFow.text: We always have a great time at Cien Agave. As always great service and amazing food. Best happy hour seven days a week. Highly recommend The Gigante 56oz Margrita.

-Af5mvSmZJpZzU2-yzmOTQ.text: Service was friendly and the tacos were tasty, but the habanero margarita was the star of evening. A great spot for a casual dinner in Scottsdale!

CC1aMicHPF3jVn3ltj4BeA.text: Sat at bar and had the best service.  Terrific bartender. Great margaritas too!  Didn't eat and was just there for drinks but everyone around us were ordering food and seemed to enjoy it!  Will have to dine there the next time we're in town.

IST9Ui7p0-QnCWpAFgBcbg.text: Loved the happy hour specials! Between the two of us, my boyfriend and I were able to enjoy two of the Cien Agave Margaritas, a Tecate beer, the Guacamole appetizer, the Nachos appetizer, a Tinga taco and a Diablo taco all for under $35.00. Will definitely return to Cien Agaves when I'm back in Scottsdale!

DgFY8ixlNCW1Yn9pDChpyg.text: Quite possibly the most disappointing taco bar ever.  Looked promising on the outside.  Street tacos were skimpy on the protein portions,  way too sweet of garnish in most cases, and the grilled fish taco was incredibly bitter.  We loved this concept at Joyride Tacos but not so much here.

79W9zR7Ic4F0xH5yN-9zQA.text: Great taco and burrito our  bartender was  Casey very good service a must stop when in old town Scottsdale

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pl1gQKfNSJFHUku3RuHfiA.text: I have ordered a grilled mahi mahi taco and grill corn for side. This is absolutely stunning. Fish was grilled to perfection and corn has a nice char and sweet. This is one of the place that I will definitely come back for. Restaurant environment was comfortable. Nice ambiance music and just at the right volume. Friendly service. What else can you ask for when you are hungry at night.

MGcpsMoMA_i5V3a31gpCAQ.text: This is a great place for happy hour any day of the week! There house margaritas are amazing (made with freshly squeezed limes), guac is yummy, and so are their tacos. If you find yourself in old town Scottsdale it is worth a stop in

JXgM4l0NvJISZfaK2wtr9w.text: I can't believe it has taken me this long to try this place but I'm so glad I finally did!!  We came on a Tuesday, so they had $2 shredded beef tacos.  I wasn't expecting much for $2 but they were fantastic!  They were also a good size (I was expecting them to be pretty small).  I also had a cup of their poblano soup.  Wow, it was so delicious.  It has a lot of heat (which is to be expected), but in my opinion was the perfect amount of heat.  It also had incredible flavor.  The salsas were also both very flavorful (my favorite was the green, although I wish it were a bit spicier).  I will definitely be back here!

bMz9azG_FdWg_5LU7Idmpw.text: Awesome! We had reservations so didn't have to wait long to get seated. We got in just before happy our ended and the waitress got all our drink and appetizer orders in time. Waitress was great. Food was great. We were there on taco Tuesday so their reg beef tacos were $2 each. Wow! Great time and great food.

ZkZOG52LMfBCiSCEXfrAKA.text: I happened upon this place via UberEats one Saturday night. Ordered the fajitas and was pleasantly surprised by how good they were. The vegetables were good perfectly and the entree had a nice charred flavor that I like.   I have ordered a few additional times through UberEats, but only after I called to ask them to become available on the app. I would continue ordering from them, but I'm not going to keep calling to ask them to turn on the app.

eAYVhkRsX_NFDQMmgtgs_A.text: This place was delish! And ironically, it has a happy hour that actually has happy hour prices. I know that sounds funny, but a lot of happy hours are almost just as expensive as regulars prices. But this place is yummy and tasty! 4 house Margis, two tacos, guacamole and tostadas for under $30 bucks. Pretty good! We'll definitely be back

ayxHtXtp054orM_MeIJXMg.text: Came in on Easter Sunday for my first visit in. They are having a brunch special for Easter and it was yummy.  There are four different breakfasts today only but my friends also ordered off the regular menu. Must have a BeerRita which is a margarita w a coronito in it. Highly recommend you give this place a shot. Atmosphere is real Mexican and not easy to find in Old Town. Try HH it's 7 days a week and runs until 7. Check out the couple pics.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. @cienagaves #happyhour
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Easter Sunday Brunch Special Menu - it was fantastic #cienagaves @cienagaves

77xDLEd9feipqndJ8ZWjpA.text: If you're coming for drinks (specifically for margaritas), this is the place. Cien Agaves has a large amount of tequilas and variety of margaritas at a reasonable price.  The tacos are just OK and I feel that they're a bit small for the price. Some, (salmon for example) were tasteless.  The chips and salsa were delicious and I love that they give you both a green and red salsa.  All in all, it's much better than Salty Senorita.

6Gl8g7Ey6Aaxrz7r4xov-w.text: So we got there at 4 and we left 20 mins after and there happy hour is bomb. We left and walked around and by 6:55 we ran back to this place and at 6:58 I put an order and all the waiters were so nice and placed my order. They are thoughtful and nice. Waiters bartenders bus girls hostess Fatima waiter, Adam bartender and our waitress Amy, busboy Trevor, GM Jaime, you guys fucken rock !!!

h7rQX9EcDb7ioZ2N5yzETA.text: Cold not tasty food. Marquita and  guac great but forget food. Grease taste tostada and taco.  Beans liked canned. Drink a margarita and head to Taco Bell

3sEXCx2ieAxyOsVmNXUgog.text: My boyfriend and I came here last night after jumping around old town. Nearly everywhere was a 30+ minute wait on a Thursday at 6PM, but thankfully they had bar seats, tables, outside seating and high tops available here.   The bartender was extremely nice and knowledgeable. I asked him if the beans were vegetarian, explaining that I eat fish but not any other meat product. He said that they both were, but was quick to let me know that some other items on my order were not vegetarian and then offer substitutions.   I have never had someone so kind and helpful after asking that question! Even my boyfriend, who has had to deal with my dietary questions at restaurants for years, said he was impressed by how cool he was.   I ended up with two salmon tacos and the street corn. It was one of the greatest, lightest, and freshest Mexican meals I've had in a very long time! This place is fantastic for an array of diners. If you're not that hungry, you can order a single taco or sides.   I can't forget about their extensive margarita and tequila menu! Their house marg is my go-to: perfectly tequila-strong with a splash of lime and sweetness.

0z-CZZ5tV42ooWdPQd5QKg.text: I had the carbs asada taco, diablo shrimp taco and the mahi mahi taco. They were all average. I was not impressed by the food. The environment is fun and a great location, but I will keep looking for better tacos.

RJqTHGJJXcbgUszxOH0cdA.text: Tacos were tasty, I loved the shrimp tacos and the carne asada tacos were some of the best I've had. Also enjoyed the Pomberry margarita.

OTZj2VlV-3R7s3QsRzuxLQ.text: I swear I did a review about this place. The queso verde was the best thing I've ever had!!! I could have licked the bowl.   Stopped in here after a long day of drinking and was famished and pretty buzzed. This was a Saturday night and the place was busy but not packed. Our service was a little slow, or maybe I was just really hungry. LOL.  I also had a two taco plate that was delish, but seriously, that queso verde with the pork in it was to die for!!!! I want to marry it. I would go back here in a heartbeat just for that queso.   Cute place and right in the heart of Old Town. Perfect place to regroup and refresh yourself to hit the town again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green chilie pork queso. The BOMB!
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carne asada and carnitas tacos combo

TfPYC4bqmrEa54whU0pFNw.text: This place is soooo good. We had three different margaritas and for different apps. Tons of food for three people and super good. Everything was great! Really enjoyed the prickly pear Marg and the Pom berry Marg. Awesome. Cool atmosphere. Nice, helpful, attentive staff. This place is a great choice.

Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oTS50lB3YPXH7pXYRiKyYw.text: Im honestly so upset I paid 6 dollars for these sopapillas... coming from an ACTUAL Hispanic they were flat( they are supposed to be fluffy) and they only gave us 5?? Terrible never spending my money there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oFayUJTmLHyPPnsdaNaqEg.text: The bangin'est happy hour (3-7 EVERY day!!) in Old Town by miles, Cien Agaves is everything I thought I hated (the fratty old town crowd), but everything that speaks directly to my soul (cheap and delicious). Margs are never even my go to, but at 4 bucks a pop for a delightfully strong house margarita, how could I say no? Also on HH: half priced apps and $2.50 tinga tacos.   You can't really go wrong with any of their tacos, at least in my experience. Shredded beef and carne asada both excellent, and the island shrimp is a bit of a sleeper hit. But I always come crawling back to the tinga. God, it's just fantastic, especially on the hard shells--I'm not usually a hard-shelled taco kinda gal, but these are the perfect amount of crispy fried perfection.   My one small gripe about Cien is that while the food is all amazing, it's pretty hard to get in and out in a tight hour during lunch time. What we've ended up doing in the past is ordering, and then asking for our checks as our food comes out so we can bounce ASAP. Not the hugest deal, just a bit of a hassle gettin' back to that 9-5. That being said, I've always had amazing service; all of the hostesses, servers, and bartenders are super nice and helpful, and check in often to make sure things are still going swimmingly.  One oddball bonus point: their guac comes with pomegranate seeds! Yum!

Y5cNKHTTRjKD2unHvWJ-fQ.text: The five stars are for: prompt service, pleasant and courteous staff, for placing a Mexico! flag on my taco, and for having hot salsa that was actually HOT! The atmosphere here is contagiously fun and with the skulls everywhere and mexican decor adding to the vibe, I felt I had been transported to Mexico minus being frisked by the border patrol.  The shrimp taco was full of zesty full-sized shrimps and was spicy. The shredded beef taco and the chicken one didn't disappoint either. Best of all the shells were fried and crunchy which added to the zesty tasty explosion going on in my mouth! I would definitely come back here if I were visiting Old Town Scottsdale again.  Edit: I believe the actual HOT salsa did cost $0.75 more... but definitely worth it if you're up to the challenge!

5JsFgLzKbndcpLT6IT7qPw.text: 2nd time going to the restaurant the service is amazing! The prices for the meals and drinks are very reasonable . Was able to make it for happy hour the margarita was delicious. Very recommended you want good food and great drinks

YkzRq9cTgTCGPyOq1NRDIQ.text: I gave it three stars but really should be 2 1/2. The drinks were so so , not bad but not good. Guacamole was not fresh, salsa was blah , chips were ok. The tacos were good, not great. Chose this place because of ratings , really confused how they got four stars! The best of the experience  was the service , quick, friendly server.  To many great places to eat instead of going here.
