Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cadillac Margarita
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade Guacamole

5xaFfVLPInd8XxX1dPU3bQ.text: By far one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Scottsdale. They have the best queso dip I have ever had. Their food is always delicious too, staff is always polite.

CVRvLR6CtwfXToRYv-Z3qA.text: Great spot for solid Mexican fare, bunch of Margarita options, fun atmosphere and solid service.   We went in on Tuesday night for a quick dinner but the place was still fairly packed. Solid guacamole and queso started off the meal. We both got the enchilada and it was solid. I wish the chicken was in chunks as opposed to stringy and more cheese would've been appreciated but good nonetheless. Everything felt authentic and came out pretty quick  Really enjoyed their drinks and and the atmosphere was fun.

xbDuiYk_talBUTjcx1g1Bw.text: OMG! Poblano soup and tacos (Asada AMAZING!!! You guys have to seriously visit Fernanda the bartender! Smokin' HOT, lots of fun, has a PhD in Mixology, make you laugh and smile!!! Will be back every night she is workin'!!!! Damn the tequilas are amazing!!!!

yY1Lnpx9FfLBCuJLQINrig.text: You definitely have to come here during happy hour, and if you come on a Monday happy hour you won't regret it! The shrimp tacos are $3 each on Monday's and the Island Shrimp Taco's are bomb! the Diablo Shrimp not as good... the Ceviche is ok, I prefer more lime and salt. However the $5 house margaritas for happy hour are perfect! You can do on the rocks or frozen and I chose frozen. The appetizers were all half off so I got the guacamole too and they have pomegranates in their guacamole! Love it. Finally one of the best things EVER is the cheese bread with carnitas added! IT WAS AMAZING! it comes out like a flatBread pizza with all the right ingredients. I can't wait to bring my family and friends here for dinner and drinks! I'll be back again for sure.

abYp0B9s1N8BdbQRhHWY5Q.text: Had a bachelorette dinner here as part of the weekend and everything was great! Our server was attentive, kept making sure our margarita pitchers were full and if we wanted to order more. Our food all came out at the same time for 15 ladies which was impressive. I'll be recommending this place for large groups!

tMOBtQ0Ld7sco6kUEFW7wA.text: Stopped in for dinner, appetizers and drinks. The chips came out cold and stale. Staff was nice enough to see there was a problem and tried to fix it. Our caso came out and it was honestly the worst caso we've ever had. By the time they brought back another fresh order of chips, we tried the new batch and it was still no good. We cashed out and left. Staff is good, however the food completely missed the mark. Maybe you'll have better luck as we heard this place was great (and it was packed).

GwTFn_Awcuzak4SCGoVl8Q.text: Came to Cien Agaves as part of a group lunch recently. Since they market themselves as the best tacos + margs in AZ, I was super intrigued to try them out. Thank goodness for my friends who get us together to try all these new-to-us places in the Valley!   They're in a cute + festive building in Old Town that is definitely reminiscent of the Wild West. I give them props for that. I left wishing I could give them props to their food + margs... there was a lot desired from them. Perhaps another visit is in order? ::shrug::   The servers were super kind since they had our group to deal with. By the time I arrived mostly everyone had ordered so they went thru the menu, their suggestions with me. I went with the highly-recommended AZ Prickly Pear Marg. It's so pretty! But not that good. I didn't want to bother the servers so I just kind of sipped on it slowly until we left instead of ask for another. I went with a chicken fajita salad too. Really nice presentation in a full fried tortilla bowl, but there's nothing really worth the $13 for it as it's just a standard bland salad with chicken. I wasn't terribly impressed either with their chips and salsa. That's hard to come by for me... but they did.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salad with chicken and prickly pear marg (needs more lime juice)

G0TzfG9AYUMFG91-jz48Xg.text: Best happy hour in old town! Get the queso, you will not be disappointed.  Great service and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love this place! Best happy hour in old town. Margaritas and queso per the usual

Jd8PP0ERB609zvL1OKpGrw.text: 1 + 1 + 1 = 4  Sometimes, like at Cien Agaves, the sum of the parts adds up to more than each individual part.    Mexican food was on the minds of my party of 4 and the first place we tried claimed an hour-plus wait despite appearing 10% full.  It was a blessing in disguise really, as Cien Agaves was much more what we sought:  a busy casual environment,  inexpensive fare, zero pretension, and no attitude.    During a brief wait at their upstairs bar, we learned it was Happy Hour and that theirs was voted "best of" by readers of Phoenix Magazine.  How could it not, with 1/2 price Margaritas, 1/2 off all appetizers, $3-$4 beers, and Tinga Tacos priced at $2.50 apiece?  The fact that it's every day from 3 - 7 p.m. just improves the value proposition.    Margaritas were in demand and many sat pre-made, at the ready.  Large but not refined (and made in advance without salted rims), I really wasn't going to complain loudly about a big $3 cocktail.  It was good enough, a category into which the rest of the offerings could also be said to fall.    At the table, chips and salsa were provided and an order of HH Tinga Tacos proved greasily satisfying.  The rest of the offerings followed suit.  During happy hour it's difficult to resist all those cheap appetizers so I can't really complain about them serving up fatty foods best designed to sop up alcohol.  It is, after all, what I ordered.    Cien Agaves doesn't serve the best Mexican fare but what they do serve - at happy hour in particular - is well priced, good at filling you up, and your server will throw no shade even when your whole party orders from that happy hour menu.  That counts for a lot, thus the new math, where 1+1+1 = 4.

CoTRc0mGk33Mhv_qzXKaKw.text: Audra is the best server ever!!! Great food and great ambiance. The patio is gorgeous!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3AWWYb8dIn0q3RP3zgnQsQ.text: We were visiting from Vancouver and it was our first time in Scottsdale. We were hungry and looking for a good place to eat so we randomly chose this place based on the reviews.  We were a party of 12 girls and they sat us in their back patio. It was so cute this place had a really great atmosphere perfect for our last night in Scottsdale.  They had an awesome list of margaritas... Half of us got margaritas and the other half shared a pitcher of sangria. BOTH were delicious!  The restaurant was nice enough to give me a free shot of tequila being that we were celebrating my bachelorette party.  You can't go wrong with a burrito. This is definitely a westernized Mexican restaurant if that's what you want then you've come to the right place.   The service was quick, our server was nice and the food was tasty.

vXev3sciOcF-dQs48Cl5hw.text: Yes, I love me a good happy hour because I have a lot of mouths to feed. ;) Two adults that like to eat a lot and drink, 1 toddler and a baby.  Stumbled upon this place while walking old town Scottsdale for the first time.  Saw a sign that they had happy hour on a Sunday evening, so we decided to stop by.  They were super friendly, even though we had two kids (and let's be honest, kids are messy), and seated us right away.  Their whole restaurant has happy hour, so you don't need to be seated in a particular section to get happy hour pricing, which is great!  We ordered the taquitos, the shrimp ceviche, and the 3 tacos plate, which comes with 3 tacos of your choosing, rice and beans.  Everything was good, and our meal also came with complimentary chips and salsa.  The blended margarita I ordered was refreshing as well.  Loved the super friendly atmosphere of this restaurant and the staff.

_XFC7j4Ax2y4QGKKkhGn9A.text: I was there today for the first time. It was very unimpressive. I ordered a chicken taco that had about 3 bites of chicken in it plus some filler items and it was about half full. This item was $4.25. I could have made a dozen for that price and my 9 year old granddaughter could have done a better job. They seemed to cater to those who were drinking-not so much to us. The tortilla I had was cold and had not been warmed. They asked and I told them how I felt. Wow a whopping 10% off of our tab. I was underwhelmed. Not going back.

9098vMTMmmxvkSCnAHGYEw.text: I've been to Cien Agaves twice. Their tacos are great (especially the Al Pastor). Great atmosphere here as well. I was with a large group the last time I was here and they readily arranged seating for us even though they were fairly busy and we did not have a reservation. Over all I would recommend them without hesitation.

zrtAcmx6Lcs9VudKHonzgg.text: Solid happy hour! Great food and drink specials. I really love the art on the walls.

pVc7B9T8O7YmoJ5fKtm0sQ.text: We happened to stumble upon this place while driving through Old Town Scottsdale. Best Mexican food we have ever had!!!! Hands down the best fajitas I have ever eaten!!!!

VeVGx40XkJMUvj1NOkVpqg.text: Trendy taco shop in Old Town Scottsdale with good menu.

YrUllezckaau-deFY7r-6Q.text: Ode to Taco Tuesday   Cien Agave, how I love thee  Where else can I go to get tacos for free!?  Well, technically they are not free, but still  Only $1 a piece, it's an absolute steal!   Your Tecate Light is so refreshing and crisp  And at only $2, I can have multiple sips!  If darker beer is more your fare,  Have a Modelo, it's not that much more!   The tequila you serve makes your Margs quite delish  All food so divine, I have only one wish!  Only one day a week is not enough, I say  Let's celebrate Taco Tuesday EVERY DAY!   TT fans - this little poem sums it up! If you want cheap food and drinks, good service, cool ambiance, and just an overall place to go, Cien Agave's on Tuesday nights is the place for you!

uOK3q4D2Iocw8AttidbeRg.text: Typical Mexican influenced bar with tacos. A little run down, but casual and down to earth. It has a rustic feel to it, and offered lots of seating. The ridiculous amount of tequila offered at the bar definitely draws in customers. Quite a sight to see! The food was mediocre, tacos and burrito were OK, nothing special. The rice tasted a little burnt and the black beans were the best part. Though the shrimp were cooked to perfection, they got it right!

PlcGwE1cuWYRK_7_6s5Phg.text: I've been here twice.  The service is great; the margaritas are great; the food sucks.  Both times my meals tasted like an old shoe.  I'm not sure how they get that exact flavor in the food on two separate occasions but it is not good.  Two strikes you're out.

659s4p_4q0ILi_w6j8a4kQ.text: First off this place should have a way higher rating then 3 stars. Came here because my boyfriend bought a travelzoo deal and the food and margaritas were awesome. We both had seafood enchiladas and split a tostada appetizer. It was absolutely delicious. This restaurant also has a great taco Tuesday deal 1.50 shredded beef tacos and 2 dollar tecates. Will definitely be back again.

iPcr18FQlt07T96bepZb4A.text: Fish tacos were great, both the breaded and the grilled. Yummy. Salsa and baja sauce were HOT, HOT, HOT. Waitress seemed clueless about this and no mention of how hot it was on the menu.

6-eYFnuFHXXsCR4_zBXeyg.text: This restaurant has AMAZING tacos/food but HORRIBLE service. This disconnect makes it very hard for me to make up my mind about this place. I have been 4 times between mid April and mid June.   PROS: A big variety of tacos, a lot of them are unique and combine great flavors you don't see everywhere else. Love the shrimp and the carnitas/pork. Great chips and Salsa. The margs are really delicious and refreshing also - good portion size and no sugary syrup. Nice atmosphere and patio.   CONS: I have had a different server everytime so it isn't just one person bringing down my review. I feel like the servers have to be reminded of what there job is. It should be automatic to bring by chips and salsa or at least ask if the table wants it. I ALWAYS have to request this. The drinks take a while and often the waitress comes back a second time to double check the drink order. Mainly I feel that they are unattentive and just don't put a lot of effort into customer service which is really too bad because it is a great place.  I am not high maintenance and do not ask a lot, but I do like to be served. Whenever I bring someone new here I always add a disclaimer "You will love the food, but just as a warning the service isn't great" so that the person will want to stick around for the course to be served.   I will continue to come here and eat the delicious tacos that I love so much, but will also continue to get extremely annoyed with the staff. This place has amazing potential if they could just work that kink out - it would be perfect.  **UPDATE August 2012 - At the beginning of the month I took some friends here from out of the country. Our food was very good and I am very happy to say that we had great service. I didn't recognize our waitress and I wish I would have gotten her name. She did a great job, was attentive, and was very polite. Made the experience so much better!

n5-ACMimiBD8RmCZjrnAsQ.text: Great white sangria and margaritas!!!  We went for dinner, but ended up ordering appetizers and a pitcher of white sangria. All I can say is the service was great but the drinks are amazing!!!  The tortilla chips  were fresh and homemade.  The ceviche was so tasteful!

jRHGZQtMRAJdnwtgFRvTlA.text: Came in at 330 on a Tuesday.  I assume this was their slow time as there was only a handful of patrons and at least 3 or 4 servers and 1 bartender. 3 female servers walked right by me without saying hello or acknowledging me. I hate that.  Makes you feel like they don't want you there. After 5 minutes a gentleman approached and asked if I had been helped. He took a drink order and returned with a menu. Nice guy but he had a dirty broom and dustpan in has hands the whole time....not very appetizing.  A few minutes later, the bartender took my order. I had the Tingo tacos. Tacos were very good as were the chips and salsa. They bring 2 salsas, red and green and both were very good. I really appreciate it when the person taking care of me comes back to see how my food tastes, promptly.  The female bartender did come back to my table but after I was halfway through. If I had had a problem she would have never known it. I asked for a to go box and she brought me one. As I was packing my food in the box I dropped a chip. I didn't feel like getting down at the moment to pick it up and I watched as all of the female servers walked by, more than once and never picked the chip up. Two mail servers did the same thing. There's no way they didn't notice it. It was right in the middle of the walkway and they just stared at it and did nothing. You can always tell when people don't like their job and that's the impression I got from this restaurant. None of the staff smiled at me and none of them seemed like they cared that I was there at all.  It's too bad, the food was very good. When I come to a restaurant I don't expect people to do cartwheels and shoot off fireworks when I come in. However I do expect to be greeted and treated with kindness and a smile. These people all walked around with frowns on their faces and with the attitude that they just didn't care.

wDxMoLQpihpeTZAA7JLkXw.text: Been here several times.  Margaritas are great.  Happy hour is a great deal with half price appetizers.  Look forward to coming here any time I am in town.

tr9aOdvWcmpGSkp65wyUXQ.text: If you're going to a Giants spring training game you must go here first! Their happy hour is second to none.  We were there on a Tuesday and they had $2 tecate, $1.50 shredded beef tacos and half price appetizers.  They bring you free chips with 2 different types of salsa.  We left there with full bellies and spending $30 (which included a very generous tip).

n1dc1t2EwNhp4N0c-Il03A.text: This place was the setting for two of my "firsts". My first fish taco and my first cucumber margarita and I was far from let down! Holy goodness they were so great. My husband and I had a weekend away from the kid so we decided to get some drinks and tacos. I've heard great things but it's always better to try it yourself! The Mahi Mahi taco was FABULOUS and their cucumber margarita is my new favorite, and I'm not usually a margarita fan!  We'll go back, for sure!

cGx9ZlRGtu6LjCbwZI8Vhw.text: The only reason I give this place a 2 star is because the food is fantastic but the service is absolutely horrible. We have come to this place very regularly for years and the staff changes almost monthly and never improves. It's almost a breeding ground for terrible servers. We sat down today and ordered food and a margarita. By the time we had finished our food the waitress had still not returned to check on us or ask if we wanted to order another drink. I finally got up and walked to the bar where she was just chatting with a friend and was shocked that I wanted something and actually caught her slacking off. I wish I could include a picture of the entire place. There is a total of 3 tables and 2 servers. Not a lot for either of these people to take care of. I don't ask for a lot. I just want someone to stop by once in a while to see if my drink needs refilled or maybe I want another taco. We will never know because they never gave it a chance.

T1QN625s2HPK4KKXvFIVzQ.text: 3 Stars only because the house margarita and guacamole was so good.  The food was decent (fish tacos), however the patio atmosphere was a bit sad. I understand this is more of a bar than a fine dining restaurant but the patio tables had no place settings, condiments, etc... Just cheap metal tables and chairs. Also - there was no music out there, just this incessant humming of a back alley generator.    The service was a bit sporadic out on the patio as well. We were asked by three different servers if we have a server yet. Not much in the way of organization.   Maybe management just hasn't gotten around to fully organizing and furnishing the patio yet. I hope they do, because they are in a great location and the food and drinks give them lots of potential.

S0FLYCK8iMlAH-jEWLMgTA.text: Fabulous selection of unique tacos. Had the 3 taco plate with salmon, grilled Ono and pork. Each one had its own unique flavor - hard to decide which was my favorite. The other members of our party had the same experience. Service was courteous and prompt, and we were able to make last-minute reservations on Open Table. Will definitely be back!

6-BR_srgHfz3UxUnZdo10Q.text: Let me start by saying that when you sit down at a Mexican restaurant, you shouldn't have to ask for chips & salsa,  let alone ask for it 3 times!! My boyfriend & I started off with the habanero-lime margarita. Great fresh flavor but we weren't sure where the habanero disappeared to. There was no heat whatsoever. I ordered the 2 taco special--carnitas & shredded beef. Part of my order was wrong, there were only 2 pieces of carnitas, and the shredded beef taco was like a running faucet. My boyfriend ordered the carne asada burrito or should I say the 'rice burrito'...it had nothing but rice & was dry as hell. To top it all off, our waitress never even asked how we enjoyed our meal. Perhaps that was intentional on her part since our entire meal sucked!! Yelpers beware...don't waste your time or your $ on this place!

sN_TEKluo62-jPwyV9sZQw.text: Food was great...service, not so much.  We sat at the bar and it was pretty busy however, the female bartender was not very attentive at ALL (Tuesday Taco night) and never got her name.  I thought I heard someone call her MichaelAnn but, can't be sure.  The male bartender on the other hand, was doing his best to take our order and get us drinks.  We hand the Tinga Taquitos which were great, a taco and the beet bowl.    I guess as newbies to Scottsdale, we are not "regular" enough.

HNbPVcRineoAfRCS49ws0A.text: I am a huge fan of Mexican food and I can't believe I have not found this place sooner! It's only a mile from my house! The food is amazing....their guacamole is outstanding...stopping on the way home will easy become a habit!

NrIdDbOGqdh05TOGhiXBBg.text: This place has great margaritas and tacos!!! Audra was our server- whom was amazing! Audra  brought our service dog a bowl of water and we sat inside.  We will be back here!

yatKdqCxaz8o-ZOfY1dyyQ.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome. I tell everyone I know in the Phoenix area that they neeeed to try this place.  After my last review, Katie reached out to me about the issue with my CC and promised to make things right on my next visit. I am not local to the Phoenix/Scottsdale area and really had no plans to come back in the immediate future, so I thanked her for reaching out but didn't really expect much to happen.   Fortunately I got the chance to be in Phoenix for a couple days just a short month later and I knew I would be hitting up Cien Agaves for my tinga chicken quesadilla and house margarita. After sitting down and ordering I mentioned Katie and my server sent her right out - she was awesome and very accommodating and made True on her promise.  I can't speak for the full menu because I literally order the same thing every time (I know - how boring,) but I would expect nothing less than greatness from this place.  The only issues I have are: 1.) I can't go on a regular basis 2.) They don't sell the "green salsa" - seriously y'all need to allow me to order this or share the recipe with me because I am obsessed with it.   Thanks again Cien Agaves, I can't wait for my next impromptu Phoenix trip so I can come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enjoying a house margarita in their cool outdoor seating area.

UAR2EZp06I-eYl_Zsv68Cg.text: I typically hate everything in Old Town, but who can hate a Mexican restaurant that's open late, serves a huge variety of drinks, has great and imaginative tacos, can accommodate those who eat clean.  The lean green bowl is black beans, Greek yogurt, roasted veggies, tomatoes and lime quinoa. It's outstanding and even better with shrimp for a few bucks more.  Ahi tuna tacos also are terrific.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lean Green Bowl

vqffHuS_xKkt3ociicpL1Q.text: I had an amazing time at Cien Agaves during my visit to Arizona! Not only are the margaritas AMAZING but the wait staff and management are absolutely incredible. The atmosphere is relaxing and I loved the decor. I cannot wait for my next trip out to Phoenix so I can enjoy the wonderful company and delicious margaritas!!!

605n4iJzRiJMQ_s8DjJz0g.text: Friendly staff, good service, and great happy hour specials. This is in the heart of old town, but it's not so hip that you'll have to wait a long time to be seated unless you're with a large party.  They can make several of their bowls vegan. The avocado and beets bowl is really good.   This is a good casual date spot and also good for entertaining out of towners in Scottsdale.

4Nn-HYLwhl-GqJ3qyu_Ffw.text: What a great lunch! Walking around old town and discovered this Mexican place! Fantastic fajitas and Cadillac margaritas. The guacamole was pretty good, needed a bit more flavor. Samantha C did a great job as our waitress! We will be back on our next visit to Scottsdale.

wNdL4G3jMZrNbwooainXWg.text: Best ceviche and guacamole you will ever find! All the menu items we made fresh to order, the kitchen had no problem getting a picky eaters order correct and all our kids finished their meals! That never happens! We are heading back for happy hour 3-7 for half prices appetizers and margaritas! Thanks Cien for a great lunch! We will be back!

1zDTqhEVqRO6pe1Z9sLQVw.text: Wonderful food. Great service. Been there several times and love it! Four of us recently went for lunch - it was very reasonably priced. Large servings and delicious sangria!

LNpiB4LNEiJ5kP-JT1gDwA.text: Had a really good meal. Loved the variety of fish tacos and they had a lot of vegetarian options too

X5ddOAh56tquwkGwVl5__g.text: This is a killer happy hour.  Great little taco and marg spot right in old town Scottsdale. Basically the entire menu is half off from (I think) 3-7.  We came in at around 6 on a Saturday and sat down right away.  We had some margs and tacos, a quesadilla and a queso dip.  The food was good not great, and easily made up for by the ambiance, location and atmosphere.  We will be back for sure, but can't justify paying non HH prices.  Check it out if you're in Scottsdale!

q7Y3r5J83fEKv3z1ShyryA.text: Food was good.  However, the manager is giving a job interview inside the restaurant and she is so loud that I can barely hear myself think.  It's pretty unprofessional to hold an interview in the middle of the restaurant during lunch hour.   It would be very easy to walk outside or hold at a different venue.

DMRHIml98qwLGU9GWhPogA.text: Best Mexican restaurant in the area hands down. Loved it all service and food all superior.

2ahWOpUJSRxsE0VqnnY6Kw.text: Beer is cold, tequila is good and guacamole is spicy ...and that's how Latin bar should be

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3gNptSktO4oXS2QQ8Qjqvw.text: Great food and a cute outdoors courtyard area. They have a huge selection, and some good options for a vegan like myself. I thoroughly enjoyed my dinner.

rm9JcQRYftAyI07q9xTM9w.text: Casey is an awesome bartender/server. Best burrito I ever had. A must stop place when in Scottsdale.

a3OZFjLxGhb1Oj4XcAdAtg.text: Hands down favorite Mexican Restaurant in Scottsdale. The margaritas are the best that I have ever had and are extremely reasonable during their long happy hour. The tacos and appetizers are delicious.

siJ2wL8z9R6hQc1Wp0Etug.text: Great Happy Hour.  Fresh ingredients cheap drinks and the best service ever today. Thanks! Happy hour till 7 not 6 like most places. Even on weekends not just Mon thru Fri.

zF2ZJn7EFT0pNHRYBvIC-Q.text: My new go to Mexican in Phoenix. Amazing staff!!!  Guacamole is fresh, mildly tart, chunky & topped with pomegranate seeds. Tinga chicken tacos covered with freshest veggies and creamy creama! Happy hour means $2 for the tacos and half price on the guacamole. I'm in love!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

daMNX6s6R12JqxbWZJW4ug.text: We went there today and we were really impressed! Great food , service and the beer was cold! We'll be going back! Great atmosphere. Easy to get into! Enchiladas were awesome!

ZLbIpQ5Odvvi1AihuoAxpQ.text: With so many Mexican places to choose from in AZ, I cant say this is my favorite, but certainly a solid standby. Ambience is okay, small outdoor patio and house margarita is so so. But Amazing happy hour specials everyday and until 7pm ! Great deals on all appetizers.  Get the nachos which are HUGE and cheap and delicious.  We will certainly be back when the mood strikes.

hLmvTWAqCnIXhKMZr4gVLw.text: Food is great, drinks are great, happy hour was great.... However, I wasn't a huge fan of the "service." When we got there we were offered a booth, but we had to be done before an hour as they had a reservation. So, because we didn't want to feel rushed we agreed to either wait or go to another table; they seated us in the bar area at a high top. It did take forever to get chips and salsa but that's the only complaint that I have regarding the actual service at the table..... However, as one of the bartenders checked on us to see if we needed anything else, we ordered another round of drinks and were then informed that they had a private party coming in and they wanted to clear the area within 15 minutes. So, basically, hurry up and get out...   I mentioned the fact that it happened when we first got there and the bartender laughed it off and continued on.... Honestly, I felt as if our patronage was not appreciated and we were a bother.

j2by-9PA7W_oqLzCMGeNQw.text: Nothing like a 30 minute wait time to get a table to only then be ignored by our server for nearly 30 more minutes... Don't get me wrong the place was busy, but he took our drink orders then never returned to our table even though we could see him behind the bar 5 feet away. After listening to the table next to us decide to leave for the same reason (mind you, with no check- they just left cash and walked out) we flagged someone down for a check and left. No reappearance from our "original sever"..  Not even poor service- simply just no service at all. Won't be returning.

8b58wUsH6nKXhqzmqT4lPQ.text: My boyfriend wanted Authentic Mexican food and we found this place.  We were seated outside in an alley way, which had a very nice feel to it.  They provided free chips and salsa.  The 2 taco platter (Grill Mahi Mahi and Pollo Asado) and a side of Mexican street corn I had was rich with savoring flavors.  It made my taste buds explode!  My boyfriend had the same but instead of chicken he had the Island Shrimp and he enjoyed his as well.  Needless to say, we'll be back for more and possibly dessert (if we aren't to stuffed).

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2 Taco Platter w/side of Mexican Street Corn

i0iyWWqE8Oqh_LOpu975tw.text: I love this place! When we went for lunch the place was relatively empty, but filled up quickly. Their shrimp tacos are amazing! I would get them again in a heartbeat. Queso dip is a must and a nice cold margarita! They have so many margarita options an the service was great. I would go back any time!

-TsWXfKK8Trw20LXk1Q2_w.text: Loved this place!  Great margaritas and great tacos. Tried the Cien Beets and street corn which were great!  Service was awesome!

TFvXYq9z0dVwewkscSJq4w.text: Great food! Love the nachos, and their tacos are good too. Food came fast and service was great!

T61eC3w3cxx7i6H38vYzqw.text: Happy hour on Tuesday was better than I expected. I sat upstairs at the high top because it was busy and too hot to sit on the patio. The service from the bartender was awesome considering she was waiting on 4 tables plus the bar by herself and making drinks for the other tables.  The crispy tacos are American style with light & crispy shells (they looked made in-house) with lettuce, tomato, & shredded cheddar cheese. Also comes with cute little flags. I just wished they had more flavor. The margaritas were appropriately strong. And when my boyfriends drink slid off the slanted table, the girls were quick to clean it up, tell is it was ok, and brought a fresh one right away. Needless to say I left a good tip because it was well deserved

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mIGsIsFRPbwqT0UtB9Z82w.text: Service was not good (had to ask the server for water, had to ask him to remove appetizer plate...while he left the empty glasses, etc). The food was really quite mediocre Mexican food. Nothing special and nothing to note. The atmosphere was nice. The outside space was nice but our table was beyond wobbly making it a little too easy to spill the overly sweet margs.

RWb0j0X-xevQv8BP_hGkBQ.text: Our friends introduced us to this restaurant over 2 years ago and we have loved it ever since! Our definite favorites are the Tinga tacos, guacamole and house margaritas with salt! The guacamole has a delicious twist of pomegranate seeds and it goes perfectly with the chips & salsa. The location is great and there is plenty of parking around the restaurant. The service is great and attentive. We are excited to continue to explore more of the menu and we always take friends & family when they are in town! The restaurant has a great vibe and also has outdoor seating for the perfect Arizona weather. We love being able to make reservations when we know we are craving tacos & margaritas and it's very easy to do. This is a just see if you're in old town Scottsdale!

JOlWnUZVACI9kGMfqEzvnQ.text: This has got to be the best happy hour in the area for sure, and bonus points for having it every day of the week. During happy hour cien-a-ritas are $5...not the best margarita ever but a fantastic deal nonetheless. Last time my boyfriend got his frozen and added coconut flavoring to his ($1 extra) and that was delicious and how I plan on taking mine from now on. They also have half off all appetizers during happy hour!! We enjoyed their guacamole. My favorite food wise was their tinga tacos , which are $3 during happy hour. Overall we spent less than $40 on 4 drinks, 3 appetizers, and 2 tacos. How could you not enjoy that?!

NPhJ-zvoFzSdIrKGB49YpA.text: We discovered this restaurant while walking around the shops in old town Scottsdale. We had margaritas and a variety of tacos. All were good. My rating was lowered because of an issue regarding seating. The hostess told us that there would be a twenty minute wait although there was a nearby empty table in plain site.  The reason given was that two large parties were being served nearby. We went in the bar area to wait but were not allowed to put a third chair at one of the empty two seat tables. We then went to the outside area where we were initially hassled about seating 3 at the table and what could be served outside at that time. Eventually someone was reasonable and allowed us to order both food and drinks. I lowered my rating because of the seating issue.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie taco
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tonga Taco

ccwVSGsuX5KW5TmejHKVwA.text: Stopped in for lunch one day as we were driving through town. Our server was a trainee and she was pretty good, just a little green so things were a bit slower.   We got typical enchiladas and burritos. Food was good, but nothing outstanding. Their salsas were tasty but they charged more for some of them which is kind of odd but whatever.   Overall nothing was bad but I would not come out of my way to go here again.

0odTF1trVCvT_azyPiEV1A.text: Not particularly impressed. Service was VERY slow... 5-8 mins before I was welcomed by a waiter and given a menu.  Never saw waiter again. Food runner brought food, another took dishes away, still another finally brought check, and a fourth returned credit card and bill to sign. Water never filled, no one came to check on diners. Food was... meh...  like I said before, not particularly impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

z8ka3uQRIsuE9_SsAJcf8A.text: Stopped in just for drinks. They have a GREAT happy hour and the margaritas are wonderful! Salsa is perfect medium heat! It was slammed on the Friday after Christmas, but we got a seat at a high top near the bar right away and great service.

pb2lPzn2DrliiWYklXPHeg.text: I'll start off with the specials. They're amazing. I felt like I was robbing the place during happy hour. 2 VERY strong margaritas, 2 tacos AND a massive bowl of delicious queso for $20.  The service? Happy, quick, nice! Nothing super special but nice smiling faces to come to. The food was something else. I have never had a better taco shell. It was crispy, flavourful, and obviously incredibly fresh. Inside, more impressive flavours. The queso....... just go try it. It's probably the best Tex mex queso I've had.  GREAT experience. Will recommend to friends and come back ASAP.

vwPc7Jn47KylCtC4fxEXmQ.text: The Beets by Ren Bowl was really good. The fish taco and taco salad were pretty plain. The regular margarita was too sweet. I liked the skinny margarita (asked them to not make it sweet).

fgE-hOVXuFA-Sq5ZAqtxoQ.text: Came here with some girlfriends, after walking around the Old Scottsdale and taking in the character and desert sights. In the heat, all I wanted was a tall cool drink, maybe with alcohol. Ended up getting a Cien Agaves margarita for myself, which was quite good. If my girlfreinds drank alcohol , i would have ordered a pitcher they call  El Gigante.  Food was just very bland for me, and very pricey (but it is smack in the middle of a tourist area, so no surprise). ($4.95 for ONE taco - it better be Kobe asada, or Kurobota carnitas and premium Ahi tuna). Maybe that's the Arizona style for Mexican food, but it was not my thing.  Three stars for our very sweet-faced server, it would have gone higher if maybe we got our food and water sooner. Kitchen seemed really slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Exterior
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bathroom has knobs for your purse! Genius!
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Interior

nXZTdqxEvZVKj96YN0xCJw.text: I don't know how this place has a 4 star review. A friend and I had a late night at work and we were hungry. So he found this place with 4 stars as we were craving Mexican food. When we got there we were seated and we waited about 15 minutes for our server to bring back our waters and chips and salsa. She at this time took our order we both got the old town burrito. It took 45 minutes just to get our food and during that time period I think the server came back to check on us once. My buddy said his chicken in his burrito had a rubbery texture. Both our burritos were dry with not much flavor. During this time the waitress came back to see if we needed anything we did not see her after that until we were finished eating. I had looked over and she was busy talking to some people in the bar area which I would assume were her friends. When we finished eating and asked for our check it took her another 20 minutes to bring it to us as she was back in the bar chatting with her friends again. I will sadly not be returning here again if I am in the area.

tc_a3Y9_Juybev8-s0fbFw.text: Great little place! We had 4 house margaritas, 3 Tinga tacos and guacamole and chips for less than $27! And it was all delicious! Can't beat the value.

R4Kv-Jluk9yru6w_Z4nURw.text: If you are looking for a great street taco look no further..CIEN AGAVES has them.  Their entire street taco menu is mouth watering however I can never stray from the lobster tacos.  This place is a great place to go to before an afternoon Spring Training baseball game.  Their three tequilla taster is also a good way to sample the tequilla, if I can remember it is around $16 for 3 shots (heavy pour) of tequilla for sipping.  This place continues to get better and better and the service I recieve there is how any place in Scottsdale should be.

_bczLnx23FCIdnzH-7Eafw.text: Awesome happy hour deal - their house margarita is about $2.50 (I think that's right) - a total steal for a pretty tasty margarita, accompanied by some tasty tacos.

WifhxcLBXAydubzvq0vMaQ.text: Came here for happy hour---the queso dip was good but everything else was so-so. The guacamole was tasteless, tacos average and the tostada was pretty terrible. Not a fan--won't come back. I will stick with salty senorita!

O_W7g-YvVtfDLVvsThkw2Q.text: Basic bar with excellent beeritas and awesome shrimp tacos that were on $2 special Mon night. Very friendly service.

bfUBOD0jxkHEsnnbJncAzA.text: I've given this place so many fair shots because they have a great happy hour and seem like they have potential. The atmosphere is cool, the restaurant's decoration and patio are really neat, they have awesome artwork.   The reason I'm over it is because the service is pretty awful. The chips are stale, but they're free, so I'm not that critical and don't need to fill up on free chips anyway.  Girlfriend digs the margaritas because they don't taste as 'syrupy' (whatever that means) and because they are half price on happy hour. Tinga tacos ($1.50 each) are good too. We really prefer the other tacos they used to have on happy hour like 6 months ago...consider bringing those back, management.  The problem is really that most servers are clueless, irritated that you're in their section and get everything wrong. Pretty consistently, the waitresses seem to be in their first week of their first serving job - forgetting orders, messing stuff up and being awkward.  So if you have a lot of patience, are not in a rush and have a lot of great friends with you, this might be an okay choice for happy hour, but there are definitely a lot of better options nearby.

i8cSt08SSiM9eMbZ91ks4w.text: Great environment! The staff was friendly and provided great service! I had the Tinga, Island, and Chorizo tacos! Wow........very flavorful! Not to mention the margaritas! Shhhhhh don't tell but I had two! The pomegranate margarita was very flavorful and the amount of tequila was on point! The prices were great as well! I was there for dinner, but viewing the happy hour prices, no doubt I'll be back very soon!

QydsEHHiJqoM6dlZFa8Qpg.text: Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila does just a couple of things, but they do them really well!  We tried a range of items (blackberry mojito, local margarita, nachos, tacos, rice, beans) but the real stars were - not surprisingly - the tacos and the tequila.   The local margarita is made with a locally-made tequila, and this was one of the best margaritas I've ever had. And the tacos? Nom, nom, nom. We had beef, carnitas, and chicken - and they were all winners. The nachos were okay, and the beans and rice were pretty standard fare.  Our server, Meg, was awesome. She made great recommendations and she totally took good care of us - making sure our food was good and that our drinks stayed full.  And the price? Totally reasonable for the amount of food and all the local ingredients.

wLSCHmwWh153D-yORav83g.text: This place is amazing! Perfect for watching sports with multiple TV and the atmosphere is laid back. Their tacos are super tasty, especially any of the seafood. I was amazed at the tasty unique margaritas, like avocado. I was skeptical, but was pleasantly surprised. If your in downtown Scottsdale this is a MUST!!!

jQSv1LeqQHdlrWK84pNQ_w.text: Best watermelon margarita of my life!!!! Great food and atmosphere! Conveniently located in Old Town Scottsdale. Highly recommend!!

cajuJ5KWIyceniR535uQEw.text: We are from out of town and stopped in because the happy hour menu was enticing. The food was okay, the drinks were great... We had the house margarita and a couple specialties. You could tell the tequila used was high quality. It was smooth and flavorful.   If ever we are in Scottsdale again we'll definitely stop in for a drink and a laid back atmosphere.

S4Z0rJYElj1AlvN82zGH7w.text: I had a lunch with some friends over $1 tacos.  The scenery, the tacos, the grease...all good.  $1 fried tacos were well worth every penny.  Crispy fried tacos.  Not an every day indulgence but tasty nonetheless.  The place has a bit of a funky atmosphere, the service was very good.  I would return for Tuesday $1 Tacos.  I am betting Cien Agaves is pretty busy on Friday & Saturday nights.  Did I mention the $1 tacos were fried?  Very filling.  That was the first time I've had fried tacos.  And I thought tacos were nearly a perfect food.

a0r0065_hubdFhiwvsiQHA.text: Love their house margaritas! Especially when they are 1/2 off during happy hour!  The tacos are really good.  We really liked the island shrimp tacos.  We also had the chicken quesadilla and the guacamole dip.  All was very tasty.

kv3ot6Vlc_2fTB-n6U_zrw.text: Best Carnita Tacos ever! Great friendly staff and prompt courteous service. Love their Tinga tacos also and my friend really enjoyed the smoked chicken quesadilla

F0C3zs88QceJ3yHs5ZprfA.text: Would I go back here if/when I return to Scottsdale? Heck yeah!!!!!  When we were there last November there were 5 adults and one child in our family group wandering around the area looking for something to eat.  The one place we tried to get into you couldn't get in without a crowbar so we wandered past this, took a look at the menu and said why not!  So glad we did!  Good sangria, interesting patio area (felt more like an alley but cool), great chips and salsa, and good food at a good price.  No one, not even the kid complained about their food.  And this was the first time in my life I had fajitas with zucchini in them! YUM!  Plus, most veggies that come with fajitas are usually limp beyond limp and on the bland side.  Theirs had some spice to them.    With drinks and food our whole bill for all of us was around 100$.  Not bad for a place in Old Scottsdale.

EyrJ3mnssc55jJOZ0jhXxQ.text: We stumbled upon this place as we were looking for someplace to sit outside.  Being from NE, it seemed all the places in Scottsdale had on the heat--it was 70 degrees and too hot for heat for a NE girl.    We planned on just having a drink but were surprised by the incredible selection of tacos.  We started with the ceviche appetizer which was good.   Chips and salsa was also good, with two salsa selections.  We then had the cheese dip appetizer, which was awesome.  It was definately "real" cheese as opposed to some of the other "cheese"dips I have had where they are 1% cheese and 99% something else like cheese food.  The taco selection included lobster, shrimp, chicken, pork, salmon.  Quite impressive.  They were all great.    I'm no longer a tequila drinker but their selection is quite impressive and they make their margaritas all fresh with freshly squeezed lime juice.  I did take a sip of one, it was definately a winner!

K1X6xQHNndvn7P2NpGObAw.text: Very weak margaritas. When I spend $12 for a drink I need to actually taste the tequila. I'm pretty disappointed that a place with tequila in its name can't make a good drink. Meh.

ZN2sEGPJfl0z5zl3QuT6zg.text: The out-of-town family wanted Mexican, so we took them here. Since I don't eat meat, I'm not a fan of most Mexican restaurants because there is a limited selection for me. Here, the waitress recommended the shrimp and veggie tacos--both were great. And, I could even eat the refried beans (because there was no lard in it)! We all got Cadillac Margaritas and everybody was very pleased with their food. I also appreciated that they were so diligent about the reservation, a party of 8. They gave us a table upstairs that was private and spacious. For someone who doesn't typically consider getting Mexican food, it says a lot that I'm looking forward to going back here in the near future.

j9pSWAncZ8u6aHRvrJHf9A.text: Glad to say this place is still going strong a little over a year after my first visit/review. Wanna try it? Then visit on a Tuesday night for $1 tacos and $2 cervezas! They have amazingly good Tacos and Salsa, and an excellent Tequila bar. Do try the grilled corn on the cob.  Excellent place to hang all night with friends - great drinks, great food, great prices.

ir6lBksqRxBv808SXu6Ljw.text: I'm never disappointed when I come here! The food is delicious a few of my favorites are the chicken nachos, their taco stand which consist of 13 different tacos, the fajita bowl and to end the night with a churro sundae yummmy! They also have THE BEST selection of tequila! It's in the name.. Cien=100 agaves=the plants tequila comes from thus being Cien Agaves. And if you're looking for a great happy hour this is your spot

E0pHEtyg9pSTX4farzB_4w.text: Just stopped to have lunch. It was semi-decent Mexican food. Service was good but just thought food could be better. Guacamole was good but some of the chips were stale.

KcQuxsVhrWbvl-N6pGXjNg.text: Best happy hour everyday! Tinga tacos & chicken quesadillas are always delicious. Love that they give complimentary chips and salsa too. One of my favorite spots in old town!

dBsbm8TX__VFZtG35Rs1lA.text: Appetizers were half price!!! Ceviche was delicious Queso with pork Chorizo pizza Shredded chicken taco! It was sooo good!!!

CeTFABd3E_dP1uz9Vh0C6g.text: Truly bad service. I'm visiting from out of town and after confirming the reservation they 'called' to cancel. As I'm living abroad couldn't get the message and happens that they were 'apologetic' but we just were left without a reservation  Very underwhelming

B8V7HRJkHiUnKG4moDuqxw.text: Stopped by Cien Agaves on a Tuesday evening. Was delighted to find so much energy in a restaurant at 9pm on a weekday. Gotta love a place that has over 10 different types of tacos. We tried 5 and all were unique and tasty. Very good chips and salsa as well. I'm sure there is plenty more great items on the menu and can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Really good chips and salsa

J-tXsqGih-XWA34IsoqOag.text: Was a great place to just wander in off the street. The workers were very nice. The waitress did a good job. If I lived here I would come back again and again

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mom wins...
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Before and after decimation

jvUX72QWLTaGjyWDrhmj9A.text: Great Mexican food, never disappointed. We did have a large group and it was a little slow getting more food but otherwise good.

24cYk18o8-d0QUwbY1dDWg.text: Very nice place! Loved the outdoor fire pit seating, our server Audra was adorable! Very attentive didn't forget a thing, loved the salmon tacos. Will be back

ffFoCMx8L6LOWH0X4_Ys3g.text: Huge margarita , tequila and taco selection  The food is simple and good ! Which is good and large portion . They have great happy hour . I Will definitely be back

W_kLTfnJMuMfTfU9BhWkEw.text: 2nd time this week, because we like it so much the first time! Happy Hour was great, 3p-7p, and the Tacos here are great as well. We had The Tecate Fish & Carnitas Tacos, and loved them both. Also enjoyed the fresh guac!

-o068vD01dR1veBjlUhU_g.text: I recommend mainly for the fish tacos and VERY AWESOME margs.  I do love them margs here.  It's one of my two "go-to" marg spots in Old Town Scottsdale (the other being The Mission).  Happy hour is the beset value, and my family and friends LOVE the crispy chicken $2.00 Tinga Tacos they have during happy hour.  I've been here numerous times, at various times of happy hour, and my sister (who LOVES this place) had her graduation party upstairs.  That was very nice.  Them margs will kick your ass.  Prickly Pear is nice, as is the Cadillac, and the organic marg is a treat as well.  Interior looks like it's off the set of The Peach Pit from Melrose Place in Mexico City.  Outside patio is nice, especially in spring/fall at the fire pit.  No matter what, I always seem to come back.  Waiting to get a glimpse of Tori Spelling lurking in the back...

-l7bSXznjtZLRnvEA5kQLA.text: 3-3 1/2 stars is about right. The service was very good, no complaints. The food came out at an appropriate pace and I did not feel rushed at all. I ordered guacamole which was good, not great. Then I got three tacos, two shrimp and one veggie. The menu said the shrimp were hot. I interpreted this to mean spicy. But they were in no way spicy, not even medium. That was disappointing.   My other concern was the outdoor seating. To get a quick seating I agreed to sit outside--they said they had misters and I am really fine with the heat anyway as long as things are shaded. The misters however were pretty extreme. There was a fan blowing a cloud of mist on me the entire time. It was fine at first but got old after a while. Granted I could have requested another seat but I decided to tough it out. But by the end I was honestly a little chilly (yes, in 105 degree weather, amazing to me too).  People who came in after me refused to be seated in the area I was in--they likened it to a rain forest. Note the closer you are to the fan the worse it seems to be.    All in all I was ok with my meal but wonder if I shouldn't have chosen another option in Old Town.

9itlr3OX5xjY9y52kDuJrg.text: First time visitor to the restaurant.  Made the reservation thru open table.  Seated quickly, place was VERY busy because of the Golf tournament.   Staff was great, service was good, food was fine.  Cien Beet Bowl, was AMAZING.  Enjoyed the experience.  However, do NOT allow them to seat you on the second level.  VERY VERY LOUD because of low ceiling and poor acoustics.  Take the first floor or patio but don't sit upstairs.

MMKw3Q79D6FbJpoS-2FzSQ.text: I was very excited to try this place.  My fiancee and I have been looking for a place to have our rehearsal dinner.  We want a good Mexican restaurant since we have family coming in from all over the world.  We have not inquired on the cost of renting their second floor, but that aside I would be very happy bringing out-of-towners here for dinner.  Unfortunately I work late, so I cannot partake in their happy hour, but we still wanted to try the place, so we came on a Tuesday at about 9 pm.  I got a house margarita and my fiancee got a strawberry mimosa.  I was very happy with the margarita, it was not overly sweet.  The mimosa on the other hand was not good.  It tasted watery and the strawberry seemed fake.  We let the manager know and he immediately took it off our bill.  We were there for taco Tuesday, so we ordered a bunch of the shredded beef tacos.  They were quite good and much bigger than I was expecting.  All in all it was a very good place, the service was great and the food was great.  We will be back to try a larger selection next time, and hopefully we will be bringing our friends and family here before our wedding!

b5D7oG6niYZhIh9uhiYpCg.text: The waitress apparently preferred serving my male companion. The food came out cold. She kept mixing beverages up.  Poor service. Decent food served cold. Sexist waitress.  Just come here to drink, not have a good time.

-3DvqUJiN4pwgsONIRGXeQ.text: Pretty good Mexican spot. I had the fajita bowl with chicken added in. Would've liked more rice, corn and gauc instead of tons of beans and bell peppers personally. Normally get the chimichanga and nachos. Definitely recommend those. Friendly staff and great margaritas. Definitely recommend the Bobs Blue Hawaiian or prickly pear margarita. Nice place for a date or with friends/family.

ucQ_X9XcchVEwodzAPilpg.text: Just ok. We had the guacamole and margaritas. Everything needed salt. Service was ok. Nothing spectacular.

3L1qYQxU6cOgTtT4jTIJzg.text: Food was OK at best but the vibe is cool. Was a bit empty for a Friday night. I don't think I'd return but was worth a visit!

p1moYgv6u2JTEp95M0BwyA.text: This place is definitely under rated. I had the 2$ shrimp tacos on Tuesdays. It was worth more than I paid for it. I would recommend this place.

lX2-1Hy8rEiZ867PUO3cmw.text: Cien Agaves could easily be compared to heaven itself. They have tons and tons of tequila and really nice servers such as, Jacob Canevett, who is a miracle worker when it comes to busying tables. Highly recommended place to eat especially if Jacob Canevett is working. Gracias Cien Agaves!

I85gYnh-HFKojJIL90V9lw.text: Great tequila options is the highlight. Unfortunately all four of our orders were just blah. We had to send one meal back as the ahi bowl was swimming in soy sauce. Another meal lathered in cheese. I rarely find a meal that prompts me to give a subpart review. Disappointed to find such poor Mexican in Arizona.

qql6wJ_hk8ev3UKUaiuavg.text: Best service! Even on taco Tuesday when its absolute chaos inside! We had the best tacos and margaritas served by bartender and server Danielle! Will definitely be here more often!

DWXC7unFkrVkQFWnjjAYTw.text: Perfect lunch spot for our family. The margaritas were great. The food looked spectacular - but the flavors were just a little below par.

3gepcPV-76FOnpLvLFx5Ng.text: Excellent.  So much to say...we were in the area for three days and found ourselves at Cien Agaves twice, wishing for more.  Loved the Prickly Pear Margarita and the shrimp tacos and carne asada tacos the first day.  Went back for Happy Hour today. Usually happy hour drinks are pretty weak, but they kept high standards and served a delicious house margarita. And the guacamole with pomegranate seeds...yum.  Thank you Leon and Jeff for the great service.

Rll6XJNlSE1v62iXog7eqw.text: Ok tacos and margaritas.  Nothing to write home about

AzBUYmWmluZStR_gt6w1nw.text: The service was mediocre, but the happy hour was amazing. Unfortunately our waiter got my order wrong and my dates drinks wrong, twice. I didn't complain about my food being wrong, i just picked off what wasn't supposed to be on there. My date took the beer that was given to him , even though it was the wrong choice. Then ordered a second margarita and the server didn't ring it in until we asked him 10 mins later where the drink was. Our server was very apologetic and told us not to worry about the margarita and it was on him. When we got the bill we were delightfully surprised he also comped the beer and took $$ off my order that was wrong. He was great and it was unexpected - we will definitely be back!

mqtmzXPMwWenZ9HlwhSQjQ.text: We were seated upstairs which was extremely noisy. Could hardly carry a conversation. Food was good but we will only stay if we can sit outside.

Yogsc9tn-QgLKqLk1dE7mg.text: Today was definitely my last visit to Cien Agave. My son found a fly in his water! It was disgusting. A dead fly just floating there! The worst part was how it was handled. I informed the waitress, she appeared to be shocked and had no idea how it got there. She never apologized. I honestly dont think she meant to be rude, she sounded like she wasnt sure how to handle the situation.  I asked for the manager to express my concerns regarding cleanliness of the bar area. He seemed to preoccupied with the dinner rush coming in to address my concerns. He had one foot near my table and the other headed towards the incoming customers.  His lack of interest has most certainly lost my business and I will be sure to recant any positive recommendations I have made to friends, family, and coworkers.

LLaoOVE3Gy0KynQ1h2j0xQ.text: Great atmosphere and good food! Highly recommend this spot in old town scottsdale for happy hour or dinner!!

0tRQGtTZSujUAHNUheCYGg.text: Excellent food & service. I had chicken tacos and my husband had chicken fajitas! We left with smiles on our faces and full bellies. I highly recommend this Old Town Scottsdale special.

Iw-ckINIyeQeUM8ScjNOlQ.text: Me and my wife came all the way out from CA to see old town Flagstaff. The service was poor, and the food was mediocre. I was hoping for some authentic tex-mex food but the food is very bland. The margaritas we ordered were mainly just mixer and lime, and we only saw out waitress 2-3 times. Avoid if you're looking for a good experience and great food

a4SOVHxBlVWcGjEdCoONvQ.text: Happy hour is the best thing about this place so far, because originally the prices are  a little high.  My husband had the big ass burrito and for $10 it was really small and full of a lot of rice.  We've also seen bigger burritos at say, Chipotle even.   The quesedillas are good, but they're a bit too greasy, and the chicken is that shreddy texture that I don't really like.    I'd go back but for happy hour only, even though there's only one mixed drink that's half off and only appetizers are half off.

F_zHU5oJu3k2Lk8MJiZCww.text: Absolutely love this restaurant. My favorite in old town. Their Chipotle Chicken Quesadilla is AMAZING! The best happy hour in the area and a great atmosphere. I had my birthday here as well and they accommodated for all 30 of my friends on the second floor!

rbMBK-xP5t2_XJUPhwIARg.text: The tacos were so tasteless and we did not get a good service. The waitresses were so confused and stressed.

yISaVjpJVNzBoQbkdTdSRA.text: Great little spot in old Scottsdale.  They have a great happy hour specials and cute patio.  The food didn't knock out socks off but it was decent.    The wait staff was nice, location and atmosphere was good!

lOnaWPiIrs5fcSaC8c0hXA.text: Waitress was wonderful, music not too loud, habanero margarita was delicious and the tacos were meal sized!  Great spot!

G78tmpU4Y0TU92qBACpHbA.text: Wow - how have I walked by this place on so many vacations and not stopped in? It blows other Scottsdale Mexican food out of the water.   If I lived here, I would be there every Monday for shrimp tacos (2 bucks!!!) and 6 dollar BEER-A-RITAS - they have taco Tuesdays as well... Both types of shrimp are amazing - one is just grilled shrimp and rice - simple but tasty - and the other is kinda of a fried Asian-y shrimp with cabbage, also killer.   I didn't like their other stuff as much, but still good. The carne asada was steam, just nothing to write home about,. I really liked their crispy chicken taco, and the chorizo and potato taco is a great idea but falls flat because the chorizo is sort of bland - which is strange for a place I found all their food to be sort of spicy.   Came back for lunch our last day before leaving, I will definitely be back! .

MWZ-rv2_62RaMII93ficlQ.text: So good! The carne asada taco was amazing, shrimp Diablo taco was very good and the shredded beef taco was good but a little dry (needed more sauce). The habanero margarita was really good and not very spicy but the star of the meal was the churro sundae! SO GOOD!

dQ08dOKJcyQe38Bs28Tu7g.text: The senora and I decided to stop by after talking a walk through town. We were seated right away and looked at the menu. They have a lot of Tequilas to chose from if you want to enjoy sampling shots. The Margarita list was suave too. I had a special Margi and the senor had a Mojito. Both were very tasty.   The food was fine, not great but very good. We decided to sample tacos. Each of the choices were pretty good and the dish came with rice and beans. It's a nice place to stop and enjoy tasty drinks.

iOXoORj-HIzj0EhCzpRGEA.text: So fun, really love sitting at the bar hanging out with crazy drunk locals. The tacos are terrific and "The Local" margarita in a pint glass is the way to go.  Marisa loves the ceviche too.

FhUqYLBit5S_3ZK29y-WwA.text: I would recommend coming here for margaritas. The food was OK but the margaritas are definitely the highlight.  Yeah margs are really good and of course anything in old town is always fun.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Check out this delicious queso verde

LUkIQ93p7ZEgzsVR6zx6Cw.text: My husband and I spent the night in Scottsdale at an air-bnb. Our host suggested this restaurant. We arrived during happy hour and enjoyed the $5 Cien-a-Ritas, the tinga tacos, half priced appetizers such as queso blanco and ceviche as well as the tres taco especial. The ceviche was ok but the queso blanco was surprisingly good. All the tacos were very good. The service was good. The atmosphere was upbeat and fun. Great meal at a great place.

LnERoPTla4-s1kLo1bCf1A.text: Bartenders Jeremy and MichelleMichael were at the top of their game!  It was both happy hour and tinga taco night! Jeremy was able to arrange for my tacos to be wrapped in lettuce!  Amazing.  We also got the guacamole (which has pomegranate) and I used as salad dressing on my cien salad.  It was all so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tinga tacos wrapped in lettuce.

Dvz6TnttKhE3KTh3OmiPHw.text: 4/5 stars because of the ambiance, street corn and cucumber jalepeno marg. Tacos weren't that amazing...ok but nothing special. I would come back and try something different though.

R1HfSj6OKe3zUL9XOyI63g.text: When I'm in Arizona, I just crave good Mexican food so naturally that makes me want great chips, salsa and margaritas. Generally, it's easy to get a good margarita and chips, but the quality of the salsa and food varies drastically from one Mexican place to the next.  I'm happy to say, that despite this being in a touristy part of town, the Yelp reviews are spot on. This place is fantastic with the best salsa I've ever eaten (and I've had hundreds over my lifetime), great chips, awesome food and most importantly fantastic margaritas.  Best of all, the service was fast and friendly so I had zero complaints about this place. Well, I didn't care for the 30 minute wait, but it was worth it as I loved the everything about this place - especially the atmosphere.   I'm so glad I found this place and I'll definitely return the next time I'm in Arizona.

s35C5VkeAktqPZ5WYanJJg.text: We came here for Happy Hour after leaving the Scottsdale Culinary Festival. It was within walking distance of the Festival, in the shopping district. I got the Sangria and Regular Margarita. The Sangria was ok, not enough fruit at the bottom. The Margarita was good.

fJ8DSEdS7cqAhnDljzni6A.text: I moved to North Scottsdale in 2015.  As somebody who loves to eat out and appreciates the opportunity to taste new cuisines and food, I keep a keen eye on the restaurant scene.  But like most people I use filters to sort thru new food places that show up on my radar.  Cien Agaves has been one such place. The only reason it has taken me over 30 months to come and eat here has been my perception that this place being in the middle of Old Town is probably a tourist trap. Not really True! After lunching here two days ago, I am convinced of the quality of the food served here.  Also the whole ambiance is great. Fantastic, but funky, art on the walls. Great music.  So I am coming back.  I ordered the Tres Tacos! One each of shredded beef, diablo shrimp and carnitas.  OMG! Great flavor; outstanding texture; optional hot sauce to raise the temperature.  Gracias!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The tres tacos!!!
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa!!!
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Art on the walls!!!

5npb0qoanlA-OmLeqT2h-Q.text: Horrible, we booked the outside terrace months in advance, and had email receipts to prove it. The hostess and manager told us people who randomly showed up with no reservation needed it first,  acted as if it wasn't their problem - even though their own manager confirmed it was reserved for us. It  threw off our evening. We are out of town guests and would like to have trusted the management to take care of us based on our communication... you can't trust them clearly.   There are a lot of choices in Scottsdale, this restaurant is trash.

FzcZ3gGviblp9FOnGqMcTQ.text: Really loved my fajita salad! The guacamole was a little onion-y. Strawberry marg was good! We ordered way too much food for 2 people so keep that in mind! Great service too and the food came quick.

Js4j7-PHJh45-hotZPTJlQ.text: Fun ambiance, historic setting, delicious & savory Mexican cuisine, jaw dropping tequila list, and a legendary reputation really make this what it is!  I ordered their tacos of carne asada and carnitas and they did not disappoint!  My waitress Teresa was on point in all facets of her job!  Couldn't have been better!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious tacos!

bXJVWGG2FHjhOoT-jL7YeQ.text: Great service and the food was incredible!! The drinks (margs specifically) were okay, a bit watered down and a tad too sugary for my taste. The outside seating was great as well as they had misters and kept the area cool for a warm summer night

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GKNtwOjhpCbf-zKFR_7eCA.text: Best margaritas in Arizona! Special spot In heart for Cien! Great creative atmosphere and the food and people are great! Yay tequila!!!!!

CyadWh0YAaPUzWAuI0vMrQ.text: What A disappointment!  This restaurant had been highly recommended by several people and we were able to get a reservation ..which was great!  however the food was marginal at best.  We ordered the queso and the cheese crisp.  The cheese crisp was flavorless and the queso was not edible. I ordered a shredded beef taco with no sour cream and my husband ordered a TECATE fish  taco.  We each took one bite asked for the check paid and left.  Oh and my taco came out with sour cream on it.

0XVY3yWo6b1LtV51uoIFIg.text: The shrimp tacos were extremely plain just served with a little rice had to ask for more condiments and sauce they brought out sauces without spoons and took forever to acknowledge that we needed the  bill and had to go back to get or bill after they asked which took longer very plain and unprepared the art is better than their service they need to make their food more appealing

CIBszHiHFRdlw1WceBPDAA.text: My friends and I went here last night and had an awesome experience! We had been to two other bars in old town and were fed up with unpleasant bartenders and bad service but Michael-Anne was awesome and treated us so well! She made us the best strawberry frozen margarita I've ever had and answered my questions! The nachos are on the appetizer list but big enough to split between three people and quite delicious. Would for sure go here again, thanks for ending our night on such a good note!

zwxWfSWkgmaROSoLDSt2BA.text: We do like to come back to this Mexican restaurant.  Its always buzzing with energy!  service is good. Tacos and ceviche are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A

8548lqSVNSDBla99VSsUfw.text: Comparable to my favorite Mexican restaurant back home, this authentic eatery features a wide selection of traditional favorites and a good selection of beer, cocktails, etc. We were seated outside in an alley way type setting which had a very nice feel to it. Though it was a chilly desert night, they had propane powered, heated lamps keeping guests warm. They also provided free chips and salsa with not one, but two distinct flavors - mild verde and a medium traditional salsa. The chimichanga I had was a new taste for me compared to the same dish I had back at home. The meat was rich and flavorful and not mushed like back home in NJ. Great presentation on it and two different sauces as well (server offer each one or both...both, duh).  My wife had a chicken quesadilla and she enjoyed it as well. We are only spending a weekend in Scottsdale and the restaurants we pick are somewhat of a hit or miss but this was definitely a nice hit. We enjoyed it and didn't find out until later the popularity of this place.   Recommended for any first time visitors to the area and of course the locals too. Good shopping in area as well. Easy access to dessert across the street at the infamous Sugar Bowl of Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FtY9jrZSRSEpxUBPZh2LVQ.text: Great tacos and tequila! Amazing prizes! Wide variety of tequila! The services was friendly...Will be back!

FI0CtExu8CJOSUO--YoBYA.text: Stopped in for a early dinner because this place had good reviews and was right down the street.  As other reviewers have mentioned, the atmosphere was very pleasantly bright and colorful, and the chips and salsa were decent.   Upon first sitting down, our waitress spilled salsa on our table which also splattered lightly on my belongings.  She was very quick and attentive to clean up.  I was also given a dirty napkin that had someone's leftover food pieces in it.  She also very quickly saw that I had a new one when I asked.   I ordered a steak burrito, enchilada style and my boyfriend ordered a shredded beef chimichanga.   My burrito was 95% rice and was very bland. When I did have flavor, it was that of over cooked burned steak. When a couple pieces would fall out of my burrito, they were completely black.   The enchilada sauce tasted like it was out of a can or very terribly seasoned.    My boyfriends chimichanga actually tasted somewhat pleasant. The meat was cooked well. However the chimichanga itself was over fried and the ends were burned. His also contained mostly rice.  I would say based on our experience, you are paying way too much for low quality "Mexican" food if you come here.  My burrito was 16 dollars and it contained mostly only rice, which is probably almost no expense to the restaurant.   If you drive down the street a little bit farther to Julio's, you can get a high quality, meat packed burrito at half the cost with soo much more flavor.    I only ended up eating a quarter of the burrito while the rest sadly when to waste.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A 16 burrito filled pretty much just rice...

9nXGPLksP2uBdqjRiRr_YA.text: The menu looked awesome online and the food lived up to expectations. The service, not so much.  We arrived about 3:45 on a Sunday. The place was maybe 2/3 full, and we were seated right away. Our server was unfortunately lackluster from the start. Only my son was ever brought a water. Two of us ordered alcoholic drinks and one friend ordered a soft drink, and we were never asked about getting refills. The server didn't check on us.  The actual food and drinks, though, were fantastic. They brought us out the standard gratis chips and salsa, and in addition to that we ordered the  queso verde. That was seriously good. Tons of melted cheese, meat, and pleasant spices. I had a strawberry margarita (also fantastic) while my husband had a bottle of beer.  Our server was right in praising the beet salad when I ordered it. The dish was exceptionally good and I've never had the like at any other restaurant. My husband paired two of the appetizer foods, a bowl of green chile pork and the tinga chicken quesadilla. He loved both. I had a sample of the quesadilla and I was impressed by the heavy load of meat. They don't skimp. Our son had a kid's quesadilla and didn't have much, but he's a picky eater. Our friend had the chimichanga, which was huge.  I would be open to coming here again because the kitchen and bar know what's going on.

oQ0i7udUQtIoe_zHoOKydw.text: Food was decent but the inside environment was extremely noisy and too much stimulation especially for our child with mild sensory issues. So, we chose to sit on the patio.  Our server was quite pleasant and gave some good menu recommendations. However there were several mistakes with our order; the service was slow and we never received the salsa we requested. Nor were we ever offered chips and salsa.  With so many places to choose from in the area, I'm not confident that our experience would entice us to return.

XPxiH68eJRAPkCz5A5pXKA.text: Cien Agaves really delivered. They're food is always amazing and service is impeccable! Our server Audra was considerate and thoughtful of our dining needs! Thanks for a great meal!!

vhJ52rcFSDeZ4cyt4riypA.text: It's my go to place for cheap Mexican food and happy hour booze. The staff is nice and friendly.

N8eOup4KRVCBpK7JbSub2w.text: If you're a tequila fan, this is the place for you. Fortunately for me, I have enough sobriety that I was able to breeze past the beckoning of my former friend the agave plant and head straight for the fresh shrimp ceviche with perfectly ripe avocado slices.  The fajita salad did not disappoint, featuring amazingly tender, smoky beef and fresh veggies in an addictively airy tortilla bowl. I ordered the creamy jalapeno dressing, which was a little bit. In retrospect, I would have also ordered the creamy cilantro and mixed the two.  Our server was friendly and appropriately attentive, and we overheard other servers delivering similarly great service.  Only reason for 4 stars was the outdoor dining area was a little plain and dirty, a busboy was smoking outside near the tables, and the inside was overstimulating. But for a tequila bar, maybe those are five-star conditions.

2629IApchtxD0jfVQGiL_Q.text: They have a huge selection of tequila here. From cold to room temperature, they have it for you, and you can even have them in different flavors. Their tres tacos is a good deal for about $14. Comes with corn chips, two sides of your choice like beans and Spanish rice. You can also mix and match your tres tacos too. They have a fantastic outdoor seating area which at night, it's delightful to be out with your friends, enjoying the nice meal. Service was great, and the staff gave great recommendations.  Until then, Cheers! ~ :p
