grBbWjCjucM9_7-lb5JuGQ.text: Some of the worst Mexican food ever! Their website advertised chile relleno that didn't exist. Food came out cold and tasteless. Tequila was watered down. Bad.

PviNfheT_4xfFxP0g2Y1Yw.text: Love that this restaurant supports local schools! Thanks for hosting a fundraiser for RedforEd!

-muEVzFvBCySUxTl8Uv99w.text: I haven't been to this restaurant yet but I heard they support the RedforEd cause so I WILL be eating there soon. I've heard great things about this place so I'm looking forward to visiting and updating my review.

X7eorIeQoAURQ377ErSexw.text: Thanks Cien Agave for serving the community with great food, drink, HH, & service! Also thanks for the support of the Red for Ed community efforts.

PZZ4Xzk68JMv1zrtR_16Kw.text: I had the Island Shrimp Taco and the Tecate Fish Taco which were both delicious but very spicy for my taste. These were served with beans (black or refried) and rice. A bit pricy for the quality  since beans and rice are also a standard. Had the tacos been less spicy, my opinion of the quality might have changed.

MHaWhbMdpRDzbzGRpANd3A.text: Had a great meal of Carne Asada tacos and a cheese crisp. The Local margarita was fantastic and Marissa, our waitress, took very good care of us. We will defiantly be back.

zZ42gQR6pa5XUijCyYfCmQ.text: Great tacos! There were so many delicious choices on the menu! The fajitas were delicious and so fresh! I came here with a group of teacher friends because I saw this business supports the #redfored movement and I seek out business who support the community. AND, the food was so good!

s3iYkNdhpDQXpt2wwDoFFg.text: Thank you Cien Agave for celebrating teachers last night with your #redforedaz event. You are the first in our community to reach out for support. The service and food was excellent as always!  @Azedunited

IWaKHKMc9L9H2Ueg6R4Jrw.text: They are the most gracious and welcoming staff. They have a great happy hour. Great food and drinks. I will definitely be back.

OnIfO7Ej7xLWcDW5kwYSqw.text: Amazing food and incredible service. The guacamole is a must! The corn was something different and DELICIOUS! They had great happy hour prices and the margaritas were impeccable. There was great variety- try them all!!!

zTgP7fcRPnuLAWS_3iJ4xw.text: I ate here two days ago. Loved the guacamole. The appetizer options for happy hour were great

mxBPDSsFFr0gjNemCKhK2Q.text: Happy hour was amazing!  Our first time in old Scottsdale and we happen to be right on time for happy hour!  The house margaritas were great.  We sampled almost every appetizer on the menu and made a whole meal of it for a large party.  Nothing went to waste because everything was delicious.  Cheese dip stood out as the best app!!

Hf3E5NBAGbs0C2DgDypqhQ.text: So good! And the staff was super knowledgeable about the tequilas! The carnitas tacos were tender and delicious and the guac was spicy and perfect!

Iyl8clI_J49BFMvE3-XiZQ.text: Unless you are looking for a bar scene - which my family and I were not - everything here is pretty much middle of the road. The food is fine and the service was OK. We could see how this place is enjoyable for those upstairs, and those at the bar watching baseball. But for a couple or a family looking for food, this is probably not the first place to try. It's not bad, but it's pretty loud and better suited for a more rambunctious crowd.

65YvBTc5Mifh0MpHvx4B7w.text: Great place and accommodating for kids. The prickly pear margarita was a hit with my wife!

BI9XRCJ8AOLzN81UFUI7gA.text: Came tonight with some friends and got seated pretty quick, considering it was pretty busy. Service was decent and the food came out on time and correct. Water tasted unfiltered though, like tap on ice. Not so refreshing. Note for service staff, I'm in the biz too and understand it's busy for this smaller sized restaurant but slow down a little bit. Watched a girl run full sprint like a NFL try out into the kitchen through the double doors and could have done some real damage to herself or someone else. Remember, your on stage at all times and ppl are watching you. Tacos fiesta!

mMr608grGbf7y-oNvw1aVA.text: So this is becoming one my favorite spots for Happy Hour. The tacos are delicious as well as the Margaritas. My friend brought me here to try it out one tuesday when the tacos are $1 and now it is our place to meet up!

R2gPTiJ8vFNVK1HTnb9YNQ.text: Great ambiance- a nice mix of modern Scottsdale, old school western scottsdale, and latin touches. The tacos are fantastic and the menu is flexible so you can try many different ones. Check this place out!

mmelgXZqrLyT9AlLYkmXoQ.text: I love this place for HH but for dinner on the weekends it can be a pain to find parking... pretty typical mexican with good margaritas... no need for me to reinvent the wheel since i feel the same as most of the other reviewers

1oSE5jkueBA3oIlkCEdGtw.text: Great atmosphere, food was great, staff was amazing, beergarita's are wonderful.

PTyxcG2Mft984qenIGt0BA.text: fun place to go and grab a drink and bite to eat, again not your typical scottsdale crowd which I love.  I especially enjoy their tortilla soup and a beef taco on taco tuesday...totally reasonable and fun spot at night. See you tomorrow cien agaves for $2 taco's :)

-Ru9-x-dvAzvdR8Em6I4lg.text: We went to this Mexican establishment last Sunday night and we ordered the organic margaritas and we could taste any tequila and they put so much soda water in this drink it tasted like a soda. I ordered the taco combo, one ahi taco which was good however the crispy chicken taco was very bland and tasteless. The rice tasted old and you can tell they put it on the grill to reheat because it had burnt patches ...yuk! Over all I wouldn't spend the $$ to eat here again.

OK4MxbxqAmMP3XM49int5Q.text: This place is saved by the salsas for the chips. Again lame tacos in the traditional non-mexican style. Nice patio to sit and relax, but they should train better their waitress.

p2XsvZQGbBITSjcZq0iNkw.text: You can't beat Taco Tuesday's at Cien Agaves! My family and friends have made it a weekly ritual and we can hardly go the entire week without craving those crunchy, beef tacos! At $1 each, I order two, with a side of black or refried beans and I'm all set. They serve complimentary chips with two salsas--tomato fresca and spicy tomatillo (my personal favorite). Last night we tried the Street Corn for the first time. It comes topped with a smokey chili blend, crumbled cotija cheese and with the full-husk to use as a handle. It's just a bit spicy, full of flavor and highly recommended (and just fun to eat)! There are also $2 Tecates so you can have a few with your meal and still come out paying only about 10 bucks. Really?? The restaurant is always hoppin' with happy people of all ages. It's well worth the trip, and maybe it will become a Tuesday ritual of yours too!

is_UDitgCKVwIUzyGpk9GQ.text: I love tacos and Cien Agaves has so many too choose from and they're all amazing!! The margaritas are also to die for!

lOztFw7lDntdTBxLyFcMtQ.text: Wow that is what i call a carne asada taco, plus i had my first $3 marg that you can actually taste the tequila in. Wow! Chips where nice and hot had to salt then of course so i can drink faster. Salsa was good, did not like the green one though, red one had plenty of flavor asked for the hot sauce to heat it up. The Carne Asada was actually real steak. Nice! will be back for sure, rumor has it the have taco specials tomorrow too.

K9wMmaY-04Izz1NcRwDDhg.text: Go on Tuesdays!  They have $1 tacos... just be sure to have them clarify which ones; not all of them are a $1.  I have been here twice so far and the service the first time was attentive... the second time my waitress seemed a little spacey but got the job done:).  Today I decided to try their house made guacamole which was very tasty and their chips and salsas are not to be missed.  So far I have only tried their shredded beef taco and the chorizo and potato taco... they both were really good.  I have not had a chance to try a margarita yet because I have only been during work... but a see a happy hour in my future and Cien Agave:).

S3L_Y8ps0HPt4LsuTe4nzg.text: Ate here last night with family..the food was just OK..atmosphere was loud and crowded..service was OK..the house margarita was fantastic..

3Gg4EiwTLyQW4TDWJTpSVw.text: Food was decent but not consistent. One lobster taco was cooked perfectly and the other was like rubber. I did enjoy the flavors, though, and the presentation was okay.  Still, two stars because neither my dinner-mate or I actually ordered a lobster taco at all. I knew we were in trouble when the server didn't write anything down and we both had a three taco combo. Talking to said waiter/bartender was impossible because he was in such a hurry and it was so loud anyway. I tried to catch his attention once as he ran by but that didn't work out...  So we ate what we got.  Why were we seated in the bar, you ask? We made a dinner reservation online at Cien Agaves' website but something was wrong with the system that day. Not sure if that was a technical or human fault but whatever. The only option was outside... At the end of June... Or in the bar. I actually saw another couple go spend some time outside and then leave, fanning themselves.  I'd like to try some of the other offerings but that's not likely to happen until it looks like they get their systems sorted out. That includes order taking, reservation taking, and uniform cooking.  Will check back in the future to see what other people have to say.

Ddqob1IWU_TYciPkxDmDhg.text: Great tacos, super selection of tequila and good service.

GsqF1msgJtRH_6M8wLJVEg.text: Arriving in Scottsdale on a Saturday morning, we chose this restaurant based on a desire for Mexican, the Yelp reviews, and the fact that few other restaurants seemed to be open.  We were delighted with the food. We started with the complimentary salsa - the tomato version was ok, but the green chile varietal was excellent and we ordered more - and a generous portion of guacamole.  My wife ordered the tinga taco, which is chicken in chipotle. The chicken was outstanding; I've never had chicken so tender. I had the lobster taco (lobster, fried, and servied with coleslaw) and the carne asada taco, with a hint of lime. Both were delicious.  Service was good and all of the staff were very friendly towards our sleeping baby.   Would definitely go there again. No complaints whatsoever.

Xg2TTD2md1NLwKCbV7uYRg.text: I had really hoped this place would be better since the location was great (right in the middle of Old Scottsdale) and the inside looked nice, but that was about as far as it went. Although our waitress was nice, the service took FOREVER, and the place was not even full at lunch time. $10 for a regular margarita at lunch time seemed a little pricey to me too. We split the 3 taco plate and had a fish taco, lobster taco and carne asada taco. Both the fish and lobster tacos were fried, not lightly fried, but heavily battered and greasy. The carne asada did not have a lot of flavor. Probably OK to go here in a pinch, but there are probably hundreds of places better than this!

rQPaX8_fXvMN9kb1NVk-Fg.text: Awesome tequila list. Enjoyed variety of tasty tacos. Friendly and fast service. Staff opened early when they saw a line starting outside. That is impressive customer service.

iHSFXEuBkZM1lQbhs78UCg.text: Just got back from here and loved it! My fiance and I enjoyed our shredded beef tacos, they weren't the greatest but they weren't the worst. I absolutely loved that they were $1 each since it's there Taco Tuesday special. I thought the cheese tasted funny, and my fiance apparently doesnt like deep fried tacos (WHAT?!?! How can you not like deep friend fatty goodness??) but other then that, yumm. We also ordered the shrimp ceviche, delicious. And I also ordered the Cucumber Margarita, which was recommended to me by our server. That was awesome, extremely refreshing. The service was fast and friendly, and I will definitely be back here!

amTo_UK55rZcwuyjbgwR-A.text: Food and atmosphere are just Ok here.  Probably shouldn't have gotten an enchilada in a more "tex mex" kinda place ... however the service and margaritas are definitely something everyone should experience!

cLuVMpTHlzD-SPJeqKP_aA.text: Cien agaves has ruined other Mexican restaurants for me because they serve the  best margaritas in old town. Hands down.

b0IXqu0nT9dr40VZIsupQQ.text: One of my favorite happy hour restaurant here. They have great price for drinks, tacos and appetizers. Ppl are generally nice, food is good and good atmosphere. Especially I really recommend to go on Tuesday
