tz41hKm6YP4aJF8fSGhBPA.text: This place was great! Located in an older downtown area of Scottsdale, it was the perfect place to eat. We were able to sit outside and enjoy some warm weather with our margaritas! They had great guac, and chips and salsa. We both enjoyed our potato tacos!

fgE-WrLfhhyl3pA-MidyxQ.text: Really good Mexican food and Margaritas.  We had our rehearsal dinner here and they were very accommodating.  The only issue was that we ran out of food and it took a long time to replace it.

FnNVzMj-0qv5f4E5KIWTJQ.text: Love, love this place. My all time favorite Mexican Restaurant in AZ. Authentic mexican food, great prices, good quality food and fun atmosphere. Only down side is if you go on the weekend at night or anytime during happy hour you can wait a good amount of time to be seated as this place is very small!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Combo #5: Tinga Taco and Cheese Enchilada w/rice &amp; black beans.

jotz6WvBo1adGiOjLg7zIg.text: Fairly good and spicy tacos, efficient and polite service. If looking for bar scene this seemed to be happening - went on a weekend evening and it was quite busy and a bit loud, so not for a cozy intimate outing but a fine spot for tacos!

AcAwjn-M5Og4_DEM1QHgnQ.text: Happy hour is too good to miss! Food is pretty standard (good) Mexican with a solid location and great specials.

xD84Con7vOvSBuMquSB53Q.text: My friend and I ate a decent lunch here. Although, it wasn't the best or even second best taco place I've been too. Taco Tuesdays only refer to one taco on the menu, that being shredded beef. We ordered four shredded beef tacos, two fish tacos.   Tip: you may order soft corn tortilla tacos instead of the hardshell for the shredded beef. I preferred the fish taco over all the dishes I tried. In the end, I just picked out the meat and veggies and did not eat the rest of the soggy tortilla.   We also ordered the house margarita. It was very satisfying! As it was a hot day, it did quench the thirst. Other than that, I'd say I would only come back for happy hour or if everything off the menu was half priced

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shredded beef and recite fish

qdy3TgAFyrcapXhTj1LLhQ.text: Great service, food, and margaritas. This place was great! I decided to have my birthday dinner here after reading reviews about "the best Mexican restaurants in Scottsdale." I made a reservation online for 9 people- super easy. The day of the dinner they called to confirm my reservation. When we arrived, our table was already set with waters and chips and salsa for the table-which I thought was a really nice touch. Our waiter was very friendly and had great recommendations for margaritas and tacos. And although we didn't take advantage of the happy hour, I saw a sign while we were there, and it looked great. I will definitely be back.

hU7unzsMw2xWgCJlR7gUAg.text: Honest review of the food. BEWARE!  Fellow yelpers you really let me down. I have to assume that the ratings for this place are based on the drinks or pure bribery. I was in AZ so I thought it fitting to have Mexican food. This place had some of the best reviews as far as Mexican places went on yelp and I decided to check it out.  The waitress was very pleasant. and the place was pretty much empty. I showed up around 8:30PM on a Sunday in November.  ATMOSPHERE I give them kudos for the excellent music. A mix of current tunes and some 90s favorites. They also have some great TVs. Temperature wise, even with the door open, it was a tad chilly and I wore my coat. Be it known I mentioned to the hostess when I walked in it was chilly, and after no change, I let her know I was going to get my coat, which also led to no change in the temperature. Glad I had brought it.   FOOD It started out well. I had the chips and salsa (you get green and red) I am a sucker for green salsa, and this did not disappoint. You do need to ask for the chips and salsa if you want them. I'm not the first yelper to mention this. Would be good it the management got the hint and reminded their servers to offer it. I put a little of the red salsa (which is Hot) in with the green to give it a little more zing. The chips were excellent.  Since the Tacos seemed to be all the rave on yelp (maybe because they are $1 on Tuesdays) I got the platter of 2 which comes with rice and beans. Here is what I thought: -Rice - bland, (ok, i know its rice, it wasn't bad rice, just not knocking my socks off. I liked that it was soft and not dry.) -Refried beans- also pretty unexciting, but since they were the most edible thing on my plate much of it was eaten TACOS Part One -Grilled Ono Taco - this fish taco was very dry. even adding salsa/chalula couldn't save it.  I think this taco, with the fish cooked properly could be good. -Carnitas  Taco - This shredded pork taco was insanely greasy and unexciting. One bite was all I could manage. The cilantro and onions were barely discernible accompaniments.  So the waitress comes over and asks how everything is. I take a deep breath and let her know about the tacos. She sweetly asks if she can get me anything else. Still feeling optimistic I go for 2 other tacos that she recommends which are popular ones during their happy hour. She walks away.  A gentleman comes out and explains they are going to make me some replacement tacos and apologizes. I'm not sure who he actually was. No introduction was made. I told him I was optimistic and would definitely give it another shot. Just in the name of full disclosure, the waitress knew I was a yelper. I mentioned it a few times and I was taking photos of all the food she brought out.  TACOS Part Deux In general, so many toppings were piled onto these two replacement tacos I think the chef was honestly trying to mask the mediocrity of the meat. (cheese, lettuce, tomato, sour cream - Taco Bell special) -Shredded Beef Taco -  beef still a little dry, which can be expected. Didn't taste the green chiles it was allegedly marinated in. Unexciting -Tinga taco - this shredded chicken taco was ok. It was marinated in chipotle sauce but was definitely still lacking something.  I have to say there was not an onion in sight within this 2nd round of tacos. I wonder if that's what was missing from the flavor. Lack of seasoning. I can't imagine this is how Southwesterners like this food.   Also, these two replacement tacos (which didn't come out with rice and beans because I said I did not require another serving) came out on a tiny plate. I need to mention that another Yelper has also complained that squeezing two tacos on a small plate is extremely unwieldy. I looked like a little kid spilling tomato and cheese all over the table. Chef - Please just plate the two tacos on a large plate.  I will probably go back one more time and try a few more just to make certain I didn't just have bad luck. It seems some of the other reviewers had tacos which I did not try. If my opinion does change I will make sure to update the review.  $12 with tax/tip. I had a water.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2 tacos on a tiny plate because they want to laugh while you make a huge mess
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa (excellent)
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2 tacos platter - Shredded pork (greasy), grilled ono (dry)

wd8Dq_pqY9B38tr1uS9Rjw.text: Best. Taco. Salad. In. Phoenix.  Seriously, that stuff is amazing. This is probably because they make all of their own salad dressings. I get 2 or 3 of them on the side with every salad and that works so well for me. I get to taste a range of amazing flavors, appreciate the talent of their chef, while moderating the amount of extra calories I'm eating.  Another plus? The steak on it is amazing. Lean, pink in the center and tender! I really have to give it to them for producing such an amazing salad. Puts everyone else in PHX to shame.

8S6tpWiXS_ZnusyVVpDiXQ.text: I went in Tuesday looking for a new Taco Tuesday spot and definitely found my new place. It was delicious and my buddy and I had a great time . The food was delicious and the beer cold. A super solid selection of tequilas turned a great meal into a definite danger will robinson night. All around a wonderful time and the bartender (I think her name was Michael Ann) was hilarious. I will be back on Tuesdays and any other time I need some tacos and wonderful times. Kudos Cien, you have a new regular!

qVIYeXWNffrwoOpf_UWIbw.text: Great Saturday night vibe. Beer-Rita's are a must! Bring all of your friends. Service is friendly and prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beer - &#39;Rita

HogZan-ktPn0eLpoyD8ULw.text: Last night was my third time to this fresh and well-spirited (both figuratively and literally) tequila bar. It has not disappointed...  Aside from the pretty but grumpy hostess, I have nothing but praise and accolades. The tacos have been amazing each time, the fajitas had that smell that just makes you inhale and savor, and the tequila collection is probably the best I've seen - over 100, mostly high end blancos, repos, anejos and even some of the best (still in production) XAs around. 100 tequilas in a year and you're considered royalty with a picture on the bar and happy hour pricing for life - if you're from Phoenix why aren't you already there? Heck, I only come into town now and then but I'm aiming high. Like I said, the best shelf around.   The servers have been super friendly and attentive, the 'tenders each time have stopped mixing just long enough to say "hey" when we walked in. I'm giving the service 4.9 stars (just that hostess that one time...)  Parking is easy, the place is fun. If you haven't come for a tequila pour yet, you're missing out.  "DJ 1942 neat, please?"

pErFEMSF-Dtt3gqPcXsw8w.text: The tacos are top notch.  I have had most of them and can't pick just one to say it is the best! I do like the fish taco.  The avocado margarita is fantastic as well!  I doubt you can find these in many places.

naXkzkexIC7c6KHs8tgrDg.text: I wanted to give this place five stars but due to the strange encounter with the host and hostess I can't. When four of us arrived at 4:30pm the hostess told us there was a 15-20 minute wait as we stood in an empty restaurant. They told us the kitchen was backed up and they couldn't seat any more people. We were fine with that and just wanted to sit down and enjoy a couple drinks. After some back and fourth one of them reluctantly took us to the island just past the bar threw down our menus and left. We could hear them griping about the situation from our table. It was just such a strange and awkward encounter I had a hard time enjoying my meal. After this however we had great service from our server and the food was delicious and incredibly fast considering the kitchen was backed up when we walked in. My favorite from the meal was the guacamole with pomegranate seeds on top. I would love to give this place another try in the future.

7yZTrTdKLLrepJk5x7l0bw.text: This is when you wish Yelp had a 0 star option.  On the surface, this restaurant has 3-star appeal. My husband and I were excited to enjoy a well-crafted margarita with some upscale tacos, and we left satisfied with our experience. Yet, when my husband wound up with an awful bout of food poisoning that kept him in bed for the entire next day, we instantly regretted our experience.  Being on vacation, this wound up costing us expensive tickets to two spring training games and time with our friends that we hadn't seen in years. When I called the restaurant to alert them of the issue in their kitchen, the manager was rude and accusatorial.   The manager said it was impossible that the food poisoning came from them, because it takes 24 hours for food poisoning to occur. When I mentioned that the Mayo Clinic disagrees and that it only takes hours, she went as far as arguing the Mayo Clinic's research.  She said that the restaurant requires customers to get a doctor's note verifying that the food poisoning came from their food. Well, since it was 7:00 on a Friday night and we were trying to salvage what was left of our shortened vacation, we weren't trying to pay $500 for an unnecessary ER visit.   Food poisoning is bad, yet Cien Agaves' customer service is worse.

cIlwrgWPKzliKHzWc1GK4Q.text: Stopped in after a spring training game, and was happy to see I made it in time for happy hour!  $3.50 house margarita, and it was tasty :)  We were sat right away and after drinks were brought chips and salsa.  The salsa was amazing!!!  It was so good, my whole family liked it, we polished off the basket in no time.  I ordered the chicken fajita bowl, it was really good and inexpensive, only $9.  The rice especially was delish, authentic with a bit of kick.  The kids burritos were a good size for the price and milk for them was only $1.  All and all a great stop for dinner.  Kid friendly but still adult and fun atmosphere, good food and good service.  They also had TVs everywhere, so we were able to watch basketball.  Great location and in an easy to walk area. For our family, it was a good choice!  Enjoy!

4TW664VF3GM1Q0XaBlX4sw.text: Very good and we even ordered our dinner as take out! Three of us ordered a ten taco package. At first, I did not think it would be enough; however, I was full after eating 3 tacos. The carne Asada and chorizo with potato was fantastic! Note: the menu on yelp is not an updated menu. Also, the pico is spicy (one of my friends does not like spicy things).  Would have been 5 stars if we got rice and beans with this which I thought was supposed to come with the dinner.  Great food.

h6KY1L82hHNF2R6ePUeE6Q.text: First of all, the bartender was extremely attentive and very patient. I came in with people from out of town and even though I knew exactly what I wanted, my friends asked a lot of questions and the bartenders were very thorough with their explanations and hospitality. Their daily specials are such a good deal and I did I mention their awesome hospitality? Come check it out!

qFU3NaxFWiBWXZhzd2x8BQ.text: I first came here many years ago and remembered the happy hour food was good, so on a recent trip back to Scottsdale, I was in need of some good food but didn't know where to turn. I was one block away from Cien Agaves, so I came back to try it again. I got the two taco special with soft flour shell and carne asada. Comes with typical beans and rice. These are without a doubt the most flavorful tacos I've ever had. It's like a taste explosion! I think some of that comes from the fresh guacamole they put on the tacos.  All their other food looked great too, and people seem to love it.  Definitely give it a try. There's a reason they've been here in business so long!

ZCyT3Anh31yhbsXwLIbWwg.text: To Owners, you should really consider covering the bright window so your first booth can be sat around 6!! We got the last booth avail and then saw 3 parties try to sit in the too much glare booth as they were warned by the hostess, and then upset that the only seating left was upstairs.    The happy hour was good, I tried the house margarita, tinga taco, and an al pastor taco as well. I really didn't like how small the plate with the taco was, the tacos were almost falling off of the plate. I eat a lot of tacos at different restaurants and the entire experience was messed up because the 2 tacos were falling into each other on the really small plate. I liked the tinga taco but not the Al Pastor.   Might come back for the atmosphere.

B7ZBlyzoEFBoD1y0dHiYCA.text: This place is off the hizzie for shizzie. Great HH, Great drinks, the most amazing Salsa. This place has it all. Would definitely recommend to a friend, a friend of a friend and even my grandma.   Thank you Cien Agave for deliciousness every step of the way

oUdqMPR-wHS5rQD4XnvD6A.text: Good casual ambience, with good, but not sensational food. I was not wowed - but also not sad I went in.

_VWbHxVo2Fvgxg4u2a8J9Q.text: Great margaritas!!!  We came here during happy hour for a margarita (or two).  Their service was excellent and margaritas very tasty.  They have some interesting decor and nice window view of shoppers.  We tried a beer-rita, our first and were big fans!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

V1wXR7lz4xo9wXp1mYcOsQ.text: Inside they pump the music too loud - so, sit outside on the patio underneath the stars. Guacamole with pomegranate seeds was surprisingly tasty. Prickly pear margaritas are not to be missed. Staff was friendly but lagged it a little. Overall, not a bad choice for an affordable night out in Old Town Scottsdale.

_QSXBL0hMVTJNU2rw8mzcA.text: Went here with some out of town friends and liked it very much. We made it for happy hour, before 7pm, so the apps were half off. We got the guacamole and ceviche, which were probably the best part of the meal! Btw, Thanks to the yelper who told us we have to REQUEST the free salsa and chips that come with the meal, otherwise, we would never have gotten them! I ordered 2 chicken tinga $2 tacos and one grilled Ono taco. I really liked the Ono, but the tinga was just ok. My friends ordered the spicy shrimp taco and liked it. I would definitely come back another time, but make sure it was for happy hour!

tYEXrwKYyzTwWQ_k4sqiMg.text: Fantastic margaritas complemented by excellent food selections. A healthy variety of tacos which can be mixed and matched. The chimichanga was just the right level of spice. And, oh the great margaritas. Highly recommend the Cadillac. And save room for the desserts. This is an excellent night life hang out on weekends, or a pleasant dinner for two during the week.

oMy_qD-aus6Rc4fsSNsoOg.text: I ordered food for take out. I got two tacos, the shredded beef and the carnitas. The carnitas was very good. It was very overpriced, though. It would be a good date spot. I was looking for authentic and cheap, this was not the place for that. But, like I said, it was good and would make a nice date spot.

5psNtqVsmAA3zrnaxOhS0A.text: Cien Agaves is my "go to Mexican." The prices are great. I love their ahi salad, vegetable fajitas (ask for light oil on the veggies), and the tacos. There are so many choices of tacos. Another must have is a margarita. I have yet to try one that I don't like. The cucumber is amazing, especially on a summer day. I have always had quick and good service here.

GNwyGGJqeG3msJxNxorumA.text: Came here for happy hour with some friends.  Margaritas were good. Not as strong as I like but good...lol!!!  Chips and salsa is good.  Great flavor.  Asked for the habanero salsa....has a nice kick. Which I liked..  :).  Ordered the guacamole dip, Ono taco and a chorizo taco....it was all good!  No complaints.!!  Bartendar was very attentive and friendly.

I_S18dXS8yIUxP723Pu6Fw.text: This place ROCKS! I've been here plenty of times before, but this experience from last Friday night was outstanding. We took my mom here for her birthday dinner. We called in for reservations & to see if we could reserve a booth 2 HOURS BEFORE we were going to go there- they said no problem! Upon arrival, we were seated at a reserved booth and our server, Diana N., spared no time to come and get our drink order! Let me just say, Diana N. made my mom's birthday extra awesome! She was a fantastic server and went above and beyond. She even gave us an amazing churro/icecream birthday dessert (I doubt they do that for everyone).  We definitely will be going back soon!

0XlT-l0t3Wfm06oSp5ehPg.text: Great atmosphere in here. Half price starters during happy hour. The burrito was a touch dry but nothing drenching it in salsa didn't fix. I'll be back.

LUDC0cmgtZxUhRnWNpnAkg.text: I work next door to cien agaves and I absolutely love this place! Awesome food and they have the best chips in salsa around! The staff is very nice and helpful as well, Jaime the manager and Danielle the bar tender are so nice they are like family and always keep me coming back! This place is a must have if your in Scottsdale!

0VjaCHe36pDt_zkMp5Lnag.text: HOLY HABENERO LIME MARGARITA.     So I decided to man up and try this thing out after thinking about it many of times.  It was just as I expected hot and amazing.  After I was almost done though I was finishing my last sips when it happened.  I got a seed right into the back of my throat that was the painful moment that kept me away from ordering this thing before.  I managed to pull through though and finished it.    I also got the 3 taco meal and the tacos were great I had tinga, lobster, and chorizo and papas.  The beans were horrible but the rice was ok so just order the tacos without sides and save yourself a bit of money.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Habenero lime magarita

lhgzdZWOYYi9W4FX0pIZYA.text: I went here for the first time as a part of a Yelp event for new hires. My friend Amanda just got hired so I was especially excited to be able to share the experience with her. We went during the afternoon, and it had a very laid back vibe, which I really enjoyed. I only had a beer and some tacos (which were AMAZING!) so my overall experience was somewhat limited. But in the short time i spent there I was definitely impressed, and will be back very soon.

RfXr2mHDN6XmoQkxUMfeYg.text: This place is a True hidden gem in Scottsdale!! I have dinner here probably once if not twice a week! The grilled Ono fish tacos are my all time favorite! I get the dinner which comes with 2 fish tacos, rice and beans. Not only are the tacos amazing but the rice is one of the best I've ever had! I wish they would bottle and sell their salsa verde as I've never had better. The price is def. reasonable especially for the generous amounts of food they give you not to mention the yummy chips & salsa you get when you first sit down.  You can't go wrong with any of the wait staff as they all are amazing & super friendly! I've never had a waitress/waiter that I didn't like! I will have to say that Shelby, Niki, Heidi & Kaitlyn are extremely awesome waitresses as I usually have one of them when I come in. The service is always great, the food comes out quick & I have to say I absolutely love the decor of the restaurant!!  If you're looking for a casual fun Mexican place to eat with a friendly staff and awesome food this is def. the place to go. The menu has several choices & they always have happy hour specials.  I am def. a customer for life & would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone! Anyone I've ever brought here for the first time has always come back..:)  Thanks Cien Agaves for having such a great wait staff & serving such amazing food always!

ltt9y797Z2R_fiUfgj178Q.text: Visiting from New York we wanted something 'authentic' to Arizona while walking around Old Town Scottsdale and this place seemed to fit the bill.  I ordered the Fajita Bowl.  On 'paper' it didn't seem like anything amazing - rice, beans, citrus marinade grilled veggies and guacamole on top - but it was vegetarian and seemed filling so I went for it.  This is an example of where a humble meal, prepared well, ends up besting something else that's got a sexier name or more exotic ingredients.  It was perfectly seasoned, with just enough 'heat', everything tasted fresh, the rice and black beans were soft, the grilled veggies REALLY did have a marvelous citrusy lemon-lime flavor and the guac provided a lovely counterbalance to the heat of the dish.  Healthy, tasty,with a texture that was both chewy and soft.  Perfect and at $7, it seemed like the best deal in town.  You can order it with some protein on top for a bit more too.  The services was friendly and atmosphere very SouthWestern.  If I was local, this would become a regular thing.

HeZ_qvwj4a-McwMMT7tv8A.text: First time to Scottsdale and a friend took us to Cien Agaves. Loved the location!  Perfect for shopping and then dinner and drinks. We started with the margaritas and I have to say they were about the best I've ever had. Definitely enjoyed the cucumber one, very refreshing! For those who can tolerate spicy, I also loved the Habanero margarita. For an appetizer don't miss the cerviche. All the food was delicious and good size portions. Leave room for dessert because the flan was the best I've ever had.  Service was personable and attentive while laid back. This place is a definite thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled corn is amaizing!!!
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best margaritas in Arizona!!
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade guacamole and ceviche

Dwe5bUaFzLf3nioInOI0Mw.text: Great happy hour deals, great margaritas, great service. Definitely could become my favorite.

PUyGJJ0fD0-6M869htQXhA.text: I checked this place out for the first time the other day and the margaritas were amazing! I highly recommend the habanero margarita. Tacos are delicious too. I wish I had more of an appetite to try the rest of the menu. Service was great! Mimi was our server and she was so funny and really went above and beyond. I will be back and I will recommend this place to others.

3Xe2YRjbhXHROJQty-Ddnw.text: Taken to Cien Agave for a belated birthday celebration. Wanted to go here as they have Happy Hour EVERYDAY from 3-7. Headed over on a Sunday that was mildly busy. The group enjoyed house margaritas, cheese crisps, tacos ... All on the happy hour menu... And a chicken chimi that wasn't on the HH menu. Service was a little slow at times but once we brought it to our server's (Mila) attention, things improved. Server spilled salsa on the table...and us, but she recovered nicely. I would come back and would recommend this place.  Written by Knife of Knife N Fork/Fork N Knife. Be sure to check out the reviews of my critic in crime, Fork.

jpZ6FUytkg32sXZRSrekMw.text: My husband and I just happened to come across this place one Tuesday afternoon. Lucky for us it was Taco Tuesday! $1.50 shredded beef tacos all day. They were AWESOME! The crispy corn shell was the best I've ever had. We put on a little chalula sauce and it was perfection.  The margaritas are pretty good too. I like how they make the sweet and sour mix and use fresh lime juice.  We sat outside and we really enjoyed the atmosphere, laid back and casual. We had our dog with us and it was a good time.  Only reason I'm giving 4 instead of 5 is because the waiter knew it was our first time there and he didn't ask us if we wanted the complimentary chips and salsa. I only found out after coming on yelp that we had to ask for it.

A__1YYuLcdu-zZEgxU4chg.text: YUM! I was so pleasantly surprised by this place. I am weary of Mexican food that is smack right in the middle of old town. In many cases they are only places to get drunk or they are super gimmicky.   Cien Agaves had perfect food and drinks while staying reasonably priced.   We were there for happy hour and sat up at the bar. The bartender was completely cool.   I had the tostadas which was an enormous serving and a potato cheese taco. Tostadas were loaded with beans, cheese, lettuce, cabbage and I topped it off with their delicious salsa. When I had their potato taco I thought I had died and went to heaven. My husband had the ceviche and tinga tacos, which he said was excellent.  Their house margarita was on special for happy hour... I'm usually weary of house margaritas. They are either too sweet or not strong enough. But these were great!  We will definitely be back! I want to try their veggie tacos....

AoZdIA1NjEsoWs0yoRROww.text: Their salsa is either really tasty or I was just really hungry when I came here for lunch (the traditional tomato salsa, not the green tomatillo salsa, which is kind of blah tasting).  Had the Ono taco and the ahi taco.  The Ono was quite good, the ahi looked like it had seen better days.  Prices are reasonable, but service was slow.

nKEtDr1OOmzBzHhIGVCAmQ.text: This place rocks on Tuesdays with $1 tacos and cheap drinks.  Try the Lobster Sampler Platter (if you're not going for the $1 tacos on Tuesdays).  Chips and Salsa and right on, everyone friendly, ok for kids in the restaurant section.  Has a little patio, and an upstair couchy loungey bar area (never been there for drinking, but I did sneak upstairs with my son to check out the layout -- it's a habit I have of pacing out real estate!).  Would be a perfect place to rent out for a party or event, probably holds like 40 seated, standing room for another 30 or so).

as4_ako9DfowGtF1bc-jSA.text: Taco selection was great! Enjoyed the Local margarita and Blackberry mojito! Shelby was an amazing waitress!! Thank you for a great experience!

Lu0di6pYMooDk_LhQj8dTA.text: I've been to Cien Agaves many times after work - always with excellent service. Usually I sit at the bar, but I recently had the pleasure of being served by Mimi when out with some friends. Mimi was especially courteous, checking up on us many times to make sure we were all set. She had a great sense of humor, too. 5 Stars for Mimi!!  The happy hour deals are decent. Personally, I think it should be extended to more than just the house margarita.  As a tip, the avocado margartia is to die for! It sounds weird, but it's creamy and delicious. I think it milds the flavor of the margarita a bit, which is nice.

0HQ2YZV03phGDR_rVxyrvA.text: Went in for happy hour yesterday and had horrible service. Our server was no where to be found to order more drinks, we had to ask for chips and salsa, and I was completely out of water at least 10 minutes and had to wave her down to ask for more. Then when we asked for boxes to take our food home our server just gave us a container for our guacamole and nothing to take the chips home in. We would of asked but it took her forever to do anything and we just wanted to leave at that point. I would understand if they were busy but it was still early and slow.

RuLEnrxBz72AqfiqJxNCjg.text: I missed trying the ceviche that Cien Agaves served at Yelp in Bloom, so when I was invited to go to Cien Agaves for a friend's birthday dinner this past Friday night, I was excited to check it out!  The birthday boy made a reservation for 8pm, and when we arrived fashionably late (thanks to my husband), the rest of our group (approximately 15 people) were already seated, eating chips and salsa, and drinking margaritas.  We caught up pretty quickly thanks to Lindsay, our waitress - I had a margarita made with Vodka and J went with a beer.    The food was decent.  I think the 3.5 star average is right on... I split shrimp fajitas with J and shared in the guacamole, nachos, and a few other apps that the table had.  The guys that ordered the special ahi tacos really enjoyed them.    I have yet to try the ceviche and I may even go for the tequila margarita next visit, but I'd for sure return to Cien Agaves in the future.  Two drinks was all I needed and I was done for the night.  Happy hour anyone?!

f65pqZwrieT4Z5bid65P8g.text: Happy hour!!!!  Ok so not the greatest but still good guacamole pretty good quesadilla was ok margs nothing to write home about.... Jus sayin  Time for fish tacos....... So I visited on Tuesday and I have to say the grilled fish and shrimp tacos are nothing to rave about, very dry chunk of fish with a little mango (i think) pico sauce.

ulhELRZMUqKbWb0rB8T9sg.text: went here tonight. great place in old downtown Scottdale. i got the fajita bowl with a beer garita and both were great. service was just as good and pricing was reasonable while leaving with a full stomach.

xCuNdhOEd1Hq0BUBbNx7Yg.text: Don't come here if you have a big group, or are hoping for deep conversation. It's pretty small, pretty cramped, and the music is always blaring a few notches too loud.  That said, the food isn't bad for trendy Mexican, and is incredibly veggie friendly (NOT vegan friendly), which I appreciate. Both their red sauce and their tomato sauce, as well as both salsa, both beans and their rice, are all 100% vegetarian. That's incredibly hard to find here in Arizona.  I love the basics; the cheese enchiladas are what bring me back. I've deviated twice; once for the fajitas, and once for the chilie relleno.  Both were ok, but nothing to write home about. My partner devours the chimichanga, and says it's one of the best she's had. Oddly enough, neither of us have tried the tacos, which is what they're known for. Perhaps next time!

5Aq-4wQql4WHavDzvrPZKg.text: My wife and I stop by this Mexican restaurant whenever were in Old Town Scottsdale. The happy hour is great. Margarita's taste authentic. Their diverse taco menu is as good as it gets. Also, ask for a side of their habanero salsa! They do it perfect. Service is friendly too.

c0zf-UynBzgv9f6uMJgRTw.text: Place is amazing!!! Get the potato tacos. Service is always great. Happy hour margaritas are reaaaallllllyyyy bomb

p6wWO8g9MwLag0lX6x1UMA.text: First time. Enjoyed our visit and food. Smokin' happy hour prices. Will certainly stop back and just buy happy hour appetizers and drink margaritas.

q-inZ6IEtEkTRf6hxSpbDg.text: AVOID THE TEQUILA TASTING. Unless you really just want shots (not tasting), standing in long lines,  and being surrounded by copious amounts of drunken twenty-somethings.   I bought a "Google Offers" for tequila tasting for myself and a friend. I had called to see how it was ran and what to expect. I was told it was similar to a wine tasting experience. LOL! We went upstairs to the bar area, where two elongated utility tables were out. There were two representatives offering (approximately) two ounce shots in small, plastic "sauce" cups. Which, by the way, we never did experience.  We gave up and left after waiting (standing) in line for fifteen minutes. It was more aligned with a keg party.  Not that we were upset, since instead of a sipping and a True tequila experience, we were really in the middle of a "free shot" until you get really, really drunk experience.  We left and headed over to the grapevine instead. Excellent patio, decent cocktails, (unfortunately a poor tequila selection, but that's not what they are known for).   I do have to say, the manager was kind in an email, but we won't be visiting here again.  I can't comment on the food. 1 star for misrepresenting what they are offering, 4 stars for management. 5 stars to Google Offers for giving me a full refund without any issues.

w1q-oEBqltnZSzbRYJMQcg.text: This is a solid option for Mexican food and some drinks. Good atmosphere but it's kinda on par with Chevys...it is not the best Mexican or authentic but it was definitely good.   Chicken fajitas was tasty paired with a shot of patron and some tecate...bottom line: I'd come back next time im in town for spring training since it's right next to the giants Scottsdale stadium!

A9Kx6KxEwtEmM995jNw-cw.text: Poorly mixed margaritas, which is weird when you consider that is supposedly the house special. There is no raw fish taco anywhere in Mexico, unless you don't have a fire. We didn't get quite what we ordered. First and last time there.

cUYj_wT7wLM7V4ddy5Nolg.text: Just so you know, I don't come here for the Malibu. I've been a regular since October 2007 when they opened their doors. And their house margarita is THE absolute best I've ever had. I can't get enough of them!!  Food is awesome and if you get the chips and salsa, be prepared to eat five basketfuls. They are just that darn good.   I've also had happy hour parties and a birthday party upstairs. Great place to hang out!!!! Go there... or suffer from crappy margaritas elsewhere :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 100 Tequilas!!

Z7nVBH-c7j6MMrQ9s_ZfqA.text: We had an after our rehearsal dinner meet up here with all of our friends who were in town and weren't invited to the dinner. We called ahead and reserved (although not exclusively) the top floor for our party. A bunch of friends decided to stop by before hand for food and were raving about it! The rest of us came over in huge groups from the dinner and the staff was ready for us.  Upstairs, we had two bartenders and the manager informed me that she had chips and salsa out for everyone to snack on...even though we just ate, everyone appreciated the thought and they were gobbled up! The bartenders were bad ass! They handled the massive wave of people like pros and had smiles on their faces the whole time. Thank you guys so much for doing such a great job with our party!  I had actually been here 3 years ago when I first moved and remember really enjoying the food as well, but the decor and service is what reminded me of how great this place is both for just hanging out and having a huge get together. I would highly recommend the top floor for a group like ours as long as you plan ahead and coordinate with their team because they are happy to accommodate and I would recommend stopping in even for a drink since they have some killer margaritas!

vU48Y2qcQCQkX04q5PXo5Q.text: Me and a group of 9 friends decided to come check this place out before our movie! It took about 10 minutes to get our drinks that we were never ID'd for after ordering and our waitress mixed all of our margaritas up. I didn't catch her name as she never introduced herself. It was a young black girl serving upstairs. By the time the food came out some of us were missing tacos, shrimp, sides, etc and all of our waters were empty!! We asked the bartender to grab us water and he did promptly.  the food was absolutely delicious!! I was very impressed. I wish we had more time to enjoy but the service was so slow that we were late for the movie.  Our server was standing at the POS for 10-15 minutes trying to get our checks but my friends grew so frustrated that they lined up in efforts to pay so she would stop getting distracted. I then watched her whisper to the bartender how "annoying" we were. What's really annoying is having poor service ruin an entire meal that was so promising. Keep up the good work, chefs!

CcabzbtgFW-BlSLp6fGsmg.text: Fun place.  Great service.  Really good unique tacos.  Waiter talked me into the Cadillac margarita, glad he did.  Awesome.

-EEZ7i-b4kWuneQT_HjEag.text: This place is tho!!! GREAT tacos. Fajitas are the best! Margaritas..yummmm. The green salsa is my absolute favorite (tomatillo). I have been coming here for 5+ years now. The food has NEVER let me down. One of the owners is usually on site and you can tell they care about their product. I have recommended this place to numerous out of town friends, and they have always enjoyed the experience.   They have an upstairs area that you can rent out for special events. The atmosphere is perfect for larger parties and fun occasions like graduation parties, work events, wedding showers, etc.  We have rented the space and utilized their catering menu a few times and they have always been very helpful with each event. Very accommodating! Warm staff! You will not be disappointed.

cYuOBcL_0EJhc7226PcFkw.text: Green salsa was good but little else was.    Sosa was flat, tacos were dry and tasted like they were just reheated from the night before.   Service was slow as well.   I won't be returning and they 5 people I was with stated the same.   Very sad.

60QyL9cLu-inbaUFJVlzug.text: This was a really good place for Taco Tuesday!  The tacos were a good size and very tasty.  The atmosphere of this place is awesome.  Two stories with a bar and bathrooms on both levels.  Will definitely go back.

pFp3jpHs9MVZaqnNwv-6hA.text: We stopped in here for Happy Hour on a Thursday and I am so glad that we did.  The place has a great vibe and even greater Happy Hour Specials.  The chips and salsa were on point and went perfectly with our margaritas.  I also had the Two Taco Platter.  I had both types of shrimp tacos- the Island Shrimp and the Diablo Shrimp.  Both were excellent, but I preferred the Island Shrimp.  The Diablo is advertised as hot, but it wasn't that bad.

CKVexOSxRBrvZzBPnlHSFQ.text: The food was good my first time at this place and I was so hungry ate all of my food but the service was not satisfying. A better attitude from the workers will be good.

fBIR8gWqV4cYXHb47P65sQ.text: Great margaritas, chips, and queso. Tacos were fine but nothing to write home about. My husband liked the enchiladas, though. Kid friendly but not a kid restaurant, which is our preference. We sat inside, but the patio looked fun as well. The server was nice but busy.

pPrRmrEJET9B6KQPFRkbig.text: If you're in old town and in need of good Mexican food and great service. This should be your stop. Whether it's just for their great happy hour with their bartenders (make sure you say hello to Michael Ann, she makes a mean Margarita) or joining them for their great taco Tuesday, you can't go wrong. My favorite is their burrito and a nice cold Dos Equis.  Love this place.

2yZVucmuZ7Mg4IzgjeoJDQ.text: If you're looking for good margaritas and a fun atmosphere this is definitely the place. The food isn't spectacular, it's sized right for the price.  I had ordered the Poki  bowl and the only thing that actually had flavor was the tuna, everything else in it was pretty bland.  Very cool place for HH though!

2iUygbvJyyagZl1JR-OStQ.text: Food was good. Service was ok. All in all I think it was somewhere I would eat again. Nice variety of tacos.

PF96oJnjxw1TUv0kRHFFIw.text: Thanks to Groupon, we discovered this place last Summer and have been back several times. Located in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale, it's near all of the Western Shops and knicknack stores....a great place to grab a bite if you're walking around and doing some shopping. Highlight of some items we've ordered here: Los Nachos (Chips, Black Beans, Cheese, Pico de Gallo, Jalapenos, Crema Mexicana, Grilled Chicken), $9.95 yelp.com/biz_photos/Ja4s... Chicken Tortilla Soup (Bowl), $5.50 Steak Fajitas, $15.95 3 Taco Special (any 3 Tacos), $12.95 I've ordered this several times. Some of the Tacos I've tried are: - Taco al Pastor - Shredded Beef Taco - Carne Asada Taco - Carnitas Taco - Pollo Asado Taco My 2 favs on that list are the Carne Asada & the Taco al Pastor Tacos. Overall, the food is pretty good and the Margaritas are excellent. We've only come here during lunchtime and the service is so/so. Sometimes we get an experienced server and they're good. Other times we get a young, inexperienced college student that has no clue and forgets to serve us our complimentary Chips & Salsa....that's happened on 2 visits. The inconsistent service is what knocks them down from a 4 to a 3 Star for me. Return Factor - 60%

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1NiQpdK03A072eO55shQnA.text: I don't know about you, but the one person I would trust most in the field of tacos would be a luchador. If a Mexican wrestler can vouch for an establishments tacos, then really, they've just got to be good. And due to the number of luchador paintings in Cien Agaves, I think it's just a fact that these are some of the most delicious tacos in Old Scottsdale.  These wee little tacos can be ordered a la carte, or in a combo of 2 or 3 plus rice and beans. Go for three. Sure, two would fill you up, but why would you waste an opportunity to try yet another variety of taco? THAT would be ridiculous. I opted for an all seafood night, chowing down on a beer battered ono taco, the island shrimp taco (served with an awesome tangy and sweet sauce), and an ahi tuna taco. The first two were glorious, some of the best i'd ever had. They weren't huge, but they were stuffed liberally. This is especially True of the plump shrimp, which didn't taste remotely Mexican to me, but were delicious nonetheless. I unfortunately didn't care for the ahi tacos, and I love ahi tuna. They weren't bad, just very average. And average looks bad when next to glory.   OH and did I mention habanero-lime margaritas? Sure they have plenty of different, unique flavors (hibiscus, blood-orange, prickly pear, cucumber) but that habero-lime is the perfect mix of refreshing and a kick. I would have had a dozen, if they'd had let me.   Who knows when I'll be back in Scottsdale, but when I am, I'll be sure to chow down at Cien Agaves. And maybe even steal one of those luchador paintings!

wIgur05aurGMY06TkLt3Rw.text: Made a reservation for a Sunday night dinner. Service was good & the food was delicious! Ordered a mango margarita, it was good but the ice was not crushed up enough. The taco selection is awesome with plenty of options! Best part is they didn't go light on the meat fillings!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tasty green salsa!

Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ahi Tuna taco+chicken taco+shrimp taco! Tuna could of used a wasabi sauce or something like that yet still amazing!

RNAF6zTU0-N61ZAjxbunNA.text: My fiance and I LOVE this place. The chips and salsa are great... And their fajitas are more of a tex mex style which we love. We go here often and usually have good service as well.   Obviously the margaritas are fantastic too. We highly recommend.

JUWOC0RehkD79sAl8y6tRQ.text: Great Mexican joint in Old Town Scottsdale! Visited last night with my friend and we were pleasantly surprised. There was a 30 minute wait since we didn't have a reservation, but we decided to sit in the bar instead. At first the service was a little slow, but as dinner went on it was much better.   We both just ordered soda, so I cannot comment on the margaritas, but the bartender was cranking them out and they all looked delicious! Such a variety of tequila and drinks on their menu.   We started with the guacamole which was very fresh and topped with pomegranate seeds. It's the perfect combination! Their salsas were a little too watery, but good flavor.   There were so many things on the menu that we wanted to try, but decided on the Steak Burrito with refried beans and the Combo #5. The burrito was huge and covered with red enchilada sauce. The steak was cooked well and the beans were definitely homemade which is a huge plus for me. The Combo #5 was a Tinga taco, cheese enchilada, beans and rice. Everything was a hit!  Will definitely return to try some of the tacos and the happy hour which is every day from 3-7pm!

xo7rIGNsuBHcFG7ZsFqEFg.text: This was only our second time visiting as we come from Vancouver Canada but yet again it was AMAZING!  This time hubby had the chimichanga and I chose the 3 tacos with rice and beans. I had a super hard time deciding on which 3 to choose as they all sounded better than the last. I finally decided on a carne asada, pollo asado, and the tecate fish taco. The fish was by far my fave with the carne asada a close second. The waitress was friendly, attentive and helpful in giving me the low down on the tacos. Next time I will order al la carte since there was waaaaay too much food for me to eat.  When we are staying in Scottsdale in a few days we will returning to have the churro sundae since there was no room to eat it this time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 3 Taco Special with rice and beans; carne asada, pollo asado, and tecate fish taco(my fave)
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. chimichanga
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Churro sundae

gb44zf1TXcKx2SM71wEaXg.text: We recently had a casual wedding rehearsal dinner here for 50 people. From the Manager to the entire wait staff we were thrilled with the customer service. Our guests all complimented the food & we enjoyed having the upstairs area all to ourselves. Our new son in law goes here regularly for taco Tuesday.

nD_uME1WeKaUT-Ql4CIjoA.text: There is lots to love about this place, and I want to start with the service, attentive, friendly, and gracious. Our servers took such great care of our big table on monday night, that I have to give the place 5 stars before even one plate of food was served.  About the food we planned the visit around Cien Agaves terrific Happy hour, so there were lots of tico tacos $1.50 ea and half price appitizers on the table, rounded out by a few entrees. Everything I tasted was delicious, especially the Chicken Quesidilla. Normally I would skip a chicken Quesidill on almost any menu, but I am so glad I didnt this time. Just the right mix of seasoned Chipotle Chicken and Cheese in a huge folded and grilled tortilla, with sour cream. This is by far the very best restaurant quesidilla in town. Everything served was great, and raves about the food came frome everyone.  They have great drink specials during happy hour as well, including 1/2 price margaritas and special priced beers. It's the tequilla selection that is special though. It's an amazing selection of some of the best tequillas in the world. You can even try some tequilla flights!  Inside the place is funky/cool, super clean, with some really cool art and lighting. In Old Town There are some real GEMS and a few DUDS when it comes to mexican food, but Cien Agaves might just be the very best choice for Mexican food in Scottsdale.  I MUST SAY TO MY FELLOW YELPERS---GIVE THIS PLACE A TRY!!!!!!!!!!!!!

6mwYh-Bqmv9FWGw97-x2JQ.text: Love this place for tacos and drinks. They have the BEST margaritas you will ever have not to mention their shrimp and fish tacos as AMAZING! I like to sit outside on the patio. It reminds me a bit of Europe or NY or something.

uIcfn7FDZDmXUIu0XuaLsQ.text: Absolutely fantastic!  We were looking for Scottsdale's best tacos and margaritas and found them both in the same place!  Great job Michael V. and staff!  We couldn't have asked for a better way to kick off our exploration of Old Town.

bYXSAEVKaFydAs5Y-gO-2w.text: Habanero margaritas.   That alone should be reason enough to come here.  But wait, there's more!  They have an extensive taco menu that rivals some of San Diego's better establishments.  Depending on who is cooking that day, the chimichangas can be extremely good too.  Although, these tend to be more hit-and-miss.  If you can get a seat outside by the fire pit, your experience is complete.

IMEGRo_3_ClqsNHw2jHsyA.text: been here twice and probably won't go back, unless i only have margaritas. the food was great the first time and very sub-par the second, especially for the price of the tacos. the pork ones were especially gross; extremely greasy and fatty and tasteless (i know pork is fatty, but it shouldn't be hard to chew).   our service was good the first go round, as we sat at the bar and learned a lot from the bartender about their tequilas. the second time, service was no good. very slow and our waters went empty for entire meal, even after we asked for more.   they do have great guac and chips and their margaritas are fantastic, and they should be for what you pay. but if you are looking for great tacos, skip this place. you'll be underwhelmed.

zCIQx0sA6unZrOR-k73JBw.text: Yummy spot for lunch in Scottsdale.  We were looking for something cheap and small for lunch while strolling Old Town.  They have a great taco selection for a bar and everything tasted delicious.  Prices were fine, and you could also order tacos ala carte.

cOeYcnIL_yLBJOZkbUL_QA.text: Yeah, I made it for Taco Tuesday!!! Wow, $1 beef taco's, my girlfriend and I put down 7 tacos with an appetizer. This place was great, very busy and a little loud, but we didn't have to yell at each other to have a conversation. The only bad part is our waitress was a little slow in getting us refill's and we asked for more salsa and didn't get it, but will definately be back for $1 beef taco's.

ZLXP4lHW6ei8IkayAqfrFw.text: This place was pretty good and our server (who was also bartending) was very attentive and nice. They have an amazing selection of tequilas, and the margarita that my mother had almost killed her (in a good way). I would def. go back!

jT4WENi7j2W_2mDxglL_oA.text: My family and I ate here while we walked around old town one day they were visiting. I didn't know this existed, until we passed by and looked it up on Yelp mobile on my sister's phone. We saw it's reviews, and decided to give it a shot.  It was busy downstairs, and but slow upstairs where we were. At first we had trouble getting water refills and chip refills, but I'll give it to the servers, it got packed quick upstairs (I think the Giant's spring training game got rained out). They eventually took a good chunk off of our bill, which was cool.  As far as food goes, we all ordered the different taco assortments. Mine were fantastic! A shredded beef taco, carne asada, and a fish. It was the perfect amount of food. We were all happy with our food.  Although this place is a tad on the divy side (no problem to me...dives are not necessarily bad), the food was great! I'd like to try some of their tequilas some day....I'll be back.

KF4ClCg0HhXkkuislB9cRQ.text: 5 stars for the margaritas alone!  The cucumber one is awesome!   I've only been there for food a few times and have been impressed every time. The salmon taco is pretty good.  For me, these are the best margaritas in Scottsdale.

wGQH5de0N7YU1635fidRCg.text: went last night- - tacos were excellent- we tried siz different kinds all good- salsa and chips excellent and $2 Tecate cans- good visit- would recommend

yWJ-UrC5_7evSj5PDW1L4Q.text: Te, Te, Te, tequila... Margarita! Holy heaven Cien Agave has the best margaritas in town.  Hottie and I decided to take a seat on the patio during Sunday happy hour to enjoy the Arizona sunshine.  We weren't planning on eating, but after seeing the food being served we decided to give their tacos and some guacamole a try.  I had a veggie taco on a flour tortilla.  It was excellent; they actually grilled up the veggies and the tortilla, giving it the nice crunch of a taco without the frying.  The guacamole was just okay; I've had better and can definitely make a better batch at home.   A good Mexican food restaurant typically has a solid chips and salsa presentation, but their salsa was weak and had gringo written all over it! I'm glad I ended up ordering a taco, because it gave me a better peek into their menu.  We will definitely be back for Happy hour; you can't get a rockin' $3.50 margarita and $2 taco anywhere else in Old Town!

o7YJKDL4ramyStnAyJOLcQ.text: Great food, great drinks, great service, great prices with a casual atmosphere in a superb location. What more could you ask for?

l3Eyz7LxM6iu87yDpiPhYQ.text: Great margaritas and amazing tacos. I recommend the carnita's taco. I hope to get back to Scottsdale soon so I can stop by again.

8-P5qIRjVfNn0O-UP6KKhg.text: Cien Agaves is great! I've been there a hand full of times and plan on returning. The margaritas are fantastic! I think they use fresh lime juice in all of them and they have a lot of great flavored options. The food is amazing! my favorites are the ahi tacos and the tinga tacos, which are a spicy shredded chicken - great flavor! I've never ordered a salad because nothing really seems to stand out. I would also like to see a better red salsa, although the green salsa is very good! The service has always been decent, nothing outstanding, but they're always efficient.

j6bB4e7bJE_R5L0dI7ZWTQ.text: A casual and comfortable spot in Old Town with somebody in the kitchen who knows how to make Mexican food.....no doubt. Our server was a delight and right on target for keeping us happy, the salsa was great, especially the green one with tomatillos...loved it....and the tacos were good too. No, it's not "quiet" like your typical Scottsdale restaurant but I don't think it's meant to be. It's more like a restaurant/bar/cantina kind of place. Fun. No attitude here among patrons or servers. I loved it. Prices are very reasonable too. We will be back soon.

0o9faKPlBrN-S6HrbDxnxQ.text: love this place.. ya they do tinga!  go with a group and order a bunch of tacos.. I order my tinga tacos in a non crisp shell / instead a basic corn tortilla... good cocktails, 4 stars only because I think they run a pretty lean labor and leads to, not offensive, yet dragged out service sequence.  I have never left unhappy... been there 5 times now.  Yes it is old town, and it is really good, just don't bookend yourself with an appointment after your meal and it will be perfect.

GI9Yca7er_le-BFD555ftw.text: Was in town for the day and dropped in for a drink. Great service, cute and friendly bar staff, owner was very personable, and fantastic margaritas. Can't wait to make it back there in a few months

81kayDsKnQ1M8jfoxygCwA.text: wonderful flavors in the meat and fish tacos  , well seasoned  - a winner we will be back. plus great service

TcVHbU9S8b-M9JzX8bNVSg.text: Came in to check this place out and did not disappoint. Started our with the tequila flight which was awesome and ordered the chicken fajitas which came out extra hot. Can even see the steam in the picture. Delicious!! Becky was awesome and gave us great service. Will definitely come back to get the margaritas I keep hearing about

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

BY9vJj44VB400LP9erN3Gg.text: I love this place. I'm vegetarian and they have a lot of choices for me. My fiance who is not vegan loves all the food here. Amazing happy hour!! Get the Cheese Crisp!! Great Margaritas and beer choices. The restaurant itself is beautiful and is wonderfully dark inside to keep away from the heat on a hot day. Bartenders are awesome along with the waitstaff.

gBW3g-p_6YRIJ9dXG43zpQ.text: As a local I expect better. This is the worst old town experience I have ever had. Sat at the bar on a Thursday night, had a drink and ordered tacos. Pretty basic. 45 min later, no tacos, no help from the bartender, and when I said to just cancel the order was told that it would have just been a couple more minutes. No manager. No apology. Glad that you were busy during spring, but you won't see me even when you are slow during summer. And I live a block away. My first one star review ever.

VDgoGvPDKrgD9AnKv-BTug.text: The margaritas are delicious and strong and the house crunchy tacos are super good as well. This is coming from a Mexican lol. Great atmosphere, food, and drinks!

P24_1PQMFZQXvJA4tVa55A.text: Great food and great service.  We ended up here during happy hour and there was a great selection of specials and items on the menu. I ordered the tostada appetizer as my dish -- so good!  We also ordered the green Chile cheese crisp which was a hit with everyone including kids.  Others ordered tacos and taquitos and everyone enjoyed their meal. The chips and salsa was good too! The atmosphere was live and fun.

Y-_Nv5020fGhkMmy8l9qJw.text: Absolutely AWFUL experience. Heard the food was great- but unfortunately, because the manager FAILED to stop her bartender from over-serving drunk patrons and ask them to stop screaming and using profanity around the children in the restaurant, we were forced to take our food to go. If you want marginal Mexican food and want to surround yourself with crappy servers with bad attitudes, or if you want your kids to learn new curse words, make sure not to miss this dump. Go quickly though, we made sure the local ABC office received the video of the over-serving.

d7KUyxZ58xaW80oslFW-oQ.text: On a typically warm summer day my husband and I wanted to check out Cien Agaves because it was recommended highly by the Airbnb we were staying at. We stepped in to this vividly colored restaurant thinking it would be touristy and the food would be just meh. I hate syrupy sweet margaritas that taste more like a Otter pop and less like a adult drink. These people take margaritas seriously!! It was obvious that other people felt the same because they were all posing with their drinks in their hands for selfies, and big grins on their faces. They had three pages of different margaritas all hand squeezed. My husband had their beerarita that was smooth and not overly sweet. I ask the waiter if they could make me a grapefruit margarita, and  he pointed out a fantastic one that didn't have added syrup or sweet and sour in it but very stiff. The perfect drink to cool you down. After a drink and a appetizer of the Chile verda with queso we decided to try some of their street tacos and their roasted beat with chimchurri salad. Wow! I found my self dissecting the salad trying to figure what all was in the mixture so I could make this at home. Needless to say this will be our new date night/happy hour stop when we are in Old Town Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kDaLmQbRvtkhqjn7EnAdqA.text: This is my second time here.  First time was Happy Hour.  The margarita was wonderful and tbe beer was good.  The appetizers we had (guacamole and the nachos ) were great and more than enough for two persons.  The second time we went for drinks and a light dinner.  The margarita was strong and the beer was ok(orange blossom).  We had the cuacamole and some tacos which were delicious and very filling.  I would definitely recommend this place for Happy Hour and for dinner.  The waitresses were really nice, patient  & very helpful.

hfAI0WRaACFVhtu504JN5g.text: The food and drinks were pretty good. If you're in old town Scottsdale and want to grab a quick bite this place has fairly fast service.  Only had the shrimp tacos and prickly pear margarita. Tacos were good, margarita was not my favorite. The frozen mango margarita was pretty good especially if you like sweeter drinks. The reason for three stars is that nothing wowed me.

iQBj4n2xRLc6vIUF07V1Tg.text: Whenever anyone asks me to recommend a great Happy Hour spot in Old Town Scottsdale, Cien Agaves is always on the list! It is right in the heart of Old Town and walking distance from so many fun things to do! Their margaritas & guac are to die for!! It is EVERY DAY, yes, even Saturday & Sunday! ...from 3 PM - 7 PM {I love that it runs until 7 PM, in case your work day runs extra long!} Honestly, what more could you ask for?   HH Specials:  1/2 Price Appetizers  1/2 off Cien Agaves Margaritas  $2 Tinga Tacos  $3 Dos Equis Lager & Amber

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Giant margarita from Cien Agaves! Yum!

9G5J-hkAB4kBlIonn9EiJw.text: Dry tacos. Slow service. Great atmosphere.   This literally sums up our experience. Wish I would have looked on Yelp before eating here.

c1u7CAsAJMxFD2ARK63q3g.text: Great food! Great Bartenders!  Wonderful happy hour with 1/2 priced appetizers everynight! Mondays have $2.50 shrimp tacos...Tuesdays are Taco Tuesdays with $2.50 Tinga Tacos!  Get in here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. What can be better than a Cadillac Margarita delivered to you by Micheal Ann?
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ceviche! Yum!

c_vnWK3fBHHLRyc83we2Aw.text: Just from walking in you know this place is special. There is an immediate positive atmosphere, the food always comes out right and fast, and the service is exceptional. But if you want to feel at home just sit at the main bar and get yourself silly with a Mexican mule, order 1 or 2 cheese crisps and you'll be set.

2Be9DkmNgBX8MahFuMN57g.text: Thank you so much for the support with Red for Ed movement. Your resturant is great and great customer service. I will defiently be coming back. Thanks again

JODvtNsBETB0jTstvr-nVg.text: After a long wait for a table on Friday February 22, 2019., we were seated and Cole immediately greeted us and ask what we wanted to drink and got chips and salsa for us. He said he knew we waited a very long time and wanted to make sure we got our food quick. We were fed quickly. The food was very good and Cole was the best server we have ever had.

LAqjWom5rielmn78AjvkKA.text: Delicious! Lot's of great choices in food! Well worth going to! Hreat flavor and doing Tacos the right wat, with cabbage and not lettuce. Brie, our server was very attentive and professional! Great job and great food! She's a keeper and deserves a raise!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rxI3iuYHCNzL-_OOxfVpZA.text: Wife and I tried Cien Agaves for lunch. We do not recommend them in anyway.  My wife tried the trio of tacos: tinga chicken, carna asada and el pollo asada. I had the Combo # 5.  We were in midweek at 11:30 am. Restaurant was not busy. Two guys eating lunch at the bar and three small tables in the restaurant.  We sat in the bar at a table. A server was cutting was cutting limes at the bar.  Service was slow. Chips were flat tasting and unsalted. Refried beans were runny. Mexican rice was bland.   My cheese enchilada and beef taco were good. My wife enjoyed the tinga taco. The meat in the other two tacos tasted burnt. The meat wasn't burnt but tasted like it had been cooked on a grill where something had burnt and they cooked her meat on the same surface.   My wife saw the server in the ladies room place her hands on the wall and then go back to cutting fruit without washing her hands. The bartender repeatedly rubbed his nose with his hands and went back to making drinks.

dpbmiFUH9D2MmvAQigR81w.text: How have I lived in Oldtown for my entire life and never been here?  This is hands down the best Mexican happy hour in Scottsdale.  Tried it for the first time yesterday.  For $19, this is what my friend and I got: A margarita, a dos equis, nachos, and a quesadilla.  The nachos were huge and they used real cheddar cheese (not the soupy sauce).  The quesadilla was equally large, and tasted great.  Their complimentary chips and salsa had a great salsa verde, although I didn't much care for the red salsa.  Service was outstanding.  Non happy hour prices were on par with other Mexican joints, but I rarely see too much on happy hour at other Mexican restaurants.    I will definitely be back when I can get off work and make it down here before 7!

O9cJ1c--cualJRWZ4n_eOw.text: Great find in Scottsdale. There's a lot of upscale restaurants in the area and Cien Agaves is more reasonably priced and they serve good quality Mexican. I'm pretty picky about Mexican food and really enjoyed the whole experience here. We stopped in on Monday night when the house margarita was half off and tacos were 2.50. I got a margarita and two tacos for 9.00!  It's also located in old town Scottsdale which is a fun area to check out. If you are looking for a more casual, comfortable spot in Scottsdale, stop here.

Q1RGOhp1E3XgYubAyf3ZgA.text: Great time, good food...perfect combo!  Went for happy hour and had half price house margaritas and half price apps.  Had the best salad which was delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ecoij_aGrspqeDq9HKkWBA.text: We stopped for Happy Hour and had a good experience.  Good drinks, chips, salsa, and guacamole. We sat at the upstairs bar which was good since it was so crowded on the first floor and we could talk. The service was efficient and attentive.  Next time we stop it will be for dinner.

JM8YaXwVZHdiQ1qSJ-0EgA.text: Great experience here with the family tonight! It was a little bit loud upstairs where we were sat, but that was due to two large parties also up there. Everything within the staff's control was first class. Our waitress and the manager came over a couple times to check on us. Kudos to this place for great service all the way around!

urPmDsqQYLlEx0DMonG2Qg.text: This was my third time here bringing family from out of town and it was great again. The Cien-A-Rita was soooo good. I'm not even a margarita person and it was amazing. The fajitas were great too, enough to share with two people. Our waiter, Kohl, was very nice and made lunch great. We will be back again.

2Im8-LWZ2hzxMhFNHiRQWA.text: Went here on vacation and loved everything from Margaritas, appetizer to entree. We liked it so much we went back a second night.

Lj14e75jLKWLX5Zt8uCjOQ.text: What a great place to have tacos and a michelada. The staff is very attentive and the energy of the place is really good. Plenty of parking in front, so very convenient. The beer battered tacos were phenomenal. the guacamole, with the spin of the pomegranate seeds, is amazing. Bringing that recipe back to California. The bartender is very good as well. Also try the carnitas tacos, and their mango salsa, is all that and more. I know good tacos, and these were really good. Definitely will be back!!

txogjaxeMFmJXqsYtLto7Q.text: Expectations were high, but disappointed. Food was good, but service was poor. Prickly Pear Mag was soild, Coconut Mag was just average. Good salsa. Fish tacos were overly fishy. Beet salad was the best thing of the night.  Service is what brought it all down. Unatentive, even dismissive to request. A couple of times we were talking about items and the waitress walked away mid sentence. Couple of times we even thought she left for the night. Wish it was better.

ORUwkRZgz-mrOMqiVDdx6A.text: This is the second time I've visited Cien Agaves and I was surprisingly underwhelmed this time around.  The first time I visited I had the rice bowl which was delicious.  I had friends in town and they wanted good authentic Mexican so I decided to take them here for a guaranteed great meal but we were all very disappointed.    The atmosphere is pretty good, casual always busy but they seat you pretty quickly. I wasn't super hungry so decided to just pick from everyone else plate.  The table had an assortment of dishes...tacos, tostadas, burritos, beans & rice but nothing was that great. However the guacamole is some of the best that I've ever had.  I was very disappointed that I didn't deliver great authentic Mexican for my friends on their last night in Phoenix.   Based on some other reviews I guess this place is hit or miss.  I'll try again on a taco Tuesday when they have specials and hope it's a HIT. I've had better Mexican from local taco trucks so wouldn't feel the need to come here.  It wasn't horrible just a disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

uPbkXs58I5JE7KdAGEtjrg.text: Used to be my weekly spot but had not been there in awhile. I usually go for the prickly pear and island shrimp tacos. This time I ordered same and food took awhile to be served due to busy dinner time. The food was a dissapointment as shrimp was super dry. The sauce was able to balance it a bit but still quite dry. The margarita was still pretty solid just taco was completely dry. Staff was not very good in checking on guests although you would expect it when your seating at the bar. I definitely not planning to go back for tacos there.

iO3_OOjvg2veMGIc6yHNWw.text: This place is amazing. Can't believe I've missed it all these years. Beautifully laid out. Very different from everything you typically see. Perfect Mexican cantina vibe. Food and cocktails are awesome.  Service has always been friendly. The GM even came out to check on us and see if everything was going well. Don't get that at most bars/restaurants unless there's a problem.  I'd definitely recommend! I did a review on the North Scottsdale one but the original is the place you have to see for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cl09Ez_Dr5VWk-gM7V07MQ.text: So this is probably my new favorite place for good tacos, margaritas, and guacamole! I love places that our pomegranate seeds in the guacamole as it was such a wonderful burst of flavor! We enjoyed our tacos and margaritas as well. Tip- make a reservation! We enjoyed our outdoor seat as the weather was fantastic! Service was quick and the food was good. We enjoyed the lights outside and walked around after our meal was done. The patio is dog friendly as well :) Highly recommend this place. They have two locations but this one is by far the best one. So what are you waiting for?! Go get yourself some guacamole and a margarita!!
