bC76nt0BmNrakZj2p4XVaA.text: Happy to be visiting AZ from CA- although it's raining   We ordered margaritas, nachos and the green chili crisp off of the happy hour menu.  Service:   Ambience:   Food:   Price:    Happy Hour prices are fantastic- a real bang for your buck!  HH runs from 3:00-6:00pm.  Enjoy!

1ODDI3RGtgYat2QibFSP0Q.text: Seeing that it was apparently named one of the 10 best Mexican restaurants by USA today, it would've been wrong not to come in.   Dined with a group of colleagues. Among the 5 of us, we had: fajita salad (me), green chile cheese crisp, chicken fajitas, shredded beef taco, and a taco combo meal. For beverages, the cien-a-rita house margarita (me), blackberry mojito, habanero+lime rita, and pom-berry. The menu claims the house marg is the best in town, so obviously I had to try it! Everyone was very happy with their meals and even happier with the drinks.   Service was friendly, and the complimentary chips and two salsas were perfect while waiting for our orders. Unfortunately, my salad arrived with chicken, though I ordered it with veggies only (or you can also get grilled steak, salmon, or shrimp for a few extra dollars). However, after bringing it to the server's attention, he was fast to apologize and bring back a new veggie-only salad very quickly from the kitchen. I loved that it was loaded with black beans and corn, not just a mound of lettuce and tomatoes like many places. Also, the creamy cilantro dressing was awesome, and I also tried the roasted tomato chipotle pepper vinaigrette (extra 50).  We all left very pleased with our meals, and I only wish I'd be around to come back for happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken fajitas.
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie fajita salad.
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House margarita with complimentary chips and salsa. Perfect combo.

4dka8tyE9GLTvfOviEPURA.text: Great happy hour! We don't drink but we enjoy the half-priced appetizers. Nice, easy after work place to go...

MW1UFZCjiDqAWc-ZhARpRg.text: Thursday night and the place was packed. Waited about 15 minutes. On a whim, I ordered the creamy poblano soup. You guys! It was one of the best soups I've ever had. Not too spicy with a swirl of crema. It was the highlight of an otherwise kind of bland meal. The carne asada was in my taco was cooked perfectly and tender. The chips are house made, the salsa wasn't great. 2 options, the green got a little heavy handed with cumin. The house margarita was not too sweet, and not fluorescent green. It was fantastic.

BPZAKOdhzhlYyIV5pFxrBA.text: Best Happy Hour in town! Incredible bang for your buck. Had the house margaritas which were tasty and strong. Shared nachos, tacos and ceviche, all super fresh and very generous portions. Lots of shrimp and fish in the ceviche which was served with tortilla chips. The homemade salsa were amazing and had quite a kick. Leading to drinking up those margaritas.  Tons of people here, every table full which just shows you how popular and worthy this place is. If you want Mexican food this is the place to come. Skip all the others. Met people from all over that frequent this place each time they are here and plenty of locals too.  Super friendly staff and the waiter knew his menu well. Helped us out in the decision making. Enjoy the fish tacos, my personal fav!

-RILIQDsGKmmLnS6Jo3_9g.text: Food and service were just ok. My friends and I had skinny margaritas and the tacos from "taco Tuesday". The bartender wasn't super attentive but the drinks were ok. She provided one basket of chips and salsas for four of us so we had to constantly move between us. The taco was odd; like a fancy version of a crunchy taco from a Taco Bell. Overall my experience was meh.

2osrP4Bjbe8r2mT6VotT6w.text: When in Scottsdale I crave Mexican, and Cien Agaves is - surprisingly - one of the few Mexican places that popped up in the immediate area of Old Town. I was looking for a quick to-go option and they delivered my meal in a hurry despite it being more of a sit-down establishment. The meat of my review comes down to the burrito, which was pretty underwhelming considering the size, lack of ingredients and fact that I paid $18 for it when you throw in tip and the additional charge for red sauce.   The burrito is supposed to be a "giant" flour tortilla filled with a combo of rice, cheese, pico de gallo and meat. Black beans and guac, which are usually included in such a creation, come on the side in small containers. The burrito was smaller than what I'd usually get at a place like Chipotle and essentially all meat and rice. The rice was a little undercooked as well. It was only after I returned to my hotel that I discovered there was next to no cheese or pico.   I think it comes down to burritos just not being their thing. After all, there was only one burrito option on the menu. I will say the bartender was sweet and chatty and made things fun during my short wait.

D4pay5rkQlGYm3dFxLeQHQ.text: So if you're using google maps, look carefully at the signs on the buildings. Maps had us drive past twice. It kept making us circle the block.  We finally gave up on maps and walked through the rain and found it on our own.  We were seated near the bar, and the friendly bartender came out to take our order. We ordered guac and chips. As a special touch, the guac had pomegranates seeds   It really added a nice touch.  I told her I wanted enchiladas, but I could not have cheese , milk or butter.  She said she would order mine ala carte, since their rice had butter & I didnt want beans.  My wife had a taco with potato, queso, and chili.  Everything was delicious.  Shout out to the bartender who doubled as a server while keeping the bar moving

i2k2v3pXkCyXyrWwJR0rWg.text: Yesterday my wife and I happened to be in the area so we decided on a whim to checkout Old Town Scottsdale.   We weren't sure where we were going to eat, but we had a pretty good idea we should eat in the vicinity before anyone got hangry.  :-)     While shopping at an area jewelry store she solicited their suggestions.   Without hesitation the sales clerks recommended CIen Agaves as their first choice.     The atmosphere was casual and comfy.  The food was top notch.   The chips and salsa was great.  (We both thought the mild salsa was a bit oily.  The spicier red salsa was not too spicy in my estimation.)    My wife had the hard shell chicken taco and I had the soft shell pork taco meal.  We both enjoyed our meals.  The shells were tasty with a good texture.  The rice didn't do much for me...but the refried beans were good in both taste and quantity.    We will be back!

P7CXTRIF9Q9mt5JXdvOLcg.text: Loved it! The best part? Their hours! My family took so long trying to figure out where to go on a weeknight for tacos that the majority of places were closed. So Cien Agaves it was! Even better that it was Margarita Monday! They're open until 11pm or midnight depending on the day.   Their chips come with two salsas - a mild and medium (at least according to my tastebuds) which is something I always appreciate. Still, I was "that guy" who asked if they had something hotter so they brought out a third salsa which appropriately tickled my tastebuds.   We started with the cheese crisp which was pretty darn good. The only problem was there wasn't much room for it on the table given the plethora of salsa bowls and margaritas. Quite tasty and a good choice to share and split with anyone, even the picky eaters.   I had the tacos (duh!) They have something like 12 different varieties - you can get one (a la carte), two or three and mix it up. I chose the Tecate fish, tinga, and carne asada. I couldn't possibly eat them all but I wanted to go all out since we don't have places like this on the East Coast (some people try and most of them epically fail). My favorite was the Tecate fish but you can't go wrong with the tinga. It's a good all around taco. As for the carne asada, it had more guac than carne, but still it was good.   The cherry on top and what gave them a full five stars was their decor and music. Social D was on which is always a plus in my book. I'll be sure to come back next time I'm in town!

kisMGq5fB9UQBQfoLgKhHg.text: Not a huge fan. I'm one for good service and this place wasn't it. It took the server 20 minutes to come greet us and take our drink order. Server never gave her name or the specials for taco Tuesday. We had to go to the bar to get water and call her over to get our check. The food was amazing however. The house margaritas weren't anything special.. A little to sweet for my liking.

5EUAUy0ArentsGZUnGNMEA.text: Pleasantly surprised....Charming decor, good vibe, I was glad they had healthier options- my Beets by Cien were AWESOME & guilt-free!!!! My mum enjoyed her Ceviche after adding more lime juice and the red & green salsas were very tasty.  Will def try again...

eM2dSYjahqfU_1cHvoMdQA.text: Great happy hour spot. 1/2 price drinks and appetizers.  Friendly staff nice decor. Small enough to talk and enjoy.  Highly recommend.

FqHdVlHMy-MIGxd6CNAxkA.text: An awesome place for Taco Tuesdays.  I went to two different Mexican food places during my stay in AZ for Taco Tuesdays and Cien Agaves was wayyy better.  The tacos were delicious.  Add in a $2 brew and I was a happy camper.  Service was better than most. Very upbeat restaurant.

tJBdkOFBGthxFI__9veZBA.text: What a great find!  My wife and I were in Phoenix visiting my son who is attending ASU.  Hungry for Mexican we thought we'd try something new and Cien Agaves had good reviews.  It was 10 PM by the time we got there and the kitchen was closing up but they stayed open long enough to serve what may be the best chimichanga I've ever had.  It was carnitas served in a nice flaky tortilla shell, just absolutely delicious.  My wife's beef enchilada's were tasty as well and she especially raved about the rice and black beans.  By the time we finished the place was empty, (Scottsdale in summer is a little warm) but we never felt rushed, the server treated us as if he had all night.   Will definitely be back.

SCjY7tm9fXoTO_Uz3EwsbQ.text: This place was mediocre from start to finish. From the service to the horrible drinks and cold tortillas. Don't waist your money

1mDdHw5F59Z-mnbXbc2zQA.text: Before going tonight, we heard from a friend that this restaurant was really great and delicious. Unfortunately, that was not the case when we went this evening. Four of us cousins went out to celebrate a birthday. We made a reservation and were seated just fine. It took about 15 minutes for anyone to come ask for our drink orders. We ordered and then waited literally an hour for our food. We were told they were backed up in the kitchen so we weren't freaking out too much... However, my cousin and I both ordered the Ahi Poke Bowl, and they were BOTH brought out with hard rice that had barely been cooked. Apparently the whole batch had been undercooked and no one had noticed before sending it out. We kept having to flag people down because all of the servers were frantically moving about the restaurant. We expected to have been compensated in some way, but NOTHING was taken off of the bill. It was ridiculous. The only saving grace was that our waiter was nice and tried his best to make up for the kitchen staff being behind. But for a restaurant old town Scottsdale I was NOT impressed. I will definitely not be going back.

LKdHjxTARxV2KOfbdwhkrw.text: We came back to this place for the second time for a happy hour. The waiter was very nice and the food was OK. Some good deals. Very loud but they have a cool bar area upstairs, that is very nice. I'll go back to keep some variety but nothing special.

7PIQGml_t0MdOvR9r54EKA.text: Food was great, atmosphere and service was fantastic. Meal prices are very reasonable ! Definite recommendation and will return!

2xb57aRVwlGLm8WcJDYL_w.text: Great atmosphere... FANTASTIC GREEN CHILE SOUP!!!!!! just like the one you find in Denver

8L6VIP2h-bhmQLx8QorqvA.text: We came in for dinner and had an awesome experience!  The staff is super friendly and helpful and the food was great.  I had the tacos and my friend had the fajitas.  Everything was priced right and we will be back many more times.  Great job!

Q3SZD6Y1HeFtOZmLMWkVsQ.text: The menu is HUGE and their tequila list is super extensive. I can never get enough of their guac and their happy hour specials are really amazing. I've never had to wait for a table and the service has always been really attentive and friendly. I recommend this restaurant to all my friends and I take my family when they are in town.

C9oX23iEycBXV6WHXejCGQ.text: The food was just OK as well as the margaritas. The outdoor seating looked to be a good idea but when you have a bunch of college kids getting drunk in the same area it wasn't such a great spot.

a8s0NAXsNzn-Lmo6aadCzg.text: Mayb need to b back for happy hour to see if I can up my rating, but for now this is all!   Ambience - ok  Service - meh Margarita - meh Food - meh Price- ok, but for bad quality they offer it's high  We had a bad waitress, I think her name was naomi, never introduced herself, found it on the check, which was the only time she actually smiled, bcs ofc she needs tips, but for what? She never made me feel welcome, didn't make my day any better, screwed up my order & never spent an extra second with me? In fact towards the end I asked the helper boy for everything and gave him a few $ tip.   I got a cucumber margarita after reading recommendations, which was just meh. Probably would hav been better if frozen. The price doesn't justify it. Macayos or ze tejas has Better ones.  I am a vegetarian, so decided to get veggie fajitas with black beans and corn tortillas. Fajitas were so bland and had no flavor whatsoever. I could stir fry these veggies in my home to taste better. Even a sports bar like Gallaghers has better fajitas than here. Black beans was a disaster, it was just cooked bland beans, no flavor, no salt, nothing at all. Is this supposed to b a joke, or they don't care much about vegetarians? Bcs my gf loves her meat tacos. I am defntly hoping to hear from the owner/manager about this!!   And ofc the corn tortillas never arrived, instead came the flour tortillas, down went my calorie count. Thanks cien agaves, not sure why u r trying to copy tortilla factory? Not coming back soon, unless forced to!!  Check the posted pics along with review

gs0pUdY6TDpOMxyK4aOJ0w.text: First night in Scottsdale, looking for a place to eat in the downtown area. Walked in after reading mixed views on YELP. Food was just ok, nothing really stood out.

SCgHr4SUDD9PNhaYen6lbw.text: The Happy Hour here is a yes.  Their Margarita's are pretty damn good and so was the appetizer I had, the tostada. I like that they have happy hour everyday unlike a lot of places which only have it on the weekdays.

H1ESa2Py37wOXmFdc_mwtA.text: What do I love about Cien Agaves?  What don't I love about Cien Agaves?!  Consistently, some of the best margaritas I've ever had.  The option for corn tortillas, instead of flour, on my tacos.  The perfect black beans...seriously, how do they get them to taste so good?   Service is usually good, I'd say 90% of the time it's great.    What can I really complain about?  Well, the floor is a little difficult to navigate in heels; it always seems slippery for some reason. (I'm actually surprised I haven't fallen down  yet.)  And the bathrooms.....they have black fixtures.  I know it's weird, but black bathroom fixtures give me the heebies.  Neither one is enough to keep me from returning on a regular basis.    I've been hesitant to write this review, only because I don't want to see you all there taking up my space and making me wait for a table.  I'm an impatient girl when it comes to my tequila.  ;)

cajsu65k8R8IvTzgce-u2g.text: Service was excellent. Server very friendly, food was AMAZING, bartender Alex very nice and friendly and busser Jacob very quick to clean up and friendly. Definitely want to go back again.

qnlFWmCnOnqtFgUB2hcoMA.text: I hope you like 90's alternative music if you're going here. Lots of Red Hot Chili Peppers and Sublime playing in the background.   Moving on to more important topics - food & Margs. Both were delicious. Got the shrimp, carnitas & tinga tacos and the shrimp fajitas. Definitely would recommend if you're looking for some good mexican food & margaritas to match!

MHdHwARMBDJUpcfUMCq-ow.text: I gave them a five-star because I've been coming here for almost iron years and I've never had a bad experience. But this is my first time making a review. The chips and salsa is Bland. But I must say the tortilla chicken soup here is to die for I. I haven't been here all year so. I love the tacos on Tuesday I love the taquitos those are really good to have a great Happy Hour. The staff is always fast and friendly and the Beer Rita is in the best on Mondays it is $6. I probably will be back tomorrow for Taco Tuesday

She makes an amazing margarita!! Even though it was busy, I never felt like I was waiting for anything. Would highly recommend this place if you want some amazing Mexican food!!

f7SFTVZLDQoY6oB0WgwgGA.text: Absolutely loved it. Major props to the bartender Michael Ann! Great fast service with a beautiful smile and personality. Was impressed with the authentic Mexican food.

gVfklovXofrGZOlE-FI5bw.text: So good! So friendly! So full!  We came in on a hot fall day in the afternoon.  They seated us on their great shaded patio, which gave the kids a little room to be kids, had a cool breeze, and kept us out of the sun.  We ordered a few different appetizers to split between three adults: guacamole, queso verde, a delicious creamy poblano soup, and the green chili cheese crisp.  Everything was delicious and the portions were huge.  I'm used to getting a relatively small bowl of guac or queso at most restaurants, not here.  We had leftovers of everything and were all stuffed. Our waiter was super nice, gave great recommendations, was patient with our kids, and helped make it a great experience.

0M5n0bkSDTcwTy2-PEor0A.text: Food was very good but it came out cold at first, the waiter was nice but not very attentive to us, great atmosphere but added extra charged to the bill

B0J3d5UPpKxVL5G-ruJVUQ.text: Meh.   Okay....  Not great.    This restaurant had lots of good reviews on yelp and I love tacos so I thought I would give it a try. I travel for a living and make it a point to find taco stands, taco trucks, or anything taco related wherever I go.    I was disappointed here.  I read several reviews about the service been so-so to lousy, and that was my experience today.  The hostess was slow to recognize me when I walked up, took some menus and said she would be right back. She did not say hi or welcome me, just turned around and left.  I went to go sit at the bar and was also slow to be recognized as far as a greeting.  I also had to ask for chips and salsa just like several other yelpers have complained about, because I sat there for five minutes after ordering my tacos, and I still didn't have chips or salsa.    I ordered the tacos al pastor and ahi tuna combo with rice and beans.  There was plenty of tuna on the one taco, but the taco Al Pastor was the smallest most pathetic taco I think I have ever seen.  I think it had more pineapple than pork.   In fact I'm not even sure there was any meat in it.  Way less tasty than they should have been.    As for the chips and salsa, the chips were stout, not the flimsy kind and were good enough.  The salsa was thin and runny but the green and red both had good flavor.  Sad to say, then chips and salsa were the best part.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Taco Al pastor and ahi tuna.   Both were pathetic.   Little flavor, especially on the al pastor.  Not coming back again.
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa were good enough

ddYJGUyAw0tR7L3gpDxHvA.text: This place has good food and a great happy hour until 7pm everyday!

z9c-_o7-bnR7fRFUXLTcjQ.text: Awesome food , fantastic service and great deals. Ryan the bartender and server is just wonderful every time I go in ! I highly recommend going here! Great ambiance

7WI98Pf9QE-tyu8w5SzgFg.text: I only ate 3 things at Cien Agaves so that is was this following review is based on.  1. The chips and salsa are great. People were saying it was too watery, but I disagree it was extremely flavorful with great chips.  2. The classic margarita is 100% perfect. Not only was the taste perfect but they didn't wimp out on the tequila. The color was spot on.   3. The carne asada taco. One word, delicious. I think this might be the best taco is the valley. Everywhere I go I try their carne asada taco, and this place was by far the best. I am just unhappy it took me this long to find Cien!!!  I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Classic margarita. One word, delicious.

HZpBlW13BJCf3tGpKLEqiA.text: Great girls night out dinner.  It was St Patrick's day weekend, so it was busy, but we didn't wait more than 20 min for a table.  Our server was great and the food was delicious!  I highly recommend the Prickly Pear Margarita!

5ZrNWBReuudjFAoi2roR9g.text: Just had dinner.  Picked this place out of several options in the area.  Service was fine.  Food was good.  Rowdy group next to us ruined the dinner.  I asked the group to please respect my young kids and to not repeatedly use vulgar language that was inappropriate for any restaurant.. When it continued I approached our waiter.  Our waiter told me he had asked the group several times to be respectful of the other diners and that he would have the manager talk to them.  The manager never talked to me about my complaint. We paid the bill, left our waiter a tip, but will not return.

1D-smAx0wNqG2XIBN1oXBA.text: This is our favorite Mexican food ever.  We had two house margaritas.  Nice big glass...but had a lot of ice.  :(. The chips and house-made salsas were amazing!  Husband had 3 tacos, rice and beans.  I had the fajita taco salad.  Everything was outstanding.  The ingredients tasted so fresh!  Dinner with two house Margaritas was $45 without tip.

K-iRXmXezlFf7QeF8b433w.text: I went to Cien Agaves for the first time during a trip to Scottsdale, AZ for a friend's rehearsal dinner. I went to Cien Agaves for the second time, the very next day, because this place is so good!  Coming from Upstate NY, I put all my hopes for a good mexican meal during my short trip to AZ in this place. It is loud in here, with the latest top 40 music playing throughout its two floors. There is an outside patio where you can eat tacos outside enjoying the desert air and a $2 taco tuesday.  The shredded beef tacos were completely addicting and I loved that they dotted the guacamole with little pomegranate seeds (so much healthier!). The tortillas were those homemade corn tortillas that you yearn for in the Eastern states. For my friend's rehearsal dinner, they made mini churros that they turned into a fine display. I'm a sucker for mini churros.  This place is great for a quick mexican platter while passing through Scottsdale. If you are interested in using it for a party, it was definitely one of the best mexican buffet style experiences that I have ever tried. I would definitely come back during my next visit.

Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shredded beef tacos

6tqQTTu1DgAFGGq1nC1O6w.text: Great atmosphere, great service and awesome food. Perfect stop to beat the heat, have a beer and relax. The ceviche was amazing! Sadie the bartender was engaging, attentive and made our visit a great one.

Z6uLXbT4GAMer5_8g_wj5w.text: On my recent hiking trip to AZ, after hiking Camelback and Toms Thumb, I reserved on open table and visited this place 4days ago to eat. I was really excited because I love good tequila and they had an awesome bar. I opted to sit at a bar table. They offered a drink menu, I advised that I didn't need a drink menu- I am a sipper- I immediately ordered the Clase Azul, and the Ambrosso Anejo, which I could see from my seat. I never got it. My hiking buddy went to the bar tender to ask questions because she is not a drinker and wanted some tall margarita drink because the class looked cool. ....well.... (I am still waiting on my Tequila- how long does it take to pour it neat?)  she and the Manager had  some not so friendly words about her asking him questions and not walking away after she got the answer because we had a waiter who was not present at the time. This behavior was not good toward a consumer. We get to choose where to spend our money. We opted for a more friendly place-hole in the Wall- home made excellent food. It is right behind Tony's leather shop by Aveda.

lCx_y8lXZOVlpwBwlJvKzw.text: Really delicious and fun place! I came with my family (group of 8) and it was so crowded so I'm glad I made a reservation. It had a fun party vibe, but still great for dinner!

eEa_jtcw2TrR9y4GplkWeA.text: In the words of my wife: "I mean, I guess it was all right."    I give it a solid "meh."  I knew something was awry when the waitress asked if we wanted "polo tacos."  Like, she said polo, not pollo.  A little thing for sure...But when the food arrived, it showed that if we wanted authentic Mexican food, we should look elsewhere in Phoenix (like Tempe).  The tacos tinga were the highlight.  My daughters quesadilla was HUGE (but she didn't like the cheese they used).  It was literally bigger than my three tacos.  That said, service was courteous and responsive, atmosphere was good.  But yeah, not going back.  Drive a few miles south or west and get better tacos for a cheaper price.

vqeST3t6vjJzN1PW9vSARw.text: We were looking for a place with Prickly Pear Margaritas but saw the Mai Tai on the menu and had to order it. Yummy. Had several appetizers which were Happy Hour specials. All good but served on the lukewarm side.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LYrfGG1O044IWtRq0o02Ug.text: On Girl trip we spent the weekend in Old Town Scottsdale. We just by chance found this place. Obviously you need a reservation even in the 100degree off season. Were told a 45 min wait for an inside seat, 15 min for outside. It was 110degrees outside, yes we will wait for inside. Didn't have to wait the entire 45 min when paged our table was ready. We were taken up stairs to a 4 top. As we were being seated the hostess informed us there was a reservation for our table in 1-1/2 hours "Would that be enough time?" Uummm....that will depend on your service!! We've never been here....Just Wow!! She should've just said "Heads up ladies, in an hour and a half we're going to be asking you to leave this table." It really put a bad taste in our mouth from minute one. The food was good, the drinks were OK,  but the policy of informing guest that they're going to have to leave in a certain timeframe doesn't sit well with most people. It didn't with us. So if you decide to dine here, make a reservation....

xAsSTvht43zE82Yd8GFnzg.text: Definitely very good Mexican food at this place. I had a burrito and my friend had a couple of tacos and they were both excellent. The chips and the salsa were also extremely good so we were very happy with the food.   Is service with a little bit lacking now as it was a bit of a wait to get our food but aside from that I would say that this is definite place a check out in Scottsdale.

QgvF5QloUFN9SprS1mc7bA.text: Based on the reviews and it's location to our hotel, we decided to give this place a go. Service was ok, not great. She didn't have a great personality. Felt like she didn't really want to be there. Back to the food. Their queso was amazing. Dinner for two (fajitas for me and shrimp enchiladas for her) were good, but we have definitely have had better. Cool place, nice decor and food was good. Not much more to say.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3ULk1AaCI5-4O5DrgOeIoQ.text: Do yourself a favor and eat someplace else if you want Mexican food as the area is brimming with fantastic restaurants and this place is more like a sad chain than an authentic Mexican restaurant. Quite frankly, we were all shocked at how high the reviews were since we were disappointed in almost everything.  The happy hour rock margaritas were probably the best thing we ordered. The prickly pear margarita was just super sweet and none of us wanted it. For our appetizer, we got the green chile cheese crisp, which was okay, but could have used a lot more toppings and it was mostly just crispy tortilla. The three of us ordered tacos: Tinga chicken (I liked this one, but the others didn't); pollo asado (boring); fish (okay); and pappas con queso (the saddest of the bunch). And the beans and rice also went untouched as they were both very plain and dry.   Also, our server never cleared anything from our table. Fortunately there were 3 of us at a 4 top so we were able to stack things in one spot, but she routinely left our table empty handed. Even a busser came by, took a couple plates, then never came back for the rest. We had appetizer plates still at our table while finishing dinner.  This was our last dinner in Scottsdale and super disappointing.

QJPSDJHLeQyT64eNV6w-Nw.text: The churros and cien-a-ritas were delish. We tried carne asada tacos, queso, guac and cheese crisps. The fajitas smelled so good as they were coming out!! I will definitely go back and check those out next time I go.

l0dsvKu_IN6U9OmCR_BlZA.text: The guacamole is pretty delicious and made our dinner almost worth it.. However, I didn't care for the tacos (too salty and over spicy), or the banana colada I ordered. We were a party of five and none of us were super impressed. The restaurant is also super loud with people talking and loud music (we couldn't even hear the music it was just more noise).. we did visit on a Tuesday? Our waitress didn't check on us after our food came (drinks were often empty), we weren't able to order more drinks, and the people seated behind us ended up leaving, because the waitress never returned. If the food was terrific, I'd not have minded the rest, but it's just not.

23_joqgHElJiJHUjFzI5bg.text: #fatjared say...if you are a taco and tequila place, and you run out of any kind of tequila, that's a MAJOR issue!  For anyone going out to eat, if you walk in and the place is empty just walk right out. It's that way for a reason! I don't have enough characters to go into detail about everything wrong with this experience!  For my grading scale, if I can't find ANYTHING good to say that's a one star. This place squeaked out 2 stars because the queso was awesome and I did love the salsa as well! But this is a 1.2 star restaurant at best!  My buddies burrito came with 2 rips in it and it was dry. My tacos were dry and didn't automatically come with a sauce. We ordered the nicest tequila and they ran out. Our waitress was terrible. Didn't care at all honestly. No one enjoyed the food and we left pissed.  This place is hyped up because its close to old town, but when you have an experience like this, and another friend says he hated it too, you know its not good! Find another Mexican place like DIEGO POPS!!

Though we will come back, there are a couple of songs with the place...  1) App arrived with entree. HZr59tttRZZ4rcRytgWQrg.text: On my recent trip to Scottsdale, Arizona, we took a trip to Old Town Scottsdale.  Among the beautiful scenery, artwork and shops we stumbled upon Cien.  The old building is colorful and inviting with a bustle of people coming and going.  We chose to sit outside on the patio.  Service was fast and friendly.  We started with drinks and some appetizers.  I chose the habanero margarita, my friends had the Pom margarita and coconut frozen margarita.  For appetizers, we had chips with 3 different salsas, fresh guacamole, and green chili queso dip.  My margarita was refreshing and finished with a nice spice.  I didn't try the Pom, but the coconut was delicious as well.  The homemade chips were wonderful and thick enough to scoop up our dips.  All of the dips were perfectly delicious.  Three of us ordered the 2 taco combo with our choice of tacos (carne asada, brisket, ground beef, pork, fish, shrimp,...).  There is also an option for 3.  Our other friend opted for a huge burrito.   All food was very good and was delivered timely.  Very reasonably priced and a great lunch stop.  This will definitely be on my list of places to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Taco combo, shrimp and chicken, with black beans
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Habanero margarita and amazing guacamole and chips
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Taco break!

OkvVBmMuzfVfn47oeyA92w.text: From someone who loves Mexican this was a let down. We went around 5pm to beat the spring training dinner crowd and obviously that didn't happen. The wait was an hour and 15 minutes which held to be True. Once we were finally seated around 6:15 we had a little bit left to order before the happy hour ended at 6:30pm.  Our waiter finally came and left about as quickly. He was rude and constantly seemed annoyed. We were warned up front that the kitchen was behind and it would take longer for our food. I asked if he recommended tacos or fajita bowl and his response was "either." Then I asked how hot the shrimp tacos were and he said "depends on your tolerance." I was so displeased with the service. Ended up with what I thought would be a safe choice of tacos and they were ok.  Also, ordered the happy hour special of a tinga taco and got charged full price. If you have the option -- GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. Overcharged and underdelivered.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fajita Bowl
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tinga Taco Diabla Shrimp Taco
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Table view. Would recommend the guacamole

B1IUdC5LQHmm7KFvNSBQYA.text: Our previous experience here was not good. After 2 years of eating elsewhere, we decided to try again. We were pleasantly surprised at the changes. The staff was courteous, pleasant and accommodating- from the hostess to our server, Kohl, who was very attentive and helpful in making our selections. The drinks, appetizers and mains were brought out quickly and piping hot and delicious. The manager, Tom, stopped by our table to check in on how we enjoyed our experience. He seemed genuinely interested in our feedback. So glad to see the Cien Agave has improved and we will be back! The items we ordered were delicious!  Denise & Don

MV6bXqRO8n2Gc7RMKf5Iog.text: I am in town from Los Angeles (and thus may be spoiled and preferential in my comparison between cities on Mexican cuisine) and decided to stop here as my father and I were curious to try the Mexican food scene in the PHX. We walked in at 7:30 and it's quite the stimulating atmosphere. An hour long wait for a table, or seat yourself at the bar. With that demand, I was eagerly awaiting the amazing food that warranted such a wait. There is two floors, the first floor more sprawling and spacious with an upstairs area with a second bar and connected tables for larger parties. We were lucky to grab a table at the bar seating area from a departing party of 2. The place is called Casa Agave tacos and tequila... so in True fashion we ordered tacos and tequila. The Cadillac margaritas were ok, a little on the syrupy side and heavy on the ice. It took two to get a buzz on.   Per recommendation of the waitress I ordered the mahi mahi taco and diablo taco with rice and beans. The diablo was nothing special and while the mahi was well seasoned with a sweet tangy taco sauce the tortillas weren't fresh at all. The rice was clumpy. I soon realized this was a place that thrives off its social atmosphere and not so much the food quality.   Good news is there's free chips and salsa, though the chips aren't salted enough and the salsa verde and roja lacks balance and/or kick. To rage with a group or drinking and to watch a game this place is ideal, in the heart of old town Scottsdale. If you're looking for a quality meal, go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mahi mahi and diablo taco
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cadillac margarita

Amo3zrAaISt_jvevKD4clg.text: Stopped by here while I was in Old Town and needed a little late night dinner/snack since I hadn't had a real meal.  Inside decor is cute, with an upstairs, and nice decorations and lanterns. I sat at the bar and had really great service.  I happened to come by on a Taco Tuesday, so I got one of the $2 shredded beef tacos, and then also ordered one of the carnitas tacos that the bartender recommended when I asked what his favorite was. I also had a house margarita.  The margarita was good and not too sweet. Both tacos were delicious - but I truly did love the carnitas one the best which was the recommended! It had a bit of a kick and great flavor. Try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shredded beef taco and carnitas taco
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House margarita

UjBI8dF8p0jVjstRr2fdsw.text: The drinks taste good but hardly any alcohol in it. I had the Tres Taco Combo with Diabla Shrimp, chicken and carnitas. Let's starts with the portion size there was hardly anything in the taco my first bites were just eating the tortilla that was barely cooked. Now to the meat in the taco, the shrimp was ok, chicken bland, and carnitas horrible. The carnitas were dry and burnt. I have never had such dry and hard meat a day in my life. The rice was old and over cooked. The beans was the best part of the whole meal. Would not recommend or return.

eErkAdEOLt90s9pvCAIw1Q.text: The drinks are good, the food is not. I had the 3 taco special including 2 carnitas tacos and 1 carne asada. Let's start with the amount of meat on the taco, a whole tablespoon of meat on one regular sized (soggy) tortilla. Then to the actual meat, I have never had carnitas that were this dry. It was like chewing beef jerky, and I really needed water after tasting it. The carne asada was ok at best, small amount of meat as well. Then the rice was also very very dry. The refried beans were good. Would not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas

Og0g0PkSila7yR5Tekh-7Q.text: I really enjoyed my meal and the service at Cien Agaves last week in Old Town Scottsdale. I was visiting my family, and they love this place. I was excited to finally try it.   Briana was our server, and she was fast and gave great tips to me as a new comer. I was craving cheese enchiladas, and I thought they turned out okay. I should have got red sauce, but I was worried it was going to be too spicy. I really loved the beans. Like I want to eat an entire burrito of those beans.  The guacamole app was good and uniquely had pomegranate seeds in it. The margaritas were great, and the service was fast and thorough.   I see why this is a regular place for my family, and I loved the intimate and fun vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome guac appetizer
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheese enchiladas with green sauce

SANka5scgzm8vXSpSMD3EA.text: This was a really cool place in a nice park of Old Scottsdale. I had a few different things including drinks. Everything was really good. Wait staff was very friendly and not pushing you out the door. If you are a shrimp person and taco person, try the island shrimp taco. Just the right balance. But you really can't go wrong with anything. When I am back in Scottsdale, I will definitely be back At Cien Agave!

lWq1t4wl0J2gb7AZkRxyyg.text: Set in the Scottsdale old town stage set, this lively tex-mex bar and restaurant lifted our spirits as we dropped in for a dinner on our way back from Taliesin West to Phoenix. A major part of our delightful dinner was attributed to the bartender named Sierra who seemed to single-handedly serve all alcoholic orders at the bar and entire restaurant while attending us at our separate high table seats nearby.    Our Monday's margarita drinks were just right - thanks in part to Sierra's enthusiasm in describing the drinks for us. Although the tortilla chips were not the best we ever had, we did enjoy our shared Beef Fajitas order - especially the tasty black beans. We ended our meal with a delightful Churros on Vanilla Ice Cream with Whipped Cream. All in all the service by various waiters/waitresses who also took care of us were very good. The atmosphere was lively for a sports bar with plenty of TV's all around. A good stop for our evening.

6A-fqwQwH3VThXI1EkgCtQ.text: The best tacos I have ever had. Great margaritas, loved the chili salt rim on my mango margarita. Perfect mix of sweet, spicy and salty!

RkWZMy4ykPyaW8660TDOhw.text: Im not going to lie i love this place. Now id never go there when it wasnt happy hour but thats because they have the best happy hour in town. We are talking half price apps and 3 dollar margaritS and they have the best quesadill in town. No shit, you need to get the quesadilla, its like 3.50 and its a fat quesadilla. Smoky chicken chipotle that is juicy and just the boss rick ross.the taquitos are bomb and youll find my ass in there on a tuesday because its shrimp taco tuesday and shit gets real. Dont get the diablo taco cuz the fried one is just fantastic.

WLKVfmLqWlzImkNgoL1-iA.text: Got invited here by a friend who just started working here....was really busy do we sat at the bar. The queso was amazing. Had pork in it. Not really a pork guy but it was tasty!! Damn good. The steak burrito with green chili was also really good. I can usually finish my plate but today I did not! Great portion size! Kenzie was our waiter. Awesome and patient with all our questions! Great first impression. I will be back!

r4yT9uvKhmX_pCTqWHGxow.text: Ate at Cien Agaves tonight with Three friends.  Each ordered something different and all of us tasted every meal.  We all loved all four meals.  It isn't just the food that was great   The margaritas were the best and the service equaled the food and drinks!!!  All four of us agreed that we'll be back at Cien Agaves often.

ACbWaMd13FZGyNoqW0itMA.text: The decor was the only thing going for this place. Good service and cool design inside gave it the stars, but the food was very mediocre and disappointing as I love a good Al pastor taco... this one had barely any flavor. Have to say the margaritas were pretty blah as well.

KxAYPOzxYodLXb6xaaZtPw.text: My friend from Ohio came to visit and we randomly stopped here for drinks one afternoon. SO happy we came across this place because WOW this place is tasty! Their banana coladas are to die for. Best tacos: island shrimp taco and tecate fish taco. Servers were very nice and attentive...went back the next week and had the same great service! Wanted to go to tequila tasting (last Thursday of every month) but had to work the next morning!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana colada= yum!

zI1EZJd6i_iaP4C--squ7A.text: Tonight was my first visit to Cien Agaves. I met a group of people for happy hour. The decor is nice and the patio is awesome! they even have a fire pit. This however, is where the positives end.   I arrived at 550. I finally was able to pin down a server at 615. I ordered a house margarita, a shrimp taco, and a chicken taco. At 645 other people who arrived after I placed my order receive their food. I said something to the person who brought their food about how long it was taking for my tacos and he respond in a rude tone "the kitchen is very busy". I explained that I had ordered 15 minutes before the food that had just arrived and he just walked away. A while later (655) my tacos came out and the ingredients inside the tortilla were cold. The margarita was watered down and the cold congealing tacos were mushy and salty. Very very disappointed.

Ty1EcSE0qAWACpoqgK5Yug.text: We live in Old Town and have been on several occasions over the last month. Great happy hour with freshly made guacamole and appetizers half price. The servers are cheery even when there is a large crowd. For those of us who like the Tex Mex variety this will whet your appetite. The cheese enchiladas are delicious and the menu has many taco choices. Wish they had beer on tap, but the house margaritas are special. Ask to sit in the courtyard, it is a sliver between two buildings with a great atmosphere, heaters and a fire pit. It is a great place to bring friends which we plan to do next week. Two types of salsa for salsa fans, red and green. Great job Cien A

1S6cce08yR0xAIOYrWgV-Q.text: I have been to Cien Agaves many of times and this place never disappoints. I always like to try something new each time, but I have to say the fajitas are my favorite. The atmosphere is relaxing, their customer service is on point, and the food takes me back to the authentic flavors in Mexico. I also recommend the cevechi and poblano soup with their house margarita.

K0xnr__VBFqzGHbOCUBd0w.text: The food was amazing, tequila was too. We stayed for hours because the fire pit was so nice. If you're lucky enough to have Mel as your server you're in great hands!

ijORrumNl3CWTtriAAgocQ.text: I had lunch at this place and enjoyed the service by Olivia. She has been the kindest, most helpful  waitress I have encountered in all of Scottsdale. Her recommendations for food, drinks, and specials were more than perfect!  I decided to come back for Happy Hour, and once again had the pleasure of having Olivia as my Happy Hour provider. :-)  The beer-garitas are excellent if you like a little extra kick to the usual margarita. The guacamole sprinkled with pomegranate seeds is excellent. The island shrimp tacos are good, although the diabla shrimp taco is my favorite! (I am also going to try the tinga taco before leaving Cien Agaves.)  Also, I moved to the patio where I could smoke, and Olivia provided a great experience there as well, by turning on the "misters" for a cooler Happy Hour.  There's not much else to say, other than the fact that you should seek out OLIVIA as your waitress!!!  Thank you, Olivia, for a wonderful experience!!!!

qiKARMsIeGfOL9ngLGm5tQ.text: My husband and I finally made it to Old town Scottsdale and saw this taco place right away. We were not disappointed, the tacos were great and not to high priced concidering where we were. Will definitely be back.

4cCdM1ETHmNUyycCu43uRw.text: Not the best not the worst. Typical mexmeican bar food. Was not impressed with tortila soup. however burrito was decent.   margs are decent as well.

lpWAmAZKEIqu9EKqQH4sMw.text: Delicious! My husband and I came here and were pleasantly surprised! I ordered a house margarita, strong, but delicious! I also ordered a Blue margarita- blue curacoa, pineapple, fantastic. We both ordered the 3 taco plate with shredded beef. I read that some people think the portions are small. At first glance, they do look that way, but we were stuffed by the time we left. I even took one of mine home. Our server was very nice, very attentive, and quick! We will definitely be back again. :) Overall very fun environment, tasty food, and delicious drinks.

npE04ITYhalXoMOuMFf2yQ.text: Had a fun dinner with coworkers on their Taco Tuesday, which can be a great deal with $2 chicken tinga tacos, half off their house margs and half off appetizers. Now, none of us partook in those deals (hello, expense account), but we still loved our dinners! Most of us did their two taco plate with beans (refried or black) and Spanish rice, but you could do three tacos, 10 or even 30 for $38, or something like that. You can also pick flour or corn tortillas. They had 20 or so funky taco choices so it was hard to narrow down, but I tried their seared ahi taco with chipotle jicama slaw and avocado as well as their spicy shrimp taco with rice and guajillo sauce ($4.95 each). Guajillo peppers are my jam and though the rice sounded weird on the menu, it worked, but maybe needed an additional sauce to jazz it up and make it less dry. I had an amazing habanero lime marg ($12), okay two margs, but they had a ton of options including cucumber, other fruits, beer margs with a bottle out the top and even skinny versions. Other meals on the menu included fajitas, enchiladas, salads, quesadillas and some yummy sounding bowls like the "beets by Cien" which, in addition to two colors of beets, also has shaved Brussels sprouts, chimichurri sauce and dried cranberries I think (could add proteins like chicken, steak, shrimp or salmon). Lively joint with two floors and lots of color inside. Great service that handled our large party spread across two tables and got us out in time for our next activity. Fun area in cute Old Town!

5eBxHC5cRb-aGAQPYMrS0g.text: We had our rehearsal dinner here last Friday and everything was amazing! We had an entire upstairs area to ourselves! The bartenders were great! The food and Margaritas were awesome!

9U74E2vo-FN42rjnE8LsSw.text: Went there for Taco Tuesday and was surprised when they asked us if we had a reservations.  We got a seat right away in the self-seating bar area, but it was the last table available.  Cool atmosphere and decor.  Only had the margaritas and chips and salsa.  Chips and salsa was good.  Margaritas were a bit sweet, but they were large and only $3.50.  Seemed like a fun little place, but I hated my date.  I'll go back there and explore a little more when I'm with people I like and I'll update my review accordingly.

uPNS3kLwRs2QEPQDgO9piQ.text: My husband and I are from California visiting friends here in Scottsdale. We decided to explore Old Town late last night and saw Cien Agaves and decided we would try out the tacos and margaritas being it was taco Tuesday.  We sat at the bar and were immediately greeted by Kylie. We are a little picky on our margaritas and we requested a less sweet margarita with Casa Noble tequila. They were fantastic!  She also sold us on the $2 shredded beef taco and then we had the burrito, both were excellent. We had the guacamole for an appetizer and I was hesitant about the pomegranate seeds but I trusted the recommendation and it was one of the best guacamoles I've had.  We never had to ask for chips and salsa and waters were given to us when we were greeted which was very pleasing. We've been to many restaurants late at night and this by far was the best service we have received! Overall A+ on food and A+ for service! We will be back!

uYhrpcGIfpJ3dBUcvG8Lsg.text: Bad Americanized Mexican Food: 0 stars  Reeks of dismal chain restaurant.  Paying for the check now...couldn't wait to tell the Yelpers to stay away.  Food: 0-stars. The burrito I ordered came out with everything on the side, i.e. guacamole, beans, cheese. Only thing inside was rice and meat. Yet burrito was closed.   What??? So then it's a fajita right? The rest of my group shared other complaints.  Avoid at all costs.

14gc9o3plqP_ynAHVOxRUA.text: We made reservations through Open Table and received a call from the restaurant to confirm on the morning of our reservation. We requested to be sat at the fire pit out on the patio. It was a very pleasant night and quiet outside. Indoors is a lot louder. The fire pit was not functioning but they placed a space heater near us and it was perfect. The appetizers were very good. We had the guacamole with chips, the green chile pork queso with chips and the chicken quesadilla. All appetizers were half price until 7 PM. Everyone enjoyed the tacos, salsas, chips, enchiladas, margaritas etc. The only food item that was subpar were the retried beans. The black beans are a better choice. The shrimp tacos and tecate tacos were probably the best items. Good food and atmosphere. We will be back.

M_WKOkiemcyvBNP8k0u1XA.text: Three words: creamy poblano soup. Even if this place did not have a liquor license I would still drive all the way to Old Town just for the soup. It's seriously one of the best things I have ever eaten. I don't just throw that around, either. It's perfectly balanced and I crave it like I do sushi.  But thank the Lord it DOES have a liquor license, otherwise it would just be called "Tacos." They hand-squeeze fresh limes for every single margarita. It makes for sore hands and more work for the bartender, but it is certainly worth it. It is honestly the best margarita I have ever had (aside from my own homemade ones, of course). The best thing about it is it's $3.50 during happy hour (3-7pm everyday), and happy hour lasts ALL DAY on Sunday during football season. Pretty awesome. I'm pretty in love with this place.  Also on Tuesdays, tinga tacos (chicken) are $1.50 and shredded beef tacos are $1.00 (if I remember correctly, don't quote me on that). Regardless, they're cheap. Also some cheap $2-3 beer deals, but beer is the same everywhere unless you're at a brewery, so whatever about that.  All in all, I love this place. OPEN A TEMPE LOCATION PLEASETHANKS!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5ti5sO-xN3_Zd-NjWL1szw.text: Kenzie was amazing, hot too! Just like the tacos! Great experience, service was amazing. I'll be back on Tuesdays for sure. Good beer, good food, and good service. It doesn't get better that.

lPQSgphyYV73HICVeEwnbg.text: Very cool place to grab a drink, watch a game and meet friendly people at the bar. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We called before arriving to make sue they had prickly pear margaritas. Other places had advertised the drink, but none could deliver. Not only did Cien Agaves have it, but it was one of the best I've had.   Of course, while there, we also had to sample the chips, salsa and guac. The salsa was delicious. I liked the variety. The guac was good.  Definitely take the staff's recommendation. They know what they're talking about. The staff gave us great recommendations on beverages and food.   And the t-shirts are great!!!

rVE_kDpdUFoWditUQPEBVw.text: What's not to love about this place?  Many choices for great tasting tacos, great atmosphere and hot waitresses.  I swear mine must have been a super model!!! LOL, you can tell I was impressed.  This place has a nice menu with many choices, its a little high end as far as pricing, but the quality is very good with so many combinations of tacos that you can get.  The particular visit, I had one fish taco only because I ate before, but I have been here before and the food is excellent.  If in the area, definitely give it a try.

QW6Dtge8Dotin0XReBKgCA.text: It's a fun place and gets pretty crowded and loud. The food is okay, not the best Mexican you can get in AZ but it is a good location and decent enough. higher prices and the service is not good.

-vlQFLsFuMvCUDdTJjWS8A.text: I love the ambiance of this place. Colorful, artsy and southwestern. Lots to look at and nice noisy vibe. The hostess was prompt with finding us a table but if you could make reservations, I would because there aren't too many tables. The house margarita is really delicious...packs a nice punch too. Guacamole and green salsa stand out as fresh with great seasonings. I got the fajita bowl with carnitas, others at the table got the steak burrito ( not recommended) and steak salad. The house roasted Mexican street corn was delicious. What stands out as a real bummer is the service. The waitress really could have cared less if we were there, offered no recommendations (she doesn't eat here), and her attitude seemed kind of "college bar annoyed." If they could step up the service game, this place would be four stars.

blNAQBOf02bDUt8Z8P7-Ew.text: I dislike reviews that mention partial stars...until I have to write one that hits a gray area, so there I am with Cien Agaves. Guilty with indecision and admission that I have to clarify my selection with a more accurate rating of 2.5 stars. Really, I have had better. And it's also ok. For the price and location in Old Town, it's not too bad.  The food is just ok (that is...rounding up to "just ok"). The chips and salsa are pretty good with the cumin-strong tomatillo standing out over the red. The guac is also nice and a bit too addicting. The tacos are nothing to rave about, and actually I'm not likely to order them ever again, but I've enjoyed a salad or two with grilled fish. While most people rave about the happy hour, the food options are meat-centric so not much to choose from on those deals for a veg/fish eater. But at least the margaritas are cheap.  The atmosphere on a weekend night is pretty energetic and the margaritas have a nice, fresh (aka no mix) quality. Not much by way of beer selection though. For diners that aren't super picky about Mexican food and don't mind the grease, this is a solid option. If you're more akin to the taste of say Gallo Blanco, meet your unpicky friends here and stick with the booze with some chips and salsa to tide you over.

zkgKTZRBARcU_D--hoXQ0g.text: Great Old Town staple with high quality food and the best tequila list in town.

Sq7244hilncbZpL6PjiM5g.text: I typically love this place but we went last weekend and had the slowest and crappiest service I've had at a restaurant in quite a while. They were out of certain menu items, took forever to take orders or come to check on us, didn't follow through with requests, we were there for 3.5 hours with no water service, had to ask for a to go box 3 times. Slow and really really poor attitude. Food was decent, the usual.

_JLOI0OTnvJjucQCKXI1KA.text: Get ready to die of natural causes before you get your food. ......I haven't seen food leave the kitchen since yesterday.

-5bMecrjKEPBvGdGGDz9lA.text: Wow!!  I love this place. Always request for Kenzie's section. She's a riot and knows what's best.

lZoTDvxSPTVGWsUwNymDkw.text: Really good small plate Mexican place. The tequila and margaritas are on-point! The selections available very numerous and of the couple I have sampled are delicious. Taco selection is decent and the results are very flavorful and satisfying. I will be back.

0eIGehZfD5CtAVhkzG3MuQ.text: Swung by on a hot summer Saturday. I only got to see the downstairs, but it was nice and cool inside and the staff was really friendly. Great margarita. I got "the local" and it was delicious! Try it!!

YS0gdjyKy9yWiVCE_ZhhDw.text: Great place for tacos and drinks. Over 100 tequila's. Service was awesome, food awesome, and atmosphere awesome. Can't wait to come back!

GUqLoq_jWwsVC1mld1ezlw.text: Great place, awesome atmosphere and food! Love this place!! I especially love the chips and salsa and margaritas! I will be back again and again!

QTg4HMeMc0K9KtphzShCNg.text: When  I return to Scottsdale I  really enjoy returning to Cien Agaves. The atmosphere is fun and vibrant. The waitresses are all hot. They have a great deal on  taco Tuesdays. They have a wide selection of drinks. I really enjoy the blackberry mojito and the perfectly Arizonan yet exotic prickly pear margarita.  The service is quick and you get chips and salsa before the meal. It's a great place to  meet friends and have a  pleasant evening when you are in Old Town Scottsdale.

iJD-bVjIZYXFTbjdwA4f5w.text: I know that lots of folks LOVE this place, and its tacos, but I just can't get there. My friends have raved about Taco Tuesdays, but the fact that the tacos are fried leaves me cold. I've tried multiple times to enjoy them, but I've had to give up. I guess your tastes just have to run in that direction...

P1wVRfl9EsvcMSLnUe076Q.text: Look, coming from the east coast I was never huge into Mexican food. But let's just get real here....this place is THE BOMB.COM! It's a tiny little spot tucked away in Old Town in a strip mall so it's pretty random. From the moment that Cucumber Marg touched my lips...it was over. Right now they also have the Cantaloupe Marg that is new for the summer and it is also glorious. I mean, the only one I haven't liked was jalapeno and that's only because I don't like a hot kick to my beverages, I like them to refresh me not kick me! ;) They also have the tequila challenge which I have yet to begin, but one day I will start ! You can get on the plaque as well as a t-shirt. Legend says, if you go one step further you get happy hour (or half price, I can't remember) drinks for life! Their street tacos are also D'LISH! My favorite is the Tinga, shredded yummy chicken with their sauce and cabbage! Amaze. I have tried the majority of them and have not been dissapointed. When it's nice out the patio is cute and quaint, not a bad spot to post up having some margs. Otherwise, the vibe inside is also pretty great. Bright and vibrant plus you can actually see the crowd rather than the alley outside where it's a bit more intimate. Overall, this place is BOMB - TRY IT !

tXI2FQ04gONdn9SFO65x9A.text: Great happy hour... Food and drink specials very well priced. And tastes fantastic! We had guac and tacos...awesome

SyW0HhrEBlPf4oboxrV3nQ.text: Hear ye hear ye, no booze in the happy hour margarita ! If you're gonna have one you best be getting an extra shot of tequila to add to that or snap... You won't feel a buzz . The menu specifically says all margs are made to order however I watched this come out of a pre mixed jug. No Bueno victor ;)

Uqj2zWHwhyT1MtjOq40CzQ.text: The food was excellent.  We had the guacamole with the pomegranate on top. We sat outside to get some sun in before our flight back east.

-0ZhwYAgJr8BcLcvxPL2GQ.text: A few friends, my husband and I met up here on a Friday night for dinner and drinks. Arrived before happy hour ended, so enjoyed some guac and chips and a Dos Equis before the real meal. I had a fajita salad with chicken. The lettuce and veggies were fresh and the mango-pineapple vinaigrette was great! My husband had 2 Tinga tacos and they seemed a bit small; you'd think 2 tacos would be enough to fill you up but he was still hungry after finishing them. We stayed for almost an hour and a half just enjoying each other's company and the service was good the whole time.

JNP1aXUeXsCoGYNctTJZLw.text: Tacos where horrible.  Lemonade is out of a gun. Taco Bell has better food!

u9cuN4ArRph6hEqNp-j-QQ.text: This has been a location we've been wanting to try for quite some time to check out their tacos and margaritas. The hostess was very friendly and seated us outside on the little patio. Considered maybe some tequila or a margarita, we decided to opt out because of the service time, water did take some time to get to us.   We reviewed the menu and decided to get the chicken taquitos and the nachos to start. The water finally arrives, the chips and salsa had to be requested and was served after the appetizers were sent over? The nachos were fantastic but the taquitos seemed too plain for what it was advertised. At this point, it started to get a little chilly and we were out of water and the waitress was no where to be found so we decided it's time for the check. I'm thinking next time, tacos and staying inside the building.

s8UAG0kOapHb0i7LuSw-hg.text: My server was pretty dope. She wore some nice crocs. It's always a good day when someone older than 3 wears a good pair of black crocs. I drank a lot of good, cold Dr. Pepper. Be warned Dr. Pepper is not a real doctor. One point of contention though, the green salsa is not as good as the red. Even if you put 2 packets of sugar in the green salsa it is still not as good. I would recommend this restaurant to various others.

e1OzTNp5mEe53CWBF7tgcA.text: Great service, friendly waiters and cool atmosphere. The prickly pear margarita is really good and so is the fajita bowl! Definitely worth stopping by for lunch or dinner.

5xKKgmwF-m_M5t2n5mspiw.text: Best happy hour! You can definitely get enough to eat and drink on their happy hour menu. It's awesome that their HH goes until 7 and is even on the weekends!

zChCokU8W5EZGOKw7_w_lw.text: OMG I loved this place! I wish I could have tried more food on the menu, but I guess that will be next time I visit Old Town Scottsdale :).  The happy hour specials are every day, $3.50 margaritas.  Aye carumba!  They were big too.  I was hungry and they have 1/2 price apps.  I didn't order any but got a fajita salad which comes in this ginormous taco shell.  It was SO GOOD and I had the best dressing, creamy jalapeno.  It even had hockey playoffs on - Pittsburgh vs Philly.  I'm in love, I'm all shook up.

J2n9du22iikBx00p_qh9UA.text: I'm craving a Tinga taco just writing this review.  I love Cien Agaves' tacos!  You can order them individually, as part of a meal with beans and rice, or a platter of 10 for $35.  Pork, carne asada, chicken, potato, lobster..you name it, they have it.  Whether you like mild or spicy, are not a meat eater, whatever... You'll find the perfect taco for you.  Their patio is basically a narrow walkway with wobbly tables.  That's the only negative here in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blackberry mojito..delish!

lOU1RkbYhL3IYJ9aMmSdDg.text: I like a laid back spot to watch Sunday football (with Sunday Football drink specials!) and an every day Happy Hour. How can you dislike a place like this?   All in all I really like the lay out, the server we had was extremely friendly and the food was great. I love their metal star lights, the open floor plan (the above loft is really cool) and of course a more "modern mexican" feel. We ordered chips and guac, their complementary salsa and a friend got the nachos. We each had a Frozen House Margarita and the bill was only $28 between the three of us.   The guacamole was really well made, nice and chunky with a good hint of lime and chopped up cilantro and tomato. The portions are massive for only paying half price! You can't go wrong with their specials with the amount of food and the strength of the booze you get.   I've only been here one other time and again had a great experience. They have various taco options that are very good--not crazily adventurous but they will hit the spot and keep you satisfied. This is a nice little addition to Old Town, whether it's for drinks, sports or a little bit of both.

GOJt9cqvmT32UOfsZ_xNMA.text: A little taste of mexico in old town!  And we all know how I love mexico!  Good everything, service has always been great, and I love their happy hour specials!

mStY4R04FbtmrqMIM1mOpQ.text: Came in at 10:20 pm on a Sunday evening after seeing they close at 11 (been driving around looking for dinner).  Upon entering, the bartender greeted us by saying, "the kitchen is about to close, would you like to quickly place your order"?  Then she shoved two menus into mine and my Fiance's hands.  I questioned the rush and found out the kitchen wasn't closing until 10:45 (why before 11?).    Upon taking a table our waitress also hurried us to order.  When our food arrived at 10:35, the meat in my tacos was room temperature, while my Fiance's meal was cooked well.  The waitress was just a step down from jogging everywhere and rushed every part of the service.  At one point her hurry to clear our table, she knocked over my beer which was thankfully 90% empty by then.    I don't think I'd like return, especially within an hour of closing.  Update: Both of us have had extreme stomach issues since this meal now as well.

4fbTMaGBqyI03D8EgvfIPg.text: I'm from the Southeast, so it's possible my standards for tacos and margs aren't as high as someone from the Southwest, but this place was awesome.  Husband and I stopped in for lunch, had the prickly pear and watermelon margaritas, queso, and tacos and an enchilada.  Everything was amazing...margaritas were perfectly mixed, fresh, not too strong or too sour.  Queso was excellent, as were the salsas, and my husband had a side of guac and said it was excellent as well.  Now the tacos...the shredded beef taco was maybe the best thing I've ever eaten.  I didn't even share a bite with my husband.  I think it ruined tacos for me forever.  Hubby had a couple of other tacos as well and loved both of them, I also had a cheese enchilada and it was very good...but overshadowed by the taco.  Very reasonably priced for the quality of the food.  Service was great as well, but we were there for an early lunch on a Friday and the restaurant was not busy at all.  Looking forward to coming back next time we're in town!

tRr7yX0RZl0Rnzis9c7zEg.text: Taco Tuesday is my one of my main reasons for living. They have an amazing happy hour on Tuesday where tacos are $2 and house margaritas are $3.50. If you need a good place to be obnoxious and talk shit, this is the place as it is LOUD. During their rush, service can be kind of slow and you have to ask for free chips and salsa to be delivered to your table. (I am of the mind that all restaurants, Mexican food or no Mexican food, should serve free chips and salsa. But I digress.)   For the price and the location, you can't beat it. Thank you Cien Agaves for helping me tolerate the rest of  my work week after getting drunk on your extremely cheap and tasty margaritas on Tuesdays.

rT22Hn-7tvb1NNG8G2GZ3A.text: Only okay.  On a visit to Old Scottsdale, I visited Cien Agaves based on Yelp reviews. The waitress was friendly - if not particularly knowledgeable. I asked for an old-fashioned "not too sweet" margarita - made with lime juice and simple syrup rather than sour mix. She had no idea what I was talking about.    I got the Two Taco plate  - a 'tinga' and a 'carne asada'.  The 'tinga' tasted like the oil in the deep fryer hadn't been changed in a while. kinda stale. The meat in the carne was both fatty and gristly. Maybe I just got a bad piece, but there were several inedible chunks in a fairly small taco. The rice and beans were bland.  After I finished up my meal, the waitress asked if I'd like any more chips. I mentioned that I hadn't  had any to start with, so I couldn't exactly have 'more'. She gasped "didn't I bring you any chips?" Nope.  She got them, but needn't have bothered. They - like the tinga taco - were too oily and  stale tasting. The salsas were just not all that interesting.  Nothing here was bad, but nothing was all that good either. I wouldn't go back.

TvgZMGggV1og2zbhTarv0w.text: Delicious tacos, unique and tasty margaritas, great casual and energetic vibe. Our server, Dominique was fantastic.  (Try the beets bowl - so good.) check this out for moderately priced delicious food!

2TfTVwEkeV9qLPOmvWcuaQ.text: Art is amazing ... 100 % Puro Moises. Food is barely edible. Margs are watered down sugary mess. Was excited about the green chile cheese crisp with carnitas which the waitresses recommended but the green chile had zero favor. Overall a disappointment.

agKQn4RPPef9g-lciFAvuw.text: After a chaotic, drawn-out airport experience with my family and first air travel for my two infant nieces, we walked a few blocks of old town and thought cien agaves made the best walk by impression. Our seating needs looked doubtful at first, but the staff quickly scrambled to accommodate our party of six adults and 2 babies. The menu is full of everything you expect for Mexican and more, mainly a large variety of specialty tacos. I mainly enjoyed local craft beers, guacamole, and tacos. Great drinks, great food, great staff.

o0-g9bAf2YwVP_4rQyhtDw.text: It's called 100 Tequilas, it's gotta be worth a shot, right? I've been here more than a few times and was pleased each time. This place is kind of tucked away on one of the many side streets in Old Town Scottsdale but it's worth the trip.  I love that they have happy hour DAILY from 3p-7p. You can literally have a few margaritas ($3.50) and half price appetizers or ($1.50) tacos by yourself for about $25. I went there on a Sunday afternoon with 2 other ppl and we ordered about 7 appetizers, 9 margaritas, a dessert and coffee for a little over $60 and we were all full. All in all, the food was pretty decent as were the drinks. I'd come here again to just hang out with a few ppl, watch sports on the many TV's and have a few drinks.

URZ_o6jugSdaW0CszN0Skw.text: Well that was an interesting set up.  I walked in and sat down at around 12 noon and 2 waitresses passed me by several times never said a word to me. The bartender finally saved the day when he walked over and handed me a menu.  I don't know if he was supposed to play the role of bartender AND waiter  but he did a better job with customer service than the two waitresses did.  The food was good I'll give them that, but I'm really turned off by the over all customer service except for the bartender.

jaxp8aHH68WPn2TyDph82A.text: man, this place was good. after a few drinks down the street for cinco de mayo, we walked over to cien agaves for some tasty food.  despite being quite full, we were seated within 5 minutes of arrival. you have to ask for the chips and salsa, and we did, and they were possibly the best complimentary chips and salsa i've ever had! the salsa's were even hot! as in spicy....  3pm rolled around and we started our happy hour drinking. 3.50 for house margaritas...not the crappy pre-made mix kind...the good stuff! and boy were they good! so good i had 2, could've had more, but the day was young. i ordered the cheese enchiladas and unlike most "mexican" restaurants, ay chihuahua, these were awesome! the tortillas were cooked evenly..no rubbery ends to gnaw on. the cheese was gooey and plentiful and the sides of rice and beans were a nice filler.   service was fantastic...kept the water coming and despite the place being packed, she checked on us constantly throughout our hour long stay.   i can't wait to hit up their daily happy hour again, 3-7pm!

RpNXIDbPGxYVfjSOAyq0hw.text: Worst service ever! Ordered my drink at 6:40 for happy house and wasn't served until after 7.  I repeatedly had to ask another server for our drinks and then finally they brought them to us. When they brought out the food that I ordered (2 Carnitas tacos) they were ice cold in the middle and I had to send them back. I will definitely not be returning. The drinks were ok, but after waiting over 20 minutes for a dos Equis and cold food, no thanks.

nlsHA6Q6mK7jhjC9w6VNxQ.text: A fine enough Mexican restaurant. Pamplona soup was very good, somewhat spicy. We shared the chicken fajitas. Plenty of food for two at a good price. But charge me $1-2 more and have some sour cream and guacamole on the side! Chicken had no real flavor. Friendly staff.

IFHLAFLHIUvrzDmx0CEzOQ.text: Great atmosphere!  We have visited this place several ties, and at different times - always fun.  Food is good, and their selection of flavored margaritas is very creative.  Service is very good too.

x0VMRkQvqad6Eyb7GBFiMg.text: BOOM goes the taco dynamite.  My co-workers and I (all of us except the vegetarian, not sure who invited him) thoroughly enjoyed the beef and chicken tacos.  The hard taco shells are the perfect combination of crispy and soft and the toppings were generous.  5 stars, two thumbs up and whatever other positive affirmation you appreciate.   It was a serious work affair, so we didn't get the chance to worked destroy the tequila selection, unfortunately.  Next time Cien Agaves, next time.

XvseZqtbWTZXZudcz-iLSw.text: Extremely dissatisfied I would give 0 stars if possible had issues with flat sodas burnt food dry chicken cold beans etc very upset with how we were treated.We addressed it with server who said she would bring a manager that never showed up and we had a party of six! Poor service crap food would not recommend!!!!

D5BjtK_Hcf3yStYeuCK4rQ.text: Cien Agaves is a funky little joint located right in the middle of Old Town Scottsdale. They are known for their tacos and tequilas... 15 different tacos and 100 varieties of tequila to be exact. It's casual, open late, and their menu was calling our name when my husband and I arrived in Scottsdale one recent evening.  We started with the tasty chips served with two salsas (one a mild red and the other a sweet verde) and chose a large margarita to split. There were also 16 different margaritas on the menu, and we went with The Local. The concoction of Cruz Silver Tequila, fresh squeezed lime juice, and triple sec was a hit with both of us. This place was beginning to feel like a "choose your own adventure book" meal and I was feeling adventurous!     Carrying on with our adventure, it was time to pick the entree. Being that they are known for their tacos, I went with... pasta! Just kidding. I got the tacos, silly. There are three options to choose from depending on how hungry you are. You can go with a two taco or three taco meal (served with rice and black or refried beans) or a ten taco platter. With any of the three, you can mix and match your taco selections. I picked the Tinga Taco (shredded chicken breast braised in chipotle sauce, cheddar, lettuce, tomato, and mexican crema in crispy corn tortilla), Pollo Asado Taco (grilled chicken breast mixed with pico de gallo, topped with guacamole in a soft flour tortilla), and Tecate Fish Taco (beer battered ono, cabbage, mango salsa, and baja sauce in a soft flour tortilla). I can't even choose a favorite, as all three were equally delicious! My husband opted for a chicken chimichanga that was filled with shredded breast meat, rice, and cheddar then topped with even more cheese, guacamole, and sour cream. It was roughly the size of a brick. I kid you not. I believe I even saw a neighboring building built out of these monsters.  After my meal, I totally feel like I chose all the right paths in my adventure book. It was so much fun, I hope to go down a few different paths sometime in the future and see where they might lead.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mix &amp; Match - 3 Taco Dinner
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Chimichanga... It&#39;s roughly the size of a brick!

YlZkMxe2rlaXTyoSulbD-g.text: The fiance and I went here not too long ago and the place was dead, which typically is not a bad thing.  Cien Agaves  is the typical Scottsdale restaurant trying too hard to be hip, cool, and gilded.  If you wear a tapout shirt, a trucker hat, own a purse that has Coach or Louis Vuitton logos plastered all over it, or support your millionaire-like partying lifestyle with a $30k a year job, then this is the place for you.
