It comes off as an insincere/non-genuine attempt to produce quality southwestern food and the forced atmosphere comes off as tacky.  And a large tequila selection does not legitimize a restaurant - what a large tequila selection is to a restaurant is what a corvette is to a 50 tear old man in a mid-life crisis, they are trying to compensate for something.  Meal: I took full advantage of the pork and chicken tacos.  The fiance had three or four vegetarian tacos.  We both had a margarita.  I had the house margarita and she went for a fruitier (I want to say raspberry, but I could be totally off . . . SAMSONITE) style of margarita.  Taste:  Ehhhhhhhhhhhhh, these tacos didn't leave a good, lasting impression.  The key to an outstanding taco is an outstanding tortilla.  That doesn't mean they have to be homemade, but it does certainly help.  These tortillas were no where close to being outstanding.  The tortillas were incredibly dry and cold.  They lacked the structural integrity to keep all the guts of a the taco in tact so you can eat it.  It turned into a complete hot mess when the fiance and I went to dig in.  The fillings were significantly lacking any real seasoning.  For example, one of the tacos I picked was supposed to include green chiles.  I saw stuff on the taco that looked like green chiles but it sure as hell didn't taste like it.  To top it off, the margaritas weren't that good either.  5 out of 10.  Value:  Like the margaritas, the value was nothing to brag about.  Not bad, not great . . .   I didn't feel ripped off after I paid for the bill, but it felt like the meal was missing something else given the price we paid.  2 out of 5.  Service/Cleanliness:  The waitress really seemed like she was pissed off to be at work that day.  We constantly had empty water glasses.  She would swing by to pick up empty glasses, plates, and other things but wouldn't ask us if we needed anything else.  And she would always run to the bar to talk to the bartender and another server.  We were the only people in the place.  There was no excuse for the poor service.  3 out of 10.  Atmosphere:  See above opening statement.  I guess I jumped the gun and couldn't put my thoughts in the right location in my review. 1 out of 5.  Overall:  There are so many better places to go to in the valley, why bother coming here?  11 out of 30 points, 1 out of 5 stars.

hedxHP1iWl-M3S8BLbVqBA.text: Unfortunately I only ever write really good or really bad reviews. The service at the bar tonight was so horrible we are having the rest of our party meet us elsewhere for dinner. I've eaten here several times but this has left such a bad taste in my mouth I doubt we will be back. We would've ordered another drink and had our party of 5 for dinner but since we got completely ignored after our first chip and drink order with only 5 people at the bar and waiting over 30 min to get her attention to get a check we will be going elsewhere. Yes she checked on us to put in our order and an hour later gave us a check.

GGUxGTWWavwuVGEaY7Gm7w.text: Came here for the first time last night-- was with a group of about 15 for a birthday dinner. We all met up at about 8 pm, so the dinner rush was over, and the place had more empty tables than occupied. Here is why I feel this place is 2-star worthy.  -Waitress was a really nice girl, but the food and drink ordering was very poorly orchestrated.  -Drinks took close to 30 minutes to come out at one point.  -Food was coming at different times. By the time the other end of the table had gotten their food, we were done eating.. even though we all ordered at the same time.  -My order was not correct. I was hungry and ate it anyway. When I told the waitress, she brought out the correct food for me and didn't charge me for it (which I insisted otherwise).. I thought that was really nice.  -The food itself was just mediocre. Living in AZ, you know good mexican food. This place misses the mark.  Just an ok place. Maybe I would have had a different experience if it weren't a group venture.

aCio7tOmOSD9_GRBZzCxVg.text: This is how you do it.  Walk to the bar.  Order 3 island shrimp tacos with flour tortillas and a Cadillac margarita.  Then sit back and mark this review as useful.

taOSZBscJoYx0dJmG4qIvQ.text: My first visit to Tacos and Tequila was yesterday.  I seated myself in the bar and was greeted by a very cordial bartender who took my order. I ordered two carne asada tacos, beans and rice which was $11.50 The bartender brought chips, a red salsa & a green salsa. The green salsa was very good.   When my tacos arrived I was very disappointed.  Each flour tortilla had about two tablespoons of meat in it and nothing else. No guacamole or salsa fresca. The rice was kind of just glopped on the plate and the beans were very bland, they tasted like they had no salt or seasonings at all.  The plate presentation was one of the worst I have ever seen and I just felt that whoever made the plate had no love of cooking.  I will not go back. I will say that had anyone asked me how the food was I would have told them how I felt about it... but no one asked.

8xzP85rGTy-aZp0n7zOLyw.text: We were in Scottsdale for an early dinner on a Wednesday night. Decided to give cien agaves a try, and boy are we glad we did. We sat in the courtyard area, which really helped since the inside is nothing to write home about. I had the three taco special; two fried fish and one chicken. The chicken was just ok, but the fish tacos were excellent.   Also, their selection of tequila is impressive.   My only complaint is that they are slow to bring out chips and salsa.  We were midway through our first drink before any chips were delivered.  We would definitely visit cien agaves again.

4OsctB70ION_mYcejx9YdA.text: Love this place! there last night had to delicious tacos Tinga should beef very good!

zShbSM7qdqKA5s-w34D5vw.text: Love it, I visit every time I come to town. Excellent margaritas and decent food. Reasonably priced and great happy hour specials! Solid 4-star!

skd4lFA5s_KAPJS_qs8mdw.text: I called in an order today and told them no cheese or creme. When I go to pick it up, there's creme on it. I mention it and they come back 10 minutes later with the renewed order. Come to find out, all they did was wipe off the creme. This is a good way to get sued. If someone says no xyz on their food, it's probably for a good reason, for example an Allergy. Wiping it off doesn't count as NO xyz. Deducting a star for a lazy chef who is a potential health hazard.

ZNtmp7yuXtrAQ4ulQ4tNRQ.text: I'm a fan of places that don't try to do too much. "Jack of all trades, master of none" is a system that works for the Cheesecake Factory or the Yardhouse, and that's fine. However, I'd usually prefer to dine at a place that does just a few items well. Cien Agaves is an example of this. They do tacos and tequila. Yes, they have a couple of other standard-fare mexican items, but they're all about the tacos and tequila.  I had been there once before, and last night I went there again for a birthday party. Off the top, their tequila selection is solid - plenty of sippers available, and the prices are reasonable.  I did the 3-taco platter. Based on a friend's suggestion, I tried the Tinga taco, and that was the only one I didn't love. It wasn't bad or anything, but just not my thing. The Camarones a la diabla taco was delicious and had the bite as advertised, and the Ahi tuna taco was fantastic.  I look forward to returning sometime to enjoy their happy hour.

mepy0gO36J8Gx3n-Q2lRhQ.text: Decent food at a decent price. Could  be more seasoned and tasty. Margaritas were gross, nothing special. Crowd was very loud and rowdy, many many young "tool" type guys looking for girls that really aren't there. Reminds me of spring break at Lake Havasu. Overall ok, nothing more.

qlMWcfh-RJt4l5yUPiApFA.text: Service wasn't great.  Tacos were just okay and we had SPOILED guacamole. It was rancid. Gross!     Not sure what all the hype is about.   This place is a bar too, more of a club/bar rather than a restaurant where you want to go to enjoy a meal.    I wouldn't go back.

ZAxoVFiuzGHbwpMzUk3wxg.text: This is my favorite Tequila/Mexican restaurant in Phoenix! The staff is super cool and very attentive. The food is highly addictive, and they have a TON of Tequila. Bob and Rocky are great guys, they always say hello to everyone and make people feel genuinely welcomed. When I walk into Cien Agaves, I feel relaxed and calm. A True beautiful oasis in the desert! MUST TRY!

2M9fxq1U2DOCa_qY8gJXcg.text: Great place for drinks and appetizers., I ordered watermelon margarita and it was awesome.. chicken quesadilla and churros were good too .. will definitely come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HWM69RtsB8MlqeK6HZAWJQ.text: Stopped in for a quick margarita.  Saw an order of guacamole and decided I had to have an order as well.  Big mistake.  Had to go on to a dinner reservation at another restaurant while secretly wishing I was still at Cien Agaves.  Margarita was great and I wish I had an entree to compliment the guac.  Tomorrow???

wXkZBtfZiHcZAFXGd6U12A.text: Average food, stale chips that needed to be requested (not the stale part). Service was slow but polite.  Margaritas not so good especially at $11 plus.  Looks fun has a lot of chachkies and some wall art but the upstairs back room away from it all was a little "blah".

D3H1f7wfpKie9rsnO_MYRg.text: Tacos were tasty and service was quick. Only complaint was server didn't come back to offer drink refills until we were ready to leave.

MUAq8C8kTtpXtEvMI5pRAw.text: Despite that they were super busy the server and host made me feel very welcome and took care of my quickly. Spicy salsa is way better then mild :) definitely will be back !

nptz5U3Kht6F8pQSWSZe2w.text: Holy sh!!!! The rice was nice and fluffy, the beans were warm and calming, and the tacos were full of flavor!!! Oh, and don't let me forget about the Queso Verde, being half El Salvadoran I've had my fair share of good queso, and let me tell you that stuff was prepared with experience!!

YO8XBvKhFtquw_PbOrTWtw.text: Very disappointing experience just now at Cien. We are in town from St Louis and were craving Mexican. Got to Cien around 8:35. Hostess told us the only 2 top table was upstairs and "feel free to go up there." We sit at an open table. 5 min later a server asks us if we were seated there, we told her hostess said pick a table. She said we need to go back downstairs to tell the hostess we sat there? So we did. Hostess said "ok great." Didn't give us menus or any further direction. No more acknowledgment from the server back upstairs. So we moved to a high top (it was dirty but only one available) thinking the bartender would serve us there. A busser got the dishes from the table and we were still not acknowledged by any server. At this point it was 8:55 and we decided to leave. No waters, no menus, no acknowledgment. Honestly pretty unbelievable.

MW9CGtx6uDyMTqbNg25eWQ.text: Awesome bar and margs. We also got chips and salsa for free because we came in before closing on a Monday and had a nice bartender who hooked us up. Nice menu with tons of options!

8YyQnKjHAuQZowY7tn69rQ.text: Got to table waited 15 min. No menu, no I'll be right with you. Poor service and not enough employees to handle the amount of people they let in. We left as we were disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AYApF8yxyrZlmWNWNJEUGw.text: When you blow into town like tumbleweed and need some drinks and food this is a great spot. It's location in old town area is great. Easy parking about a block away. It's a cross between a bar and a restaurant.  It just has its own feel. The food was delicious. My friend had the prickly pear margarita and talked about it our whole trip. So it must have been way above average!  I would gladly go back!

Lx9gegI8T9_1mnYnLVuN2w.text: I dined at Cien Agaves for an early dinner on Halloween. Walking into the establishment, my friend and I were greeted by a friendly hostess who gave us the option to sit in or outside. The interior design of the place is pleasing and makes you feel like you're in a Mexican saloon featuring sugar skulls and luchadora mask paintings/murals.   Our server Adam was friendly and attentive. We took his recommendation to order the pulled pork queso appetizer, which is half off during happy hour along with all of the other apps. I have been recently dissatisfied with queso dips at various Mexican joints such as Diego Pops and Illegal Pete's to name two but I could not stop eating this queso... it was perfectly balanced, flavorful, and fresh. For entrees, we ordered tacos. They have a great selection all served a la carte and you can mix and match if you do a plate with rice & beans. I substituted the rice & beans for their elote (Mexican street corn). Many restaurants attempt to recreate elote, and by no means was Cien Agaves traditional, but it was DELICIOUS. The tacos I tried were grilled mahi mahi, carne asada, and shrimp diablo. The shrimp diablo was less spicy than anticipated - I found the beer battered shrimp taco my friend ordered to be more spicy actually.  Overall great experience, looking forward to returning and trying more delicious food!

g-SdemRp-k-NkkowEibkyw.text: Great food! Great service! I had the combo #5 shredded beef taco and chicken enchilada. Highly recommend!

cYagI75DriNJ-P_RlTBIEA.text: We had great service and even though the food might not necessarily be authentic Mexican, the dishes are light/fresh yet also filling.   The ceviche appetizer is no more than OK, but the tacos are delicious and super flavorful.  Good outdoor ambience, real cute too.

Ry6YH0TYunxr8PkuqxD2yA.text: Lunch on Friday, March 9. Two tacos with rice and beans for each of us. One margarita for each of us. Taco plate was overpriced, but I knew that when I ordered. God bless them for getting as much as they can. However, as tasty as the tacos were, the beans were in need of more salt and the rice was BARELY room temperature. The homemade margarita mix was delicious, but how about being able to recognize that there is some tequila in them - must have been the smallest shot glass on earth. Service was good and the ambience was excellent. If I want a taco, I'll go back for happy hour when they're $3, not $4.75.

Gm55y5hvJEoxu2mtGLcaSQ.text: Great food! Great staff! Great service! It's a small place that gets very busy so be patient when waiting but the food and drink are so worth it! I loved my shrimp salad and my hubby loved his tacos!

zTnU0ewbyLI2ziIYWWVj3w.text: Great food at reasonable prices.  I sit at the bar, not at at table, and you do have to fight to get the bartender's attention even if it's not that busy.   The happy hour specials are worth checking out and the margaritas are solid.

3RjU5_zs9q9PFCfVEHE5iA.text: This place is more than 5 stars. Been to this place too many times to not leave a review! The tacos, enchiladas, margaritas, and deserts are phenomenal. The deals are amazing too on Taco Tuesday, shredded beef and Tinga tacos are great! Please go to this place! Best place in Old town Scottsdale!

F-ro0Ob44Ph6JAp4WEsM_g.text: Still hands down one of my favorite not so hidden gems in Scottsdale. Great tacos & tequila   *if you're up for a fun night hit up one of their tequila tastings* YUMMY

VOKgyLcyo2P2N-EL3NQRfA.text: Great atmosphere great service the food was really good they have a patio but we didn't know that until we got in. Probably the only negative was I've never been charged for a side of jalapenos before.

akwcMJA1Sktjskfi7w2-CQ.text: So cute on the outside, so disappointing in reality.  I had 3 tacos, Diablo  shrimp, beer battered fish and grilled mahi mahi.  The mahi mahi was bitter and flat out inedible; I'm not sure if the fish had gone bad but I wouldn't have eaten it either way.  The beer battered fish was a tiny sliver of fish over an overly sweet garnish/filling.  The spicy shrimp were cloyingly sweet and tasted like someone had put a scoop of cheap Chinese food in a corn tortilla.  We brought this to the waitress's attention and they credited $2 to our bill.   My husband's salad was decent but quite pricy by the time he had some extra vegetables and guacamole added.  The guacamole and queso we had to start with were both fine, as were the rice and beans served as sides.  I vacillated between a 1 and a 2 on this rating and decided to be generous with a 2.  If street tacos and tequila are what you're craving I'd recommend Joyride Taco House which is a 4 or 5 star experience for the same concept.

QwOByVD0lP2tgII8H3UJGQ.text: The food was a bit boring and the service not so good. It looked like there were a lot of people working there as a lot of people were going in and out of the kitchen. You could not tell if they were employees or not as almost everyone dressed differently. There were also some interactions between what I am guessing were employees that just was not appropriate in my opinion in a restaurant. Maybe I hit it on a bad night but I was not impressed in any way. It is a hole in the wall joint but they can be the best as well.

J3T2ERo0_OlNYroQnU42wg.text: The service was poor at best. We were there for over 2 hours not because we were lingering. We had the tacos and they were nothing special, especially for the price. One of the tacos, the pork Al Pastor, had no sauce, was dry and had very little meat on it. I will not be back. I never give reviews in restaurants but felt strongly about this.

vfSdLxTzkSR50jMCJI4x3g.text: It's definitely a place for the younger crowd.  VERY loud inside.  I had a couple tacos that were pretty good. The waitress was great.

I1himH-8yYJv2_wSzcLl3Q.text: My Husband and I stopped into the restaurant for lunch on a January afternoon.  We were greeted by our server Ashley who was very friendly.  I started with a Habanero Margarita and it was great and I also had an organic margarita which was also good and not too sweet.  The Camarones A La Diabla  and the Taco Al Pastor were both great choices.  My husband and I also had a flight of Tequila and our server put it together for us with the most popular, server favorite and bartender favorite.  They were very good choices.  There is 100 tequila selections ranging in price and it was nice to have a server that seemed to be knowledgeable on tequilas.

U2N_ch3b_BmivJvYnI91uQ.text: We tried several different tequilas and margaritas..not only were they all great the tacos were excellent. The little waitress was very friendly and checked on us pretty regular...we will be back!

TdWm293xpixzqMlN0I-SWQ.text: Our overall review based soley on today's dining experience is 3.5 stars. However, we have visited Cien Agaves probably a dozen times over the past year and those experiences average 4 stars. I think today was just a slightly "off" day for the kitchen.  To start, we visited during a very busy spring training game lunch, and the place was packed with a nice variety of tourists and locals alike. We were impressed that we were able to be seated quickly and got our drinks and order in before several large groups. The salsas and chips arrived rapidly after our request for them, and we were happy to have them to enjoy while we waited for our lunch. The green salsa was tart and tasty; the red salsa with a large pieces of onion and tomato (I love a chunky salsa) was even better. The chips were fresh and warm.  We had a very good waitress who kept our refills coming and did a great job keeping in touch with us throughout the course of our time at the restaurant. Like I said, this was very impressive service in spite of the crowd in the restaurant.   My hubby and I ordered our two favorite meals at Cien Agaves for lunch. He got the chorizo cheese crisp; I got the green chili pork soup. My soup was GREAT! It had wonderful tender chunks of pork, plus the vegetables were cooked perfectly to the way I like them, gently pliable but not mush. It also had the right amount of spice, just enough to make me sweat ever so slightly.  The problem with our meal occured with the cheese crisp. First, the amount of chorizo was stingy. Secondly, and more importantly, it was burned on the bottom to the point that is all we could taste was BURNT. When the waitress stopped by to check on us shortly after the meals were delivered, we explained this problem and she immediately sent this flawed cheese crisp packing, back to the kitchen.  Before too long, we were greeted with another crisp. The amount of chorizo was increased, which was good. This time, however, the crisp was slightly undercooked and slimy, making it more difficult to eat. On the other hand, the flavors this time, of the cheese and onions and sausage, came through nicely so we proceeded to eat this second cheese crisp even though it wasn't CRISP. Better than too CRISP, I guess.  All in all, I was sorry to give today's experience 3.5 stars instead of the 4 our meals usually deserve. But like I said, something was "off" in the kitchen today, which lowered the rating for us. However, it will not keep us from visiting Cien Agaves again.

BCg2fPIlSkGhuV99CjU7tg.text: the service what horrible. Come on. That is part of the reason we go out to eat. Bad experience. The Food less than expected.  Im not saying this to hurt the business but to help them understand this is not how you treat customers. Food - salsa was watered down. The food was just ok.

WD_LraEGAdG_Fqk_0M0FWw.text: A disappointment for sure. We are taco junkies - especialllly street tacos - but these were far from authentic. Bland, almost flavorless everything incluing the guac. The margarita was just ok too. The food was edible and the prices were good,  but overall we won't be making the trip back.

YVpwn2u1VObu5GkargONqw.text: Three-hundred-fifty pennies...during HH...for the best margaritas in town...equals four stars!  The chips and salsa were so-so (but gratis thankfully) and the carne asada tacos were very good.  Little Lady had the vegetarian tacos (zuchinni, yuck!) which she enjoyed (did I mention they were filled with zuchinni? yuck!).  We didn't have full dinner service as this was just an afternoon pit stop, but I would love to return.  The patio is nice and tucked away on the side, and we had a great afternoon snack and cocktail.  If I can find a couple solid go-to dishes, this place promises to be my go-to Mexican spot in the 'dale--and the 'dale needs some good Mexican food desperately!

_PdAIJqLqwiisVPWYJVvvw.text: Such an easy place to enjoy for a relaxing drink and/or food.  The staff is always friendly, the drinks are good and food is tasty.  Cool, mellow little vibe in there.

qds2Iv-grd5XFyHGbi6wyw.text: I had 3 of the best tacos of my life here! Island shrimp taco, Al Pastor (with pineapple!), and the tinga taco pretty much blew me away. And you cannot beat the Sunday $5 milagro margarita deal. Great cantina vibe in this joint, plus plenty of screens to watch football on Sundays. And best of all, the salsa was actually spicy!

EGzGquydTLdCtAA6J1F4DA.text: Cien Agaves was a chill place to have a margarita after work, kick back with the locals and get to know the staff.  The rating is more like a 4.5.     The tasty seared ahi taco inspired this haiku:  I walk across sand And find myself sweltering In need of a drink  The salty rim calls My dry mouth is quickly quenched As Richard brings chips  The local spouts off And teaches new crude phrases As the staff shakes heads  Margarita three Thoughts of a supposed friend prompt melancholy  Then regulars laugh the seared ahi taco arrives culinary hug

egEt_bwFcOkqM-JWTK8g1w.text: THE BEST! My friends and I have been coming here for a of couple years and it is hands down our favorite spot, especially for nice spring/summer days eating outside on the patio. The decor is great and the music is always perfect for the atmosphere.  The cucumber margarita is a must try and you can easily fill up on the chips and salsa.  I don't eat meat but my friends love the tinga tacos and I am a fan of the veggie tacos and fajitas. The guacamole and nachos are also great! They have a vast selection of tequilas and a tequila hall of fame.  If you want to make the hall of fame just ask the bartender how and they'll give you all the details. It's a great way to explore and find your favorite tequila.  They also have lots of events and specials like taco tuesdays and margarita mondays.  I take all friends and family from out of town here and if/when I move, this will be the place I miss and crave the most! :)

EakBmGnIBwmFaQVMSLFnqA.text: Every Tuesday my girlfriends & I try to go here! They have the best taco's and deal for $1.50 you can't beat them! The staff is always friendly and gives great service! Their house margaritas are surprisingly good too! I would recommend going here any day but especially on Tuesdays!

_nW2XijXtnj8VdiO9oZ3eQ.text: Delicious, Affordable, and Nutritious.  OK maybe not that last part, but priorities people!  The Happy Hour is incredible (3-7 PM daily) plus Margarita Mondays and Taco Tuesdays.  It's a perfect place for a Mexican escape right in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale.  Enjoy!

vi8D7rPEw4Yf4DeoCo2JRg.text: Great margaritas and a nice happy hour, but was not impressed with the food. We had to ask for the free chips and salsa, and the tacos were just blah

LLAKtzVIJfXp65FDJXkEQQ.text: It's a cool place! More for the kiddie crowd. Everyone trying to be all like that! Cool, or "I'm the most beautiful girl in the world" mode! Wife and I started with the Los Nachos, This was my favorite of the night! Chips piled up high with black beans, chicken, pablabo sauce and cheese! I ordered their Al Pastor tacos, wife had their beef tacos. Al Pastor was just OK, if you ever had Al Pastor, you know what kind of explosive flavor it should have! This one didn't!! Wife's taco was actually better then mine! It had shredded beef that was soaked in its juice, in a fried shell. Very good taco. Tacos come with beans and rice. Rice wasn't that good, tasted like it came out of the box. Beans had no flavor, NOTE!! Black beans were a lot better!!! We also shared a prickly pear margarita, very strong! (glad we shared it!!) I have had better. We had a good time, service was great all away around! If I was back in the area, I could see myself going there again.

Xy0-xNiCNi9XW0_xnCQAAA.text: I've only been to Cien Agaves once, and it was Cinco de Mayo, so I understandably don't have a good grasp on their day-to-day operations.  However, in a city that is filled to the gills with rip-off, overcrowded, overpriced cantinas on Cinco, Cien Agaves was a breath of fresh air.  We were there in the afternoon with a large group of 20.  We received good service the entire time, cheap and tasty cocktails, and very good tacos.  In my book, that's 3 for 3.

LNqqximKD7_CBF8hKjMPMg.text: -1 for the handful of gnats hovering above our table  -1 for the dingy smell inside the restaurant -1 for the dirty cloth napkins -2 for the awful tasting tacos ("lobster" and chorizo con pappas)*  -1 for the practically virgin banana colada  * lobster is in quotes because i highly doubt it was real lobster. it tasted more like what imitation krab is to real crab. oddly crunchy, chewy and trasparent.   i would've left if i were on my own, but i was with two friends that wanted to try it out and we had a groupon. personally, i never plan on setting foot in this place again. i want to gag just thinking about it!

4i5eHwAvTr2Vt3lZbLxPsA.text: My favorite Taco Tuesday in old town! Great shredded beef tacos. Really great deals.

SZN73r56z02ObVBj-wDEKg.text: Came here with my family (including a 3 week old child) not really knowing what to expect. It was a fantastic restaurant. Food was exemplary. I highly recommend the chicken fajitas it was insane. Family enjoyed it. Good ambiance in the restaurant and really nice outdoor seating. 5/5 would recommend. And yo... fajitas...get them

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Family friendly!

LGOfnnemFsgNpO1OvU8WTA.text: Mar 5, for SF Giants Spring Training, was our second visit. Great service from host staff to serving team. Cool vibe, solid menu and great ambiance. Fun spot in the heart of Old Town. Pricing is reasonable as are the drinks!

iW4M_HtYvULGNWru5awo3A.text: Meh. Was close to the hotel so we thought we'd give it a try. I'm sure my rating would be higher if I drank. Service was good, inside was noisy, salsa and chips were good, food was ok.

cqp3njQbpUvEeYusSWe7RQ.text: My favorite place for fajitas! I usually get the Pablano soup for starters but they do provide good chips and salsa free of charge.  Try the habanero margarita if you can handle a little heat, it's delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy tacos and the best margaritas!

KbBowEcfYJrJGm43kzY_rQ.text: Had lunch here recently. It was good enough to go back a couple of days later. It's a pretty typical Mexican restaurant. It wasn't the best Mexican meal that I've had but it was a good value for the price paid. The service was very good and it was at a pretty busy time.

PnZs92FnKjU76p9AavhQ5w.text: Love Cien Agaves - the best Happy Hour in town! We love going to the awesome FREE concerts in the park at Scottsdale Performing Arts Center on Sunday afternoon. Afterwards a brief walk into town, we have a delicious appetizer/dinner at Cien Agaves -  1/2 price margaritas & 1/2 price appetizers... the BEST GUACAMOLE we've ever had!  Try it, you'll love it!!

WlgI7KNh20bSbMMJ1ZKH5Q.text: This Old Town Scottsdale Bar and Grill is a great place to watch a sporting event on a big screen TV. The happy hour menu is an obscenely good deal, and you can easily get a full meal for a fraction of what you would expect it to cost. The eclectic atmosphere gives this place some personality, and the staff is very friendly.

-BXB2W4UCwDRofFWA4LbBg.text: Chicken tinga tacos were delicious. Great happy hour prices. The Local margarita was made with fresh limes and a very smooth tequila. The chips and salsa were very fresh.

0ginMGOJkyrV0-zp513R4A.text: We've been to Cien countless times since my initial review of the place over three (!) years ago. Food is always consistently good and service can usually handle any issue/crowds. We dropped by last spring during a gigantic street fest and even though we were wedged in a corner on their top floor, we still received food and drinks with prompt service.  BUT, what gave me pause on our most recent trip is a new addition to their menu: BOWLS. ("bowls, bowls, all types of bowls...chips and mints and seashell bowls")   More specifically: The Beats by Cien (cute) bowl. You guys, this is a freaking treat, and one you wouldn't expect to stumble upon in a little taco shack in Old Town: roasted red and gold beets, grape tomatoes, grilled corn and chimichurri are all mashed around in some avocado and served upon a bed of shaved sauteed-warm Brussels and dried cranberries. The flavors and textures are outstanding. I think my beloved papas con queso tacos have competition in my heart, and it's this meal.

9QKl94SDOtRWTgZ3PILeFA.text: Mexican fare in fun Old Town Scottsdale.  The variety of margaritas making choosing just one difficult.  The habanero one is good, but you really have to be able to take the heat.  Make sure you have water nearby.  The watermelon one is refreshing but I think I missed the watermelon flavor.  The prickly pear margarita is delicious.  I want to try the avocado one next.  The tacos are awesome - great variety to choose from - try the Mahi Mahi and diablo ones.  Tasty!

Zx9qKEey3WpfPgSNE3SDbw.text: We went here for my sons 8th birthday. The food was great and so was the service! It wasn't overly expensive either and the noise level was moderate. I would definitely come back here!

JA-9bo0-RrqhzQu8hKh5DQ.text: An annual favorite that just went from 4 to 5 stars thanks to Monika. A favorite Spring Training stop while visiting Scottsdale.  Happy Hour is the best. Monika's suggestions were right on! Started with the Queso Verde and then on to the Cheese Crisp (it's actually a pizza on a flour tortilla.) It was great. Topped off with half price Margaritas. How can you go wrong? We'll be back.  Try the patio if it's not too hot.  Kinda noisy inside.

mxkV5yA-i5derj7XuyuOmw.text: AmaZing habanero margarita and food. Still dreaming about how rich the chile sauce was days later.

FA5D9mMtFOZqiCrq0moC1A.text: The reason for the 3 stars is because they really do have a killer happy hour and the location is great. Half off all appetizers until 7PM and discounted margaritas. I'm not a fan of margaritas but my friend ordered one and she said it wasn't bad. I ordered a blackberry mojito and it was the most tart drink I have ever had, would not recommend. Nachos were just alright. Guac was great!

APxq6XOz8K1ttGEFom_AmQ.text: Highly recommend if you love guacamole and carnitas! The prickly pear margarita was also delicious! Service, ambiance and food are all top notch!

rHDhSEPUPn0JQ5Ph2D8ZKQ.text: Quick service. Loved the patio, less noisy. Carne asado taco and tinga taco were delicious.   I recommend the soapapillas with prickly pear jam.

9UKOd-5lDAF45BCSQ_vDOQ.text: I have  found another great place to eat when visiting my daughter in Phoenix.  I went there with my wife and two of my 3 daughters  and was surprised  with the quality of tacos.  We ordered 5 different  meat tacos and were  all delicious.   We had queso  verde with cold beers  and tasty margaritas  while we waited for our food.  I highly recommend  it to anyone who asks.

O1-SGSMFoKOkzOprZjh7vw.text: The nachos were so good... I am a picky eater but they were very accommodating... I was able to get my nachos with just chicken and cheese... The amount of nachos on the plate was insane... Two people could have eaten it....the margaritas were good too... The waiter was very attentive

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oh my god... The nachos were great and the margarita was fantastic... Half price happy hour 3-7

uHelK1DVlaAhMmQiBl0orw.text: Stopped by for late lunch on the way to a conference. Excellent tacos. Tinga chicken was my favorite. Waitstaff was awesome. I commented to my colleague that it's the only time I can remember the waitress taking my order and not writing anything down and getting it 100% correct.

8INI-86-MdnZpIsyVtwgwQ.text: Had the best guacamole with pomegranate seeds today. Also had a fabulous salad with the freshest greens, avocado slices and delicious shrimp. The waitress recommended a great cilantro dressing to top it off and was very attentive to our needs. I also enjoyed a tasty Banana Colada that hit the spot!  Excellent to find a wonderful place to relax  and enjoy yourself when you are gone from home working. Actually plan on going back tomorrow night before this trip is over!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great banana colada!

iWk3FL1s6HJMoCnvPH20Ig.text: I've given Cien Agaves three chances now and they just haven't provided me with anything that makes me to try them again.  I've had the veggie tacos, the fish tacos, chips, salsa, beer and the chips, salsa and beer were pretty good.  This past visit the service was good so that raised it to two stars.  If you are a friend of mine and you want me to come to a happy hour or lunch, do not pick this restaurant.

C2v8ZGVHhk4VxPcGaC8n_A.text: I have been here twice and I am impressed. The salads here are amazing, and I love the atmosphere (especially the mango vinaigrette dressing), as it is very funky and bright. This looks like a great place for happy hour. I have eaten on the patio, and that is very nice too with lots of shade. I also had the chicken tortilla soup which was great with an avocado slice in there and a small drop of sour cream. It had a nice kick of spice! The prices are great and portions are hefty!

medzB1Q4G9pZRA9sLZ8K-Q.text: Margaritas were awesome. Service was super fast and friendly. We sat outside by the fire pit it was a gorgeous evening in Scottsdale. Guac was super fresh.  There were 3 of us and we all had 2 different tacos off the menu and were all happy!  I think the carbine asada was the best.

xd9LwpXXoVZEUJ9-Qgn59A.text: Went on a Travelzoo voucher - what a find!!!!! The beer batter fish taco was great!!! Enoyed the Chicken Fajitas, the taco combo plates. Looking forward to going back, will get my own beer batter fish taco next time and not split it with my boyfriend :-)  The waitress told me they have good specials all week.  Only complaint was the rice was dry.

zwr5zdQdPbuXNYYQSzIK4w.text: When I found out I was going to Scottsdale for a vacation, I signed up for Groupon and was excited to score a tequila tasting at Cien Agaves! Well, I didn't read the fine print and it was only for the last Thursday of every month.  Not a problem - the owner/manager was great when I told him I had kind of skimmed over the fine print, and he still honored the group on.  We had delicious tacos, yummy margaritas and left thinking how great people in AZ are :)

m_p2TBNhaBPphhxUI55Sxw.text: After a night of heavy drinking and regrets, I awoke to the bedside clock reading 4:00 PM. The previous nights events vaguely present in my memory like a faintly visible lighthouse from a sea bound schooner on a cold and foggy morning. I was desperately in need of a beverage and food to soften the impact the previous night's events had on my body and soul. It was Michal Ann who first greeted me upon entering the comfortable and welcoming establishment. Candy skulls and vibrant colors adorn the walls of the tequila bar which many have said is the only place Chuck Norris will sip his favorite Mezcal. After being served my favorite beverage, made to perfection by the legendary Michal Ann, I was quickly served some of the best tacos I've had north of Oaxaca by Alison, who placed them in front of me with a smile and friendly greeting which made me feel right at home. After I drank away my sorrows and ate enough food to calm stomach, I enjoyed the culturally unique and soothing music which plays daily at the best taco&tequila bar in the southwest. On the way out I completed my ritual of grabbing a toothpick and throwing "deuces" to the staff. Until next time Cien Agaves. Until next time...

ooYFHwdVY69e_TkZWZezpg.text: Have had lunch here twice and take out once and each time the experience has been great. The sangria is delicious and the ahi tacos are my favorite. The chicken fajitas are wonderful as well.

MxrCBPvtX4-rnH4TIa-N9Q.text: My husband and I tried Cien Agaves this past week with a groupon. The groupon does not cover happy hour food/drinks so I ordered a margarita from the regular menu. $12.00 and it was all juice. My husband ordered the fried chimichanga which he absolutely loved....I ordered the seared ahi salad ($15)which was utterly disgusting. It was a large plate of a bunch of salad leafs and about 6 strips of ahi. The ahi was not pink at all... and was mushy ewww!  Obviously it was previously frozen.  Lesson learned....order mexican food when eating at a mexican restaurant.

jBjLTG7mIImsuQB84C_ixQ.text: Excellent margaritas. Service well below average. Hostess  clueless. Pace of meal was despicable. Ordered appetizers and a meal. Meal arrived two minutes after appetizer. Food was very flat. Could probably get better flavor at Taco Bell. Won't be coming back except to drink.

c5yCsBuMZdNqr9Gi8f3DeQ.text: Two words: TACO TUESDAY!  Tecate beer - $2.00 Beef Taco - $1.00 ALL DAY  This place was packed.  Live music started at about 9pm.  I have to be honest...I only had the beef tacos (they were a dollar each!) and a beer...I did sample my friends Margs and they are delicious...each one handmade, no mixes!  And there is a pomegranate tequila you must try.  You have to go on Tuesday night!

ouCwDmdklsvHdpoXQviLsQ.text: I checked Cien Agaves out with a coworker last night and we LOVED IT. First things first: everything tastes very fresh. The salsas and chips were great, and we tried the cucumber margarita, prickly pear margarita, and the habanero marg, and they were all good, made with the veg/fruit/pepper FRESH.  We just had nachos but they were plentiful and mighty tasty. Big fat slices of jalapenos on top and visually appealing.   The ambience isn't uniform in places (mixing early 90's modern furniture with homestyle Mexican decor and art), but it's just subtle enough to not be incredibly annoying. The male staff were very cool and relaxed, but the females were a little bit "in the way"... eavesdropping, it seems. We were one of 2 couples in the bar, though...  Regardless, this place deserves 5 stars. It's a very delicious, very easy Mexican choice in downtown Scottsdale.

g-891yjsJXK6IhzkAD22KQ.text: First time today and maybe my last.  While I wouldn't say I would NEVER eat here again, I could live without it.  That says a lot considering I'm a Mexican food fanatic.  House margarita was pretty good, but  overpriced ($7) considering the glass was filled to the rim with ice, resulting in a rather small drink.  Both salsas were tasty (red tomato-based and green tomatillo), both spicy but the heat was not overpowering.  I love the ala carte idea for the taco menu as there are many to try, but found the food to be less than impressive.  I had a chicken taco (pollo asado) and beef (carne asada).  The chicken was bland and at room temperature.  The beef was a little more flavorful, but still only mildly warm.  My husband tried the lobster and fish tacos.  Both were overcooked and he complained there was not enough fish and too much cabbage.  He also ordered grilled street corn, but they apparently forgot to grill it.  Cien Agaves definitely has a fun atmosphere, cool decor, and a great idea with focusing on tequila and tacos, but the experience is lost with average food at best.  Reserve this place for happy hour, but look elsewhere for a good meal.

a4i0HtZN-qbqitKeMIDLFQ.text: I used to think this place deserved at least 4 stars but with the new happy hour specials (1/2 off appetizers and margharitas, 1.50 some kinda shredded meat taco that you can get at Juliobertos for a buck Mon-Wed) its gone down to a meh..  Their soda fountain is never calibrated right and now you have to request the complimentary chips and salsa.  Definitely not my favorite anymore!

ZhjeI3prTaNNgwXgahg-yg.text: Granted, they did take our reservation for 20 just several hours before we were to arrive.....and we did bring in a group of 20 to have dinner and drinks.  Still, the service and food left a lot to be desired.    The two waitress (for our large group) lacked personalities.  The food took foreverrrr......which would seem like a good time to sell some margaritas, but we had to ask for seconds.  Then the food came out, and my rice was cold.    Still, my black bean burrito was good and they kept the chips and salsa flowing and split the checks nicely.   Next time, I'll come with a smaller group.

PmfUeDy3-yqSRiMMP6zqlg.text: Food is OKay.  I had the burrito, but should have gotten the tacos.  The tequila selection is amazing!  Owners and staff very knowledge.  They even have their own hand selected herradura "double barrel" reposado.  Keep up the good work Rocky.

8LxW7OXMCQkLtrCpLTYy5Q.text: Cien Agaves is a great addition to downtown Scottsdale -- and it provides a fun, relaxed atmosphere into the mix of places that either seem to be a) dive-y and dumpy or b) snotty and superficial. Cien Agaves has a cool, open building and has some neat art hanging on the walls.  The margaritas I had here were head and shoulders above the ones I've had at nearly every other Valley establishment (especially at places like Dos Gringos or Salty Senorita).  I came here after work with friends and we ordered a house margarita for $4 (happy hour special). It had a lot of ice in it, but tasted really fresh and packed a punch. Then I tried one of their more expensive prickly pear margaritas -- yum! Delicious, without being cloyingly sweet. We didn't get any food, but the chips were great and the two salsas included a pico de gallo and a really amazing green salsa that included tomatillos and, I think, cumin. Great!  The only downside was the service. Our waiter was really nice, but the poor guy seemed completely overworked -- I think they only had one waiter for the entire restaurant and patio. If they hired another one or two servers, the experience would be more enjoyable AND they'd probably move a lot more margaritas! But I definitely plan on coming back here and seeing if maybe that aspect was just an off-night for them.  Try the patio if you can -- it's lovely and it gets you away from the rather loud music that could be playing inside.

VLYzXIUdN7jbHGV-OHh97Q.text: 50 cent tacos for four dollars while sitting in a back alley they describe as their "patio" while the waiters watch the birds carry away left over tortilla chips.

tPdq_qxLsH58c_XlbMr1FQ.text: They have quite the tequila menu. The tacos are real good. Chips n salsa was good.

qs3mHuU4zYsUKvdBmJYSMQ.text: Here in San Francisco we have a place called Tres Agaves (yelp.com/biz/tres-agaves...), and it's pretty good. One would think that Cien Agaves would be 33 1/3 times better, but sadly, it was not the case. Walking down First Avenue, we saw Cien Agaves and decided to try it. We asked for a table on the patio, and they gladly accommodated our request. We were lucky to get a table on the actual patio, not in the driveway next to it. The driveway was home to 6-8 tables and a few heating lamps. We sat down and enjoyed the potpourri of smell sensations: fresh spring Arizona air, grilled onions and second-hand smoke. The couple next to us sure did enjoy those Marlboro lights. Our server was quick, efficient and friendly. She managed to keep up with our indecisive party of six, while refilling our drinks, waters and chips and salsa. The food here, however, just wasn't very good. I ordered a steak fajita, which may have been a mistake. The giant skillet had a lot of onions and bell peppers on it, but not too much in the steak department. It may have been a blessing in disguise, because the few morsels of steak I did find were not particularly tasty. They were overcooked, rough and flavorless. I did like the atmosphere and the service here, but the food wasn't even of Chevy's quality. It's definitely more of a place to get a drink with your friends and maybe have a taco or two (or ten - the whole taco combination platter). 2.5 stars.

C1DBoKEDZ6ThSToloybdqQ.text: Great atmosphere...  Started with the guacamole which was very good.  Drinks were out of this world great.  Had shredded beef tacos and enchiladas which were both very good also.

tffRresUdvQJUVnmQxBAqQ.text: 5 stars for taking great care of our big group of 12. I figured that service for so many people would take forever. Definitely not--drinks came out quick, food didn't take too long, and I didn't see a single wrong order.   Our waitress was awesome. She had great suggestions (get the cheese crisp with carnitas for an appetizer--yum!). She also had no problem with me asking for my mango margarita on the rocks instead of frozen.  Highly recommended for a group.

PJ6k8D8EL_FweAHiq6_zrA.text: Some of the best Mexican food I had while in Oldtown Scottsdale. They where open late on a Monday night where most of the area closes at 9pm and a couple at 10pm. Enjoyed the enchiladas and was a happy camper at the end of the night.

AtuwNiwMeH5i6jDNNGZdiw.text: We came here on Saturday afternoon while we were in town for a friend's wedding and it was really good! We were seeking out some good Mexican food and this was where the reviews led us. Our waiter that we had (and I hate that I can't remember his name) was AMAZING. He was so helpful and attentive and had great suggestions for everything since it was our first time. My husband had a burrito with red and green sauce and it was a hit. I had their Tinga taco and carne asada taco, and I wasn't in love with the tinga taco but the carne asada was good! I also had one of their Prickly Pear margaritas (I was most excited for this as you can't find these anywhere in Milwaukee) but I was a tad disappointed. It wasn't as good as ones I've had elsewhere and it was pretty pricey at $12. Their chips and salsa were great though as they have a few different salsa choices they give you instead of just the typical one. All in all, it was a good experience and I'm glad we stopped in!

s45EL16ioHg63cSePyHHaA.text: Visiting from LV last weekend and stumbled upon this restaurant. The food was amazing! We had the island shrimp tacos, diabla shrimp and grilled mahi mahi. Everything was so delicious. Wish there was a location in Vegas!

YAMMhsgvRAMuWEzAu6kXCw.text: Great happy hour! Decent crowd nice buzz and feel to the place. Go early if you want a seat at the bar fills up fast. Wish they had a bigger bar.

ADr77ZToEXUAhMEKjVG55A.text: Awesome happy hour even on weekends. 4.3 stars  Food: 4, Atmosphere: 4, Service: 4 Cost to worth it rating: 5 (for happy hour half off house margarita and appetizers) Return worthiness: yes Eve award: best az queso dip  Highlights: - Queso: green chile version was awesome and chips were extra crispy. 5 stars  - Happy hour prices: we got 2 beers, 2 margaritas, a taco, 4 taquitos, and queso and chips for $25!!! - Staff: everyone was friendly  - Setup: seating and bar upstairs and downstairs with tvs to watch sports  Lowlights: - Chicken hard shelled taco: not much flavor and meat a bit dry - Took quite a while to get our appetizers after we ordered  Had a great time watching the Packers win here. I'll be back for the queso at happy hour.

V5J9b5jpE5tIV1WBpu_tzg.text: Made it just in time for happy hour. Happy hour is from 4-7 EVERY night.   Our fantastic server Anne recommended a Tequila. Maybe the best Tequila I have ever had the chance to taste:  Herradura Cien Agaves Single Barrel Reposado    Ask for it cold!***

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Herradura Cien Agaves Single Barrel Reposado!!
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fajita Bowl w/ Salmon
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Top - Tinga Taco Vottom - Ahi Tuuna Taco  Both - SO BOMB

hszvGgHgVc8BlLQ07Iswow.text: I came here alone on a Monday night. I sat at a high top by the bar. Service was awful and very slow but they were pretty busy. Margarita Monday, I guess! Salsa needed improvement. Being from Texas, I'm very picky. I ordered the fajita salad and was very impressed with the fresh corn and creamy cilantro dressing. Would recommend for a group setting.

9X5vhjZA3qCqNEQkA2zsrw.text: When you go to a place that's named Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila, you expect your food to take like Mexican food, right?  Not the case here.  I ordered the Lean Green Machine (made vegan by excluding the yogurt) and, aside from it not tasting like Mexican food, the dish was executed poorly. Everyone at the table oohed and aahed at how pretty my dish looked, and commented on how it looked like it must have tasted so good...but was boring. Even more boring was the small amount of alcohol they put in their margaritas.  Come on guys, I can only fit so much in my stomach, I don't want to drink 10 margaritas in order to get a tiny buzz.  Meh overall!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green bean bowl without dairy.

IfISVuUTkHwnpDUEoUarcg.text: We came here looking for tacos and it was still about half an hour before happy hour.   The service was amazing and they were wonderful with our dog.   The food: To be honest there food was ok - it was decent sized for the price but the island shrimp taco tastes more like sweet and sour chicken balls with shrimp, and the diablo shrimp taco was definitely not hot. It was standard fare that felt tasted like any other big chain Tex mex resto in North America.   But our service today (along with our instable appetite at the moment) made it a  good experience.

5HUUOJNSjO_QQyBMtqkYPA.text: Best Mexican Food ever! Food is very fresh tasting. Guacamole and enchiladas are delish.

TeNJS9bUu2ofdactdInq9w.text: I've only done take out from here, but it has quickly become my favorite for Mexican food in the area. Their nachos and green chile dip are amazing. The nachos have tons of cheese on them and the take out size is enormous. I had the fish tacos as well, but they should probably be eaten at the restaurant. They were good, just something that should be eaten as soon as it's served. Definitely looking forward to going in person and trying out their margaritas.

dA2mDulz-RGL-ogTUwGTYg.text: I usually come to this spot with my girlfriends after a long day of work. Tonight we came in at about 10:15 pm and sat directly at the bar for a quick bite to eat. By the time my girlfriends arrived we weren't greeted for about 15 minutes and finally got to the point to ask for menus. The bartender during the evening didn't even acknowledge us until we told him we were ready to order (I think it's because we weren't heavy drinking during the evening). All we ordered for the evening were al la carte tacos. My friend places in a last minute order of a salmon taco and this taco came out within 5 minutes. Wow! That was quick. 10 minutes go by and our other tacos are still not at the bar; additional 10 minutes go by and we asked if our tacos were coming by, and he mentions "they should be." 5-7 minutes later we asked if he could check on our order. He then goes to the kitchen slamming the kitchen doors, as if we were bothering his "evening." We then realized he never checked on our food, because when the food came out it was ice cold. The bartender never came by to check on our food, so at this point we were starving and just wanted to eat. So we ate the ice cold tacos for the evening and we're very disappointed with our visit. I don't know if the bartender was having a bad evening, but from experience working in a restaurant, please leave your business behind the door and do not let your attitude affect your evening and especially the guests.

mqfAWFBQKrd_3VZhGTbCCw.text: I almost don't want to give this a good rating because I don't want others finding out about our secret, favorite place. This restaurant has the most amazing happy hour, service, food, drinks, and taco Tuesday. They are virtually always able to seat us right away, but if not we love waiting because we know we are going to get a great dinner regardless.

dPxzZRzCKeVP5MXK3vA70w.text: This place is my GO TO for margaritas and happy hour! When I first moved here I searched forever for a great margarita happy hour, and I finally found it in Cien Agaves.  Happy hour goes until 7:00PM every day! Which is amazing for when I work late but still want to grab a drink.   The margaritas are amaze. My favorite is the prickly pear, hands down. The food is also pretty bomb as well. All apps are half off on happy hour, the tinga tacos (my fave) are also $2.   You can't go wrong with Cien Agaves!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Fwvz5lpabWjTxMf3s1ku9Q.text: Got here at 4pm on a Saturday, it was 2/3 empty and the hostess asked "do you have reservations by chance". I wondered why. We were told we could only sit where we got seated if we could be done by 6...ok. We were seated and did not get a waitress until we were there almost 10 minutes... and the place was closer to empty then not. During those 10 minutes we had no contact with anyone, nobody brought chips and salsa like everyone else had, no water, nothing. When our waitress showed she got our drink order and guacamole order. She brought out the drinks and asked if we were ready to order dinner. We ordered then the guacamole came out. It said the guacamole had pomegranate seeds on it, so we decided to try it. The bowl looked like it was an entire bowl of pomegranate seeds, almost no green visible. There were only about half the chips needed to eat what was in the bowl and after 3 minutes we were out of chips. Our waitress checked on us after we sat chipless for several minutes, and I had to ask for chips and salsa as she didn't even look at our table. I'll admit I was beginning to be irritated. Our drinks were ok, my beer was not cold, just cooler, and my wife and sons mango margaritas looked good, but were average in flavor so they said. When our food arrived, the new food runner served 3 meals then dropped the serving tray. My wifes and my plate went down. I felt bad for the guy, it happens to us all. So my wife got a whole new order, done very hurriedly, and looking at it she would've been better off with what he dropped. My enchilada plate kinda spilled out over the side, and I thought I'd get a new one as well. Nope, it was just scooped up and re-served. It was messy with refried beans spilled all on the inside and outside of the plate. So we all ate, the quality was fair, but certainly uninspired to say the least, reminded me of Mexican food in the school lunch line honestly. The rest of my family said the same thing. All and all we were very disappointed. For 1 beer, 2 margaritas, and 5 less than average meals we paid $100. It was mostly a waste of money. One of my sons got severe stomach cramps 10 minutes after we left that lasted all night and took him out of first night of vacation. Our first meal on vacation was no bueno and will probably ruin our chances of any more Mexican food on this trip...a shame in Arizona...

BJnARGTgbFzcVEQ61alDEg.text: This place has some of the best tacos at the best price possible especially on tuesdays. Margaritas are my jam here as well. Their watermelon margarita is my fav because they use fresh watermelon juice compared to other places that uses watermelon flavored sugar syrup. The manager Jami came by and checked on me which was awesome because that shows the people who run this place care about their customers. Love it here.

r_pPg_xxQLQswkgZPUCfGA.text: Great! Support this restaurant! Authentic and a great meal. Friendly service and good food.

LBqoyk1WYvlLL5lwjHQzEQ.text: I brought a group of clients for a happy hour to Cien Agave after a day of training. We had a reservation and they were great at checking in with us earlier in the day to make sure we were planning on coming and if we had any special request. We got there 15 mins early and BOOM, our table was ready! This gave them the 2 stars.  Unfortunately the food was the downfall. We all had tacos and they came out incredibly dry and flavorless, I am assuming they were left under a heat lamp a little too long. Probably the saving grace of our meal was the pork queso appetizer which was excellent. Maybe a couple extra margaritas before the food would of made it all taste better.

e2LOFYhRmK9GwIPCylrwtA.text: Love this place!! Great people, great atmosphere, great tequila, and great food!!!   been here with friends, family, and coworkers. The hh is a fun time and late night tacos and margaritas..... can't go wrong.

iTia0PjMVXa2zyzEdLIB4A.text: I was in town for work and Cien Agaves was able to accommodate our large group of 25 people. It seemed small on the first floor but really opened up on the second. I really enjoyed the artwork and Spanish themed baseball jerseys in the wall, such a fun vibe. We had an assortment of chips, salsa, guacamole but what really stood out was the queso verde with the pork. Simply fantastic! The house margarita seemed average to me, not too different than any other bar but I didn't try any of the specialized kinds (which I regret). Though everyone else got tacos, I stuck with a steak burrito. Very filling and tasty. For the amount of people our server had to deal with he was fantastic! Easily the best service we received on the trip. I'll be back for spring training at the end of the month and will come back for some lunch before the going to the game.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hezLiSDE41CpCOzY7DhrfQ.text: Love the margaritas here. So many to choose from and their half price apps on happy hour are absolutely worth it. Service is hit or miss but overall definitely a place worth checking out.

ftDGvsyOzjs4X-snyxw11w.text: Old town taco bar with crispy street tacos! Relax in the cool bar area and watch your favorite team on the big screens. Waitresses very very relaxed, and the service was excellent. Take advantage of the specials during happy hour or specialty days. You'll ride out of town a happy cowboy!

WmLB_eq-yqxoK8zviDkbzA.text: Awesome place. Enjoyed doing happy hour here with a friend. Food and drinks were delicious. Our server was friendly. Definitely will come back here in the future. A+

fXzTIejhyNJPnedkUbu_Gw.text: " I don't ever want to eat her again".  That is the review of a 7 yr old who loves Mexican food.   The rest of the family agreed.  Food was significantly below average - borderline bad.   Service was terrible.  If you're looking for a place to get drunk on bad margaritas and eat bad Mexican food - this is the place for you.   Except for the beer, Chipotle is a much better option.

AXSbIyFVcglCaFAPDZmWEQ.text: Went to our go-to app when on vacation in Scottsdale last week, and decided to try Cien Agaves based on the reviews. As usual, Yelp reviewers were right! We got seated upstairs, admired the eclectic artwork on the walls, and reviewed the menu that had enough offerings (and enough non-traditional items like the Green Chili Crisp) for everyone to find something they wanted. Topped off by it being #MargaritaMonday made it a delicious spot for a meal. The only negative was the noise level, but that's typical of most popular two-level open restaurants. Good points? Attentive service, clean setting, good serving sizes, nice mix of couples, families, & friends, and wallet-friendly prices made it a place we'd go back to.

5EFGxLxGD-D5wb_W6-4O3Q.text: Let's play find carnitas? Ordered the burrito. Dry no meat. Called for manager she said ya we have had a lot of complaints. Re fried beans. How can you mess that up?  Omg. So dry. I wonder how many times they have been. Re fried. Stay away. There are so many good Mexican places in old Scottsdale

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dTdqje7KLF1n1vT0ipt-1A.text: Reply to Laura... Everything about this post is non sense. I am the customer she is referring to. Her exit from the restaurant was her dine and dashing after she threatened me and I asked to speak to a manger. She was nothing but condescending and rude from the moment she walked in. First of all who comes to a Mexican restaurant and asks for champagne and gets upset when they don't have any? Honey we aren't in a chateau on the coast of France. This is Scottsdale! And I have to say my favorite place I have been to thus far even though you tried to ruin not only the amazing bartender'd day but everyone's  around you. I don't care how bad of a day you were having, YOU DO NOT TREAT PEOPLE THE WAY YOU DID IN THIS ESTABLISHMENT! And you should go pay your tab because technically you can be charged with a misdemeanor at this point. Bless your heart for writing a nasty review when in reality you're the nasty one.

d6gZBRf9nShpm87G7OM_FQ.text: Reminds me a bit of SD old town. Tyler the waiter was very nice an attentive. The food was delish. The drinks were very good. Only complaint was the salsa was not that tasty. A bit watery. Not Spicy. So fix that and it would def be 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

fTUSRRfNkiuVWhFnevHhzQ.text: Who would think you could find decent Mexican food in Old Town.? Located among the souvenir shops is a welcomed destination.  We started with a margarita spiced with jalapenos, that finishes with a little bite to it. We ordered guacamole and chips to start.  Next, we went with a burrito and enchiladas. The portion sizes are large and are very filling. Red and green sauce options are available to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gpHmkpBh0moEIYUNfsXceg.text: Great Variety  of tequilas, awesome servise and environment.  Had a couple new tequilas and can't wait to comeback to try new drink.  Awesome work staff.

tP10fmOGdLQ1CcYoFTKEDg.text: The Margaritas were good with barelyyy any salt on the rim. DO NOT try the nachos. this was so extremly salty i couldnt get myself to take another bite. a little disappointing.

EK59b-xsltYcg-Y43h6DCA.text: My wife and I were looking for good Mexican food and found this place. It was a great vibe, great service, and the enchiladas were incredible. Some of the best I've ever had!

xCmPrnFYdUBG6t_aFGBPDA.text: Wonderful Mexican cuisine! The service was "bar like" but not horrible. Just had to ask twice for a couple of things. But the food more than made up for it! Fantastic!

_Mr2D_nuwPMHN81a7bFEdw.text: Drinks super delicious food was amazing. I had the Carne asada tacos. Service by Nate was awesome. He definitely checked in but not too much. Plus he had strong recommendactions. That blackberry Mojito was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xnlVSF2hNArR7vIF4aDo7Q.text: Monday night shrimp tacos!  Diablo shrimp tacos are just enough spicy hot. Great steak nachos.  Big enough to share house margarine was fantastic.

OFlGrJcy9zWLiKfvZUImfQ.text: Service was TERRIBLE!!   It was a Thursday night and only 3 other tables in the restaurant. The server took our order quick which was great but then it was rare to see her after that. Took FOREVER to get our margaritas and we saw them just sitting at the bar waiting to be picked up.   The server forgot our appetizers of chips and guacamole. The food came out pretty quick but my order was wrong. My boyfriend really wanted the guacamole for his main meal as well so when it never came he was disappointed and waited to start his meal hoping we could stop the server when she checked on us and ask about the guacamole. SHE NEVER CAME!!! We waited several minutes and she never came to check to see how our meal was. I finally walked up the the hostess and asked if they could grab our server. She comes rolling over from the bar and says "you wanted to see me?". Umm yaaaa......   The food even though it was wrong and cold by the time we got to eat it was good but the service is TERRIBLE!!!!

KGMIiZr8wdQkaxPTJT7RjA.text: Been wanting to stop in this place for HH for awhile and I FINALLY did recently. Unfortunately, our group came here AFTER trying HH someplace else first where we were less than impressed, yet had a couple drinks and a little food in us, so I didn't try as much as I would have liked to.   The only food I had was the queso dip and it was SO GOOD! We ordered two servings for 6 people and I'm pretty sure I ate almost an entire order myself. Oops. The green chile pork added into it was delicious!  One of the girls I was with had a couple tacos and she said they were very good. I hear the guac hear is delicious, and I'd like to come back for it.   I obviously had a margarita as well. It was good, and tasted even better half price during HH :)  The restaurant itself is nice. It's two stories and I believe there's a bar on both stories. Lot's of seating and our service was great.   I'll come back.

pfKyeWe1o3VKv7AprWL_1g.text: I came in for taco Tuesday and the shredded beef taco was pretty good make sure you ask for corn. It came out on a flour tortilla which some people like but I have an allergy. Happy hour is a great time for tequila margaritas and tacos. I got the nachos which are 1/2 off and they were not very good... I understand for the price they can't be outstanding. I love the atmosphere and the paintings so I will definately be back for drinks and to try it again!

ws2ZdnYyYOp1__c1StuDMA.text: Went here yesterday after a spring training game. Old town was packed as was this place but they got us in rather quick. The service was great and the food was even better. The quesadilla and queso were both soo good. To top it all off we had a random sighting of Ronnie Woo Woo (Cubs Super Fan). Cold drinks, great food, and good people! I will be back again :)

Dl7oxmPxvHH0v_Rn1AWOuA.text: Salmon tacos were great! I wish I remembered the servers name, he was awesome & very attentive.  Only drawbacks...it was really, really loud...maybe because of spring break and the enormous margaritas .  Also, the veggie tacos were just onion, peppers, cheese & beans...not great., so get the Salmon tacos!! :)

MsptlOLrdZCYqHq5uKOjYQ.text: Slow service, not i food. Not great not terrible. Nothing to get excited about. Much better selections available nearby.   Thank you for responding! I was there in the middle of the day. Maybe 2:00 & I sat at a high top in the bar area.

Wiu-lNMeVk_MFxFaCYk2sw.text: This place seems like a low dollar tourist trap from the outside but it actually comes thru on options and value. They have over a dozen kinds of tacos so if you can't find something you like, the problem is you, not them.    Service was below average. All the girls look alike and I kept mistaking a different one for my server.  Not really my fault since she really just went MIA.  I almost went back to the kitchen to look for her but then again, I wasn't really sure which one was her.  2 good things about this place: ample free parking and copious drink specials.  The tequila flow keeps the place lively and loud which leads to great people watching as well.

uawcRJyoMeqUncuD6Lgm5g.text: I have been waiting forever to try this place and I finally got a chance to come! I haven't had a prickly pear margarita since I lived in Tucson, and was excited to try this one. It did not disappoint. I came with some friends during happy hour and we had a wonderful time. Kohl was a great server and super sweet. I opted in for the nachos since all of the apps are half off during happy hour and they were Great! Salsas were also fabulous. Can't wait to continue to try more food and margaritas!! The only suggestion I would make is to put more margaritas on happy hour! There are so many options!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prickly Pear Maragarita and steak nachos!! Yay for happy hour!

ltq_puvkyf93t02mU7FWcA.text: 10/10 would recommend!! The service was amazing, the staff was so nice and patient (we had a large party of 17) and they were very accommodating as we are all vegetarians! The complementary chips and salsa were sooo good (not only saying that because I was hungry), you get a salsa verde as well as a red salsa. They were very willing to substitute parts of the dishes to our preference. Our waiter (forgot to catch his name) was so patient with us, he deserved a round of applause :) Overall would recommend it to anyone looking for a good bite with great relaxed vibes in Scottsdale!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enchiladas!

8VlAQub0YOYns0Ewalk2kA.text: My favorite Mexican food restaurant in the area! I recommend the Skinny Rita...their tacos and enchiladas are the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Skinny Rita

L2-WsEzelZwRevRbeqafCw.text: Just visited on cinco and had the worst experience. We always go to the north cien agave, and our expectations are exceeded every time. This time, this hostess made our experience unbearable and we will never return. She was extremely rude and snapped at me about how they are not taking reservations on cinco. Completely fine! We wanted to come back at happy hour. Instead of telling us there was an hour wait already at 2pm, she let us leave. We came back at 3 only for her to tell us 2 hour wait when she could've put our name down over an hour before when we were all very sad we couldn't make a reservation! Came back 1 hour later to check on our spot and our name wasn't WRITTEN DOWN. Came back again. NUMBER WAS WRONG AND NO TEXT. She was eating at the stand! We left and went elsewhere. Never returning. So unprofessional.

uFLJyZ5Tdb_24X4MCI_FqQ.text: Good food and fun atmosphere. Chimichanga was the best we've had in a long time. Crispy without being greasy. Great tacos and street corn too!

Gyjva22KpHavs4xyq3yLZg.text: Excellent food. Family of four covered the menu; burrito with shrimp diabla, five different tacos, and a fajita bowl. Flavors were gloriously enticing and created a euphoric experience for our taste buds. The margarita was on point, my wife came alive when the sweet nectar hit her lips. The guacamole was beyond the normal limitations of your everyday guacamole. This is the guacamole we need in our world.   The salsas moved the nacho chips from excellent to the sublime, complimenting the cornucopia of flavors generated by the soon to be legendary kitchen.   And Katie, our waitress, was fantastic.   It was really good. Seriously.

YQKATQLk9sINasjI-oJRIA.text: Came here for happy hour and had a wonderful time! The drinks were delicious. I tried the mango tango and my sister had the Pom-berry. You have the option of customizing the alcohol amount in the Pom-berry and our server was kind enough to give us the extra alc on the side.   I also had the dos tacos plate, carrots enchilada, and chips with queso. All were delicious! Would come back here again! Especially for happy hour!

I_jOH-4gs1Y3yce1jBXJ6A.text: This was a great place that I loved to take my friends/family after a long and stressful work week. The new General Manager, CASEY? THE MOST UNPROFESSIONAL AND RUDEST WOMAN I HAVE EVER MET IN THE RESTAURANT INDUSTRY. I am appalled that the owner of this establishment would hire such a rude person. Completely disregarded greeting me when I came in, I hear her talking bad about customers when I am sitting 2 feet away from the guests she is referring to. And plus the food takes forever there! I will never dine there again. Get new employees before this restaurant goes bankrupt. Casey is not a good fit for the vibe that Cien Agave is going for. Praying for you guys.

G8YoV6cGp1ACiZdcfsb-mg.text: Loved the service, the atmosphere and the food!!! Had the bowl with shrimp and it was the best meal I had here on vacation. I would love to recreate that bowl at home but I'm positive there's some secret sauce that would kill my attempt. Damn that was good.

VJzuoytqGsg5nb__In1zYA.text: We can't say enough good things about this place! Our 1st time was last year & we loved it. We are back for spring training (go Dodgers) & ended up here again because we remembered how good it was. As we expected it was busy after a Sunday  game. They told us about an hour wait & they would text us. We headed across the street to Hula's for a cocktail. We got the text 45 min later for our table & we were happy to see it was still happy hour. All appetizers are 1/2 price with drink specials too. We ordered the Queso & being from California & having my fair share of Mexican good, it's the best I've ever had! The Chile carnitas cheese crisp is also amazing. Service was great! It's on our list again for next year!

33v3IpCOTZVsQkmR_SkNVA.text: We brought the in-laws here while they were in town-- it delivered! Great brunch or lunch menu, and plenty of tvs during football season!  Waitstaff was attentive and timely, outdoor patio had great seating options!

Ma30GChrkebEwSRr5M-Dyg.text: If you want to try some of the best margaritas for the best price you have to come here.  The happy hour is awesome. My boyfriend did the tequila challenge and now his Photo is displayed at the bar. They have really good tacos as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mango and House margarita

Dy17MN4kNtphW_NbL_UGQQ.text: Strike Out- Not much good to take away here. Not the food.  Server was poorly trained, food on the menu - X Salty Fajita bowl had about 3 oz of chicken - X Bland and watery RF beans and canned Enchilada Sauce - X  Maybe if you drink enough at Pattie's you won't notice the high prices and lousy food...

ZOpgH_Ne_zQUEDd9T1ASkQ.text: Cool place. Solid selection of tequila and mezcal. We didn't try any food but will update accordingly.   Also very clean and the staff was very friendly. Thanks!

xE3k5oYu09CqKQx75JSdZg.text: I ended up eating here twice during my stay in Arizona over two days. The first experience was great, I came in for lunch and had the beet bowl with Mahi Mahi and a sangria. Both were delicious, fresh and the server was nice. It would've been a 5 star review but I ended up coming back for dinner with my parents the next day. We ordered the fajitas and a tostada salad. The food wasn't fresh, it was pretty dry, and a dirty appetizer plate was brought out. I'm not a local so I can't say if that was just an off day for this place, but it has a lot of potential.

K-38IWpxy0BO1T-68sRKhg.text: I had a great time here, I enjoyed the prickly pear Margarita and the tacos. The service was great!! And our waiters was so nice , she gave great suggestions about the drinks.

7I0t7dIJ7NfMFiEs9cUedg.text: Yum. I had the Carne Asada which was cooked perfectly and plenty of margaritas. The margaritas are a little sweet for me. I love the atmosphere also.

nSq6TjxnHqtk2ZJrJMbZRA.text: Great layout. Sat at the upstairs bar, so many drink choices! Tacos were good not great; happy hour prices were great, $2 tacos, $2 beer. Seafood salad was good but too much lettuce and not enough topping. Would return.

76-PrKIaSFgTiPIFM7KDPg.text: Pork green Chile is VERY good. They have corn tortillas if you ask vs. the flour that are sent out.  Enjoyed the "heat" on the Habanero Margarita. Red salsa has WAY TOO MUCH raw onion. It overpowers the natural ingredients of the salsa. Surprised that I would find this on two separate visits. Chef should know better (or obviously not checking sous-chef)

tQwakXncH2DtsAaABUbBaA.text: We just moved here and we've been twice already. Great happy hour prices and delicious food. The tinga tacos and fajita bowl are our favorite!

Kr2Rvs5p1OON29n9KGQzug.text: Decided to give the restaurant another chance after a very poor review last time we dined there. And going there for years and was always great always took out of towners there. Last two dining occasions or below average.Was there again this evening bar service was terrible and the food was cold. They can't handle large crowds which is mostly a young college crowd these days. Disappointing.

YbE2OCXTUwd_tDz7BMsICQ.text: Food fun and great service totally recommend. Really a fun place don't let the name fool You very family friendly appreciative and accommodating

QGt3Hvx2pUIIwPyxBHgtjw.text: My fiance and I went here for dinner. The place is very cute.  The food was just ok, nothing special about It. But they did have some great food/drink specials till 7pm when we were there. Will I go back for the food? no. The food lacks flavor and that is what makes Mexican food so great.
