But I'll go back for margarita.  Overall ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yes please!

Sc25-oKXl2ahNLth922XKg.text: We showed up after calling 30 minutes before and we were told 30 -45 minute wait and when we got here they told us there was a 2 hour wait . Horrible customer service , no apologies from rude girl at the desk

xwyBQ3R1gIAKYHZMPfWfmg.text: Not bad Taco/Mexican food place. I had the Chicken Burrito and it was a 6 out of 10. Chips and Salsa were delicious and they have a huge selection of Tequila. I'd love to re-visit this restaurant anther go and update my review.

91qP6QhDCdx_P7pyV6r0ag.text: Cien Agaves is a great option for good food and good vibes.  The thing that sticks out to me is how consistent they are.  Like it's always good, never bad.  I love their tacos, and fajitas. Chips and Salsa is FREE praise the LawD!!!!!  Cien Agaves keep doing what you do, thanks for being someone I can count on!

INHSccORy55xAohDMEBTsA.text: Since we found this place a few years ago, we come every time we're in Scottsdale. The tequila selection is the best around and the hosts are always very knowledgeable and helpful in offering suggestions. Plus the food is amazing. I always have a chimichanga, my wife and kids get other dishes, and we all get some appetizers--everyone absolutely loves everything we order. Love, love, love this place.

_SElYsgXJhWcFG4tPXSV8A.text: This place has an amazing happy hour!!! They also have happy hour every day of the week. Their food is better and cheaper than a lot of the other Mexican restaurants in Old Town.  I don't know what the heck they put in their green salsa but it's sooooooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I&#39;d eat a gallon of the green salsa!

d3NkUjc7FS3XkPjFHxcEqA.text: This was such an awful experience. My first time being here and our service was so rude and unprofessional. Our server Conlin was short tempered and did not seem to give a crap about his job. Any request we had or any time he was thanked he just shrugged us off. We kept trying to give him a chance for redemption, but you can only hope for a change so many times. It was busy, so the wait time was totally acceptable, but having my food be wrong, our table forgotten so we could check out and a completely rude server makes me never want to come back again. This is not the place to go for a good time. If you enjoy rude, cold and unprofessional? Sure stop on in.

NY28RWC9bLbPGQVB9zalqg.text: Cien Agaves! What can I say? I love fish tacos (tacos pescados) and this well established eatery has several choices. The Tecate Fish Tacos (crispy, beer battered fish) were tasty.  My favorite moments, however, were watching the little birds scour the outdoor seating area for tortilla chip crumbs and listening to the lively banter of the interesting couple that sat near me.

eMTiWiUqdCkjT7116Flk0g.text: Wow! My boyfriend and I ate here last night and had a great experience. We reserved a table with OpenTable and got into a quaint booth on the side of the restaurant. We each ordered the three taco plate and thoroughly enjoyed each one. As far as margaritas go, the selection is amazing! I ordered the Cien Agaves margarita and it was the best marg I have ever tasted. Last, our server, Kyle, was one of the best servers I have ever had- very attentive and kind. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best margarita I have ever had

cJFEeFoyEfPNRyz6zrmz2Q.text: I was craving some good Mexican food. This place delivered had great burritos and tacos and lots of choices with all the drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0QkuVBAVCAUa8zrmBxxjWw.text: I love the atmosphere of Cien Agaves. The place has a really cool feel. There is an upstairs (more traditional tables) and a downstairs (bar and high tops). There is a great happy hour menu and a large selection of margaritas. Chips and salsa, guacamole, and queso are really good. The salad I had was only so so, but my party ordered tacos for the most part which looked amazing! Parking can be a little tricky depending on the time of day since it is in the heart of Old Town, but well worth a visit if your in the mood for a Southwest vibe.

EHlv5VFysNzkAbRM9j0hZw.text: This is a good, fun Mexican restaurant in Old Town.   I've been here several times, and have enjoyed their extensive Margarita selection and their wonderful salsas (the house red salsa is my favorite).   They have a good selection of tacos, allowing you to mix and match, and the guacamole is great...as is he cheese dip and chips appetizer. What is in that cheese dip that makes it so addicting?  Wow. It's good!  They have a smaller bar and that can fill up quickly, however you can eat at the bar (full menu) or at a table.   The staff have been very friendly and accommodation when I've been here, and this seems to be a spot where people like to come and relax...with a margarita.   Overall, a good spot!

UvZuSE0L6g8mZc5zPPXrNQ.text: Made reservations for a booth, and when we got there we were seated right away. Yesterday we tried to stop in, and get on a waitlist but the hosts were unable to give a wait time which was weird. Our server Sierra was great tonight, but she was getting her but kicked with as many tables as she had. Was also a little strange not seeing a manager that should be running the floor on a busy Saturday to help when needed. Tacos, rice, and beans were mediocre and dry compared to the other visits in the past few months. Nachos were decent.

294VgLgNPKfwc-dYRrJKbA.text: I've had better tacos.. margaritas did not seem to have a whole lot of tequila in them... just average Mexican.

xFnHl4Iez0CINFuGglXaIA.text: Decent meal. Probably will not be back, the queso definitely has Velveeta in it, I don't care what they tell you. (We did not ask). It was tasty, but that was the Velveeta. Tacos and chimichangas we're good, margaritas were OK, with a visit if you're hungry, but not one to wait for. We were hungry and wanted to eat now and we got what we paid for and what we were looking for. Really lovely service.

pGTLUj_vF50io2XxEv-u2A.text: Great food. Chimichanga can easily satisfy two people and two tacos is plenty for lunch. Great area of Old Scottsdale.

H38ddDX2sWOw56SE7DDQ3g.text: My first response to parking in front of Cien Agaves was "what in the hell am I doing in tourist land?" Old Town is such a piece of shit. Unless you like fake western hokey crap stores and indian flute music, you'll want to barf. Of course, when you walk into Cien Agaves, you're transported to a different type of atmosphere instantaneously.   They score with Moises' art on the walls, with the industrial looking staircase in the middle of the restaurant, and the generally good soundtrack. There are parts of the restaurant that feel like the divey little places you'd find in Guadalupe, and other parts feel like a Tempe college kid bar. None of it, however, feels like a nice restaurant. The diamond plating in the restrooms is oddly reminiscent of a shotty strip club.   The food here was about what I would expect. Not as good as The Mission, Barrio Cafe, Los Sombreros, etc. But much more interesting than a place like Los Olivos. They offer about a dozen different tacos with all sorts of seafood, meat, and bird. Service on my visit was a little slow. We waited about 15 minutes for our check and finally asked for it. Who knows how long we would have waited otherwise.   My main observation while here was the crowd. Even though the restaurant feels like the divey Tempe college kid restaurant, the crowd it draws is a little different. There were quite a few roided up douchebags with spider web tattoos, affliction shirts, and stupid gay shit eating grins with some fake tittied blonde with a nosejob hanging on them. It kind of seemed like a bar for Scottsdale douchebags when they want to "slum it" and have "mexican" food.  I'll probably go back eventually, but if you're looking for a place to have good Mexican food, skip Cien Agaves. If you want to sip a few Coronas and have some tacos and salsa, you'll be happy as a clam here.

pP3JtP41yCEw_knCtcBGfA.text: This will be a quickie. I stopped in last night with a friend to see if this place was any good and worth checking out again. We had already eaten, so we just had chips and salsa and a margarita. I plan on returning to sample the menu, but until then I'm giving this a pass fail sort of review.  It passed.  Service was good and the place is nice inside. The chips and salsa were okay. I wasn't blown away by the salsa, but I enjoyed it. That's more than I can say for most places. The house margarita was merely okay as well. Nothing special. It was served in a stupid shaped glass which was annoying, but I drank it and can't complain.  I'll return sometime soon for a full meal, but I'm not going to bank on this place topping my list of great Mexican food. The search continues.

mFW2curp1RgIJPRHKPnwWQ.text: My husband and I loved this place.  The food was fresh, the atmosphere was great and everyone semed to be enjoying themselves.  We went on a Tuesday and it was $1 taco day.  What an amazing deal.  The house margarita was delicious.  We had a great experience and we will definitely return!

Jt3QbOVtcNo4sk-onmz30A.text: Had the tacos on special.  Yum... good stuff.  But they really felt like "cheap" tacos.  They arrived a bit wet and could not be picked up with your hand without ripping through the tortilla.  Guacamole was good.    Dining area was okay.  A bit loud.  I will probably be back, but mostly because the price is right.

vB4XipT18Z8eVK7KstimnA.text: I"m going to get my one negative out of the way right now so there is nothing left but praise-their Margaritas are EXPENSIVE. With that in mind-they are my favorite margaritas in town (the prickly pear one in particular).  My girlfriends and i love to go there on Tuesday nights because they do $1 Shredded Beef Tacos that are incredible and $2 Tecate Beer (however we always end up ordering the $14 Margaritas anyway, haha).  Never fails to be a fun time over there.

Hj69KKDyL4Agojpy1v8sZA.text: I was taken here while visiting from Chicago and had one of the best margaritas of my life.  I tried the house (on ice with salt) and it was fantastic, but what I couldn't get enough of was the strawberry-lime one.  I couldn't taste a drop of alcohol...and that's when you know you have a good mixed drink on your hands. I honestly could have had three more it was so tasty, but my childlike tolerance for boozin did not allow it.    The bartender was super nice and friendly, we had many refills of the chips and salsa (damn you, I can never resist), and it was all in a southwestern chill environment.  Supposedly the tacos are top-notch, I will have to give them a whirl next time I'm in town.    I highly suggest going here for a happy hour or dinner.

OxvTr_qeGpe4jSawy9lhbw.text: Wow, I really fell in love with Cien Agave because of their awesome selection of exotic Mexican veg options!  I can usually find a few vegetarian items at most restaurants but they're usually just OK.  What I had at this place was phenomenal!  For example their Pappas Con Queso (seasoned potatoes and cheese) and their grilled veggie tacos were can you say mouthwateringly awesome?! Also, they have the most deliciously fresh and exotic salad dressing made of a prickly pear vinaigrette.  But, my fave of all was their creamy poblano soup, was just the perfect amount of spicy mixed with creamy that has your mouth saying "ahhhh" and "mmmmm" after each spoonful.  Looking forward to trying some of their other tasty food creations and drinks at my fabulously new food crush place!

0LGv5qMRYssMHINdJ9yFQQ.text: Been here on a few occasions, most recently Cinco de Mayo and then this past wknd to use my Groupon. House margaritas are great!  Happy hour specials are good! Food is yumm-O! Only recently did i actually eat here... We sat in the bar area and were served by the bartender. It was a Sunday night, so not very busy. Service was great. He recommended the Ahi tacos, which the bf chose and said were good. I had the Tinga and Polla Asado tacos and was very pleased. The Tinga was probably my fave cuz of the spicyness but the Asado was great and lighter feeling in my belly.  Their chips and salsas are great... and Free!  =)   The bf had the Prickly Pear marg, which he wasn't big on... He likes fruity things, so prob just a taste preference thing.  I have a few friends who rave about the Cucumber marg, which i've tasted and is very good. The Chambord marg is also quite tasty! With a name like Cien Agave, i don't see how you can go wrong.

EpKYyAYI4mE6AO5ClgAd6A.text: Good veggie tacos, great happy hour.  Staff is friendly.

yGPfQ35o1c3ooAt8Z7VlIQ.text: Great place! The food and the strawberry mojitos were fantastic! The service was good and it was great atmosphere.YUM!

B_kiilPDid2t4UTJfFz5eg.text: Delicious tacos, margaritas, and guacamole. Very good serving sizes too. Service was good and food came really quickly.

8IFia5US9zLSDGrsa31IXQ.text: I love the taco Tuesday! 1.50 tacos and the salsa is the best in town I prefer the read but the green is good to. The beer could be colder but it a great place to watch the game an eat some great 1.50 tacos! Enjoy

QMKc5QsiuYEvd78ps18FBw.text: Taco Tuesdays should not be missed!  Great tacos, beer and tequila offered for very reasonable prices.  It was our first time in Cien Agaves, pity we had not found it before now.  The staff could not have been more friendly, fun and accommodating!  It is worth the drive from the west valley.

aDMvA0YiuOwuzjShhMaoZg.text: This place has great food, good service, and excellent outdoor atmosphere. Tacos are good, drinks are strong, and sitting outside under the zigzag of string lights is very romatic and laid back atmosphere. We come here a lot and order the ceviche which is amazing. Happy hour is the best, and taco Tuesdays. The music is laid back, and we seem to sit here for hours and talk, and drink, and eat tacos. It's fun to see people walk by and the staff is very friendly.

QvU45iIP5YbqWa05-iP4kw.text: Great casual fare, nice atmosphere, amazing tequila selection. We were able to eat outside on the patio, which was fabulous. Would recommend this restaurant to friends.

g8T4Tw2QB6_NAs6g9Vqlug.text: So many great things to say about this place where do I begin....  WITH THE HOUSE MARGARITAS OF COURSE!! Hands down THE best house margarita I have EVER had. No syrups or mixes, this is straight tequila and lime juice baby, very refreshing and delicious! And for 4 bucks on a Monday evening, how can you go wrong?  Their specials are all very good: Margarita Monday (as mentioned) with half price Apps, and Taco Tuesday with their dollar tacos and $2 tecate's...HELL YA.   They have a great range of tacos here and all are pretty delicious. Try the nachos with Al Pastor on them too, delicioso! Their chips and salsas also kick ass.   If youre looking for a low key place to hang out, snack, and drink then you'll enjoy this place and if you love margarita's then you'll REALLY enjoy this place

YzIdJQPJCJ_hMOXZ4TOy1A.text: We are from out of town and just happened to pop in here. We had the tacos and they were great. The kids meal were great too. My margarita with chiles was amazing. We had GREAT service which is a big deal to us. The girls were great!  Would definitely go here again.

fLeJd7UNsHyOubZAsXekqg.text: This place is of the charts good. My bartender, Wyatt, was the most refined scholar and gentleman I have had the pleasure to be served tequila by.  The owner even stopped by to ask how I was doing. It was like I had known him for years.  I told him I was doing "f-ing great". I like to see an owner that gets out on the floor and gets his hands dirty.  All nice people serving very good food .  Get the cucumber margarita, but only if you want your life changed forever (in a good way).

TDO9-90YFH4U10dfiChIdg.text: We had the absolute most horrific queso fundido of our lives here.    Oily, greasy, paste... yuck.  However, some of the tacos were redeeming.    My chicken was super spicy, my carnitas was too mild - but together they worked well.  My husband didn't particularly care for his lobster (skimpy, more breading than lobster) and thought his pork (not carnitas) was dry.  I really wish we tried harder to find a better place.      A few days later we did - heaven lies just down the street at Frank and Lupes.  We visited on a Sunday or Monday in September for dinner and were the only patrons.    The economy sucks man!

62Fi7Ez5WXOnxY1CYrFbtA.text: Everything we had was great. Shredder beef tacos on homemade crispy shells and fish tacos. The happy hour specials are a hit.

DJVdw5AwEpAnaNDTKfBjyg.text: A+.  Sat at the bar--got right in at 7:30 on a Friday night.  Immediate service.  Great house margarita.  Had pomegranate seeds on the homemade guacamole--never thought of that but will have to do this at home now.  Able to get steak fajitas done medium rare--which is disappointing everywhere else--but perfect here!  Already counting down to my next trip to Scottsdale to come back!

6HQjCCYKgK-QmAr2tYfBXg.text: Have been coming to Cien Agaves for quite some time now. Food has always been consistently good, and so has the service. I usually bring family here when they come into town. The chicken tinga tacos are not like my mom's but they are definitely amazing. i HIGHLY recommend the chorizo cheese crisp, if they still have it. Of course, lets not forget the margaritaaas!

A7AkpJjvWLXIEV7wxf6G8Q.text: My friend and I loved the fajita bowls!! So tasty. Veggies were nicely season and perfectly cooked. We both added chicken and were more than satisfied. We also got the chips, guacamole, and salsa appetizer. Lovedddd the green salsa and thought the pomegranate seeds on the guac was interesting! Never would have thought to do that but it worked. Also loved the decor and the vibe. Would recommend!

b8Lb6PFwoVt2T5lA8vMBmQ.text: This is one of the best deals in Old Town. Their happy hour is unequaled for price. We had beers and two appys and got out for $15. The green chili dip was awesome, They have tacos for a few dollars, nachos for a few dollars. We liked the nachos as well, a lot of food for the money. DO not expect Barrio Queen. Its a happy hour that won't break you. Don't propose here or anything. Well, unless you want to.  And service was great, nice decor. It is kind of like El Hefe without the craziness. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. I don't know why it took so long to find this place, for our "pre paycheck" outings.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nachos
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chile verde
Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar

sHSpnlSzPL8xrRivei3VOg.text: Lots to like at this spot.  Tacos can be good but unimpressive but this is a better result than most.   The fish tacos are flavored with a nice amount of kick.  I am a fan.  The atmosphere is chill and fun.  This is our second visit and we now look at it as a go to spot

x9LgYhfAAeqPAgQVQ4OkMA.text: Great dinner. Fish tacos were tasty.  Guac was also good.  Chill ambiance.  Siobhan was a great server - very attentive and always with a smile. Will be back.

jPzHgbBWULiijwAt1eGc-A.text: Not overly impressed with Cien Agaves, as I'm a True Mexican Food Connoisseur!  I'm all about flavor!  The Guacamole tasted like it came out of plastic bag with a few pomegranate seeds added! Absolutely flavorless, as were the Tinga Tacos, and shredded beef tacos!  My $12 Mimosa Rita was presented well but very under impressive! Service was good, and I'll most likely try this place again, ordering different items next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not overly impressed, sorry guys!  Guacamole far from authentic!

l91duZbnwt7CzaF6Cy56Nw.text: The tacos are the best thing on the menu and reasonably priced. Get at least two, and probably three of you have a big appetite. The sangria is excellent and is freshly made with crushed fruit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside patio area.

yMHo71t1BHn8hgGJe2JQdA.text: Great food, drinks and the customer service was excellent. Every time we go the food is amazing! They have a great happy hour and great bartenders! Their selection of seafood is impressive too!

97xwsrO6zxOnG27fPU3I8w.text: This place's was so yummy! The queso, tacos and drinks were amazing!! Service was great! Will go here again for sure!!

h8Tg_G81MYR4m_KcTVvnrA.text: Had the Chx taco and beef on happy hour and my date had a giant margarita and we spent $14 on 4 huge gourmet tacos and a drink . Very busy so if you have a large group or need table make a reservation and staff is amazing very happy !

tJOcrWPxIYgsjVJBSqIG1A.text: Wasn't expecting much for this restaurant, but we were blown away! Happy hour was great - especially the margaritas! All dinners were large portions and everything tasted fresh. Very reasonably priced as well. Would recommend for anyone!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie fajitas pictured.

Cj38R2lRvhQwnH8ri_u5tQ.text: Everybody was very very nice!! Food was delicious! I got 3 different tacos, carni asada was good, but meat was not flavored at all. Mahi Mahi was good fish, but didn't like what ever they tried to mix in the taco with the fish, and Al pastor was delicious omg!!! Street corn was more than anybody could ever ask for, for corn! Rice was perfectly best! And enchiladas, was like sitting in heaven! Never knew they could taste like that! I would rate this 5 star, however, if the carni asada was flavor less, and the did a poor vegi mix, so it's not perfect yet.. Lol. I definitely WOULD recommend it though!

Xgz_NU2-wZWxQWXUFI4T2w.text: I came in to Scottsdale for the first time this weekend visiting family and came to this area to have dinner and decided on this place after walking around the area. We could have gone anywhere..Came in and got seated by the host immediately who was very friendly. Looked at the menu as we wanted to check out everything so after a time of watching our waitress Nikki standing and socializing and talking with some guys we were ready to order and waited. Ok fine. Food was delicious, so that's good. shrimp tacos and Ono fish tacos were great.  So I notice that Nikki didn't give us chips and salsa or ever bring it to our table! When I see every other table have them! And the other waitress was offering it the table behind us! Um really? Why didn't we get them? It's just showing how you could give a crap to bother. So lazy! I was pretty irked by that, then another person brings our food to the table while Nikki is still gabbing away with her co workers. Ok. We wait for a long time to get our check, until Nikki says she is going to get our checks out to the table. Then I see Nikki Run out the door to her friends on the street saying "I'm off!!!" Um, I'm still sitting and waiting for our check over 15 mins later.. I got up after Nikki was talking away with her friends outside and completely forgets about us. Hello??? I went to the front and asked the hostess to get her and give us our checks so we can leave! Does Nikki not take her job seriously?! To top it off her attitude was so obvious and rude I cannot believe it. Nikki in a huff ran to the back to get our checks. Gave them to our table so fast then ran off again without taking my money even! I am sorry I even needed to break change because she gave me about 5 effing nickels instead of a quarter. Why?! Give me nickels cuz you're mad I asked you to do your damn job?!! Idiot.  The hostess told me our waitress "mother was in town." Um what? She should have said I'm sorry I will get her right away! No Nikki you were not off work! and you should be fired for how you treated me and walking outside like we didn't exist! I wish we had the waitress behind us because she seemed very nice. If it's the end of your shift don't blame that on guests! Some people are not meant to be in the service industry and Nikki is one. Regret getting her as a waitress. And I want yelp to know. Fire her!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The worst waitress of all time.. Nikki!

jKwl7zAF9bNgxASbRp8o1Q.text: I read great reviews about this place, but sadly I was misled. Everything here was a miss. Bad service (it took an hour to get a simple order of guacamole), mediocre food and worst of all substandard margaritas, which is a surprise given the name of the place. An off night perhaps?

9HyrHq4pYHY-n-M7jxM9Hw.text: My absolute favorite margarita place in Scottadale and possibly even the valley! Their tequila selection is incredible, so much to chose from. If you are a tequila lover like me, check out Cien Agave!

F-kAhFV7_STARLBAAGS59Q.text: We came here with a party of 9.  Our table wasn't quite ready when we arrived because a couple occupying our last table we needed had been sitting there for an hour with empty plates and glasses.  My pet peeve!  Please!  If you are a customer, don't just sit and take up space without ordering something - it's so rude!  Nevertheless, the manager was able to set us up outside and actually I preferred that - coming from Oregon we will take outside seating whenever we can get it!  The salsa was so good the chips were mainly just a disguise for me drinking it.  We got a pitcher of sangria and a bunch of margaritas, all very good.  I really liked the flavor of the margarita with the habanero in it.  It was VERY spicy, but the flavor was better than some I've had with a jalapeno.    Our server was really nice and attentive and everyone enjoyed their meals.  The only thing I didn't care for was the pico on the tacos.  It was so onion-heavy it made the tacos a bit bitter.

UNDInVevJPamboKcrcLZyg.text: Love their chicken tacos! But no free chips and salsa. Waitresses don't seem to care about you when you visit. Rice is mediocre, black beans are tasteless. If their chicken wasn't so tasty I probably wouldn't come back, but I love those tacos too much.

BmsFz2byl-DbZ_EftfOl5g.text: Arguably the best happy hour in the area. (1/2 price apps and a lot of drink specials until 7pm on weeknights) We started with the guacamole, which was solid. I had the burrito smothered in red enchilada sauce. Had a nice kick, and the burrito itself was huge. The black beans it came with on the side were very tasty. Tortilla chips appear to be make in house. Patio is very nice and somewhat intimate. Would visit again.

F9ZLqEzZSljPUA3zRD6Z-g.text: I ordered a bowl of soup to-go during my lunch break. The soup was recommended & I was excited to try it. The soup was nice. I have had better creamy poblano soup in San Diego. BUT this was wasn't bad. Only thing was I wish I had more of it. I ordered a 12oz bowl, and got 2 small, less than half filled containers of soup. I spoke with the Manager, Bob, he seemed distracted while speaking to me and almost like I was a bother. He said he would credit me a soup for next time. Thankfully the soup was good enough to go back and have again. Overall bad first impression, and mediocre customer service

gRKPY3MxXm5X0b_OEbxAWw.text: Stopped by this restaurant on a whim because I had a craving for Mexican food and was in the area. The Happy Hour menu made our meal tasty and affordable, the service was fast and friendly, and the music was loud enough to hear, but not so loud that conversation was difficult. Overall, I had a wonderful experience and would eat here again.

VU_UkP-s8MHPJ1kw9bHBQg.text: Amazing Tequila selection and delicious Margaritas on happy hour. The Chorizo pizza appetizer and the green chili pulled pork queso were both superb! I tried 3 different tacos and loved all 3. I ate here with 7 others and not one person walked away unhappy.

33C6Di_gWoDi2xQcrbfPXg.text: Friends from the area took us to Old Town to wander around and we stumbled upon Cien Agaves.  WOW! We're we impressed!  From the time we walked in until we left we were pleasantly surprised at every turn.  We just happened to have arrived on taco Tuesday to enjoy $2 shredded beef tacos and $2 Tecate but we also had tequila, margaritas and other dishes from the regular menu.  Our party shared the food and everyone was impressed.  When next we visit Arizona we WILL make this a mandatory stop.  Highly recommended!!!

l5QVkkQKKywvAkuOiCScKQ.text: Very good fresh guacamole and fabulous margaritas. Service great and very friendly. Nicely located in Old Town Scottsdale.  Would definitely recommend going here.

2Shk9-egnKfrMzQzpZkdPw.text: If you're in a touristy old town, you can' be surprised by a tourist trap.  Margaritas were strong, but food was overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Cien Agaves Tacos & Tequila - Old Town Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PiHnoEEu4LDFP-h11JD7hw.text: I frequent this place a lot.  Its a great Mexican restaurant in the middle of Old Town, where there is a daily happy hour deal.  I'm not a fan of tequila, but if you are, this place is a must visit.  They have it all...  As for the food, I enjoy the fish tacos, as well as the baja lobster tacos.  Absolutely delicious!  I always tell myself I'm just getting 2 tacos, but end up getting 3 or sometimes, even four!  The guacamole is pretty good here as well. It always seems to sneak its way on our table as well.    As for the service:  My fiance and I come here a lot, so we've had our share of good and bad servers.  Some are very friendly and are more than happy to please you, however, we've had a server or two who never checks up on you and takes 20 minutes to bring a beer even when its not busy.  Service is kind of hit-or-miss, but the food definitely makes up for it, and the prices are more than fair.  We've even used Cien Agaves to cater for a baby shower.  They allowed us to rent out the upstairs area.  It was out of the way and private, and the food was very satisfying.  They did a great job.

FzynsacJRwOyOxEATyBugg.text: Walked upon this place tonight and very happy I did. Margarita perfect! My waitress Heidi very pleasant and attentive and offered to switch my taco after I realized it was too spicy for me. Tacos and guac perfect.  Would definitely recommend!

hP6wP6exX_aSlXsGkt8YSQ.text: This is an awesome mexican restaurant. The food was wonderful and the staff went out of their way to give us a memorable experience. We had reservations , and the table was not vacating. We waited 20 min. The staff set up a delightful table for 7 people outside,they brought in heaters and lit the Fire pit. Lovely atmosphere for making us wait. The staff, brought us delicious apps. And after our meal they brought desserts. Very kind of our waiter Connor, who took good care of us. Thanks Connor for a great night.

7q-zTTQ5yiFQk8VcylIxng.text: Cien Agaves is a very nice Mexican restaurant in old town scottsdale.   Margaritas were very good and refreshing on a hot summer day like yesterday and the food was delicious.   There were plenty of choices for vegetarians like me.  "Service with a smile" definitely made the experience an awesome one and will definitely go back again!!

66vjh_3JP0XBvVn3X3TdWw.text: I ordered three tacos and all 3 were downright lousy.  Can't remember the last time I had food this bad.  The shrimp taco was overbreaded and in a sickly sweet sauce, the shredded beef taco was very tiny and thankfully, I can't remember what the third taco tasted like.  To the reviewer who posted that these tacos are top notch.... what are you smoking?  I waited forever to get my food and saw numerous other people who came in after me get their food.  Waiter was MIA. Not coming back....ever.

Blh-tCgvwCSvkuwahKEpmw.text: I can appreciate a good happy hour, and Cien Agaves certainly has a muy bueno one.  While I didn't come on Taco Tuesday (which I should have for their $1 tacos and $2 Tecates), I did come for Margarita Monday (ok, I made that up - margaritas here are a must every day of the week). We came in before their daily happy hour ended at 7pm and enjoyed some awesome house margies for half price - $3.50! And these suckers were pretty big too.   Food was delicioso. I had a carnitas burrito and went with our server's rec to get it enchilada style and got the spicy red sauce. I'm glad I did, because it was so good wet (hmm, TWHS). Their signature chicken fajitas were really tasty as well. Entrees were so big that I couldn't imagine getting any appetizers or dessert - although an after dinner shot of tequila? Si, senor! Obviously, they had a list of cien tequilas on their menu. As much as I love Clase Azul, we decided to get shots of Milagro Anejo and saved ourselves $400.  All in all, a fun spot in Old Town Scottsdale to get your Mex fix!

RJhwTIAIa0GZ0iO5g0I1tA.text: This is my go to place for a solid margarita night. Love their chicken quesadillas and the fajitas are good too. Go during happy hour, such good deals. The service is great, and all of the food is awesome. Only thing on the menu I don't like is the cheese crisp, it's like a weird version of a Mexican pizza or something, pass on that.

EzS8GGxYj1zLoafO1KEhPg.text: Cant give negative stars.  So got this walked in with a meal that followed my diet and was going to get drinks and they told me I had to eat my meal outside on the curb. Fail fail fail

zDNdohfnKYA4YH3W5SDiPg.text: Tacos and Tequila- A match definitely made in heaven... and if heaven's a place on earth, then it's here at Cien Agaves!  !Tabernero, mas Clase Azul y tacos de papa por favor

_eeYZxtubbIQLdDYaRbhKA.text: Cien Agaves, you have potential, but you let me down.  On the plus side, happy hour is decent at half price appetizers, free chips & salsa and cheap drinks. I've been here 6 times for happy hours and decided to use my Living Social deal for a dinner last weekend.   Bad decision, my happy hour memories are ruined. Stale chips, slow and awful service and I found a hair in the free salsa and had an overall horrible experience. I used a Living Social deal for $10 for $20 and the visit solidified my decision to not go back again, not even for happy hour.  The service is awful, the hostess doesn't greet people as they enter or say goodbye as they leave...I never thought I'd notice a hostess so much until I saw how little this one did. She spent most the time picking at her nails while at the front.   We had a party of 5 total and 3 of them came after we had already ordered our drinks. Our server never took drink orders for them and we had to grab her to order more food.   Our food wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good. Service was horrible, but they didn't even seem that busy.  We would have ended up spending a lot more $ here on food and drinks but decided to go other places in old town to get good service.  Management...please take the helpful hints, because I know you can be a good restaurant.

lPVwVWLojgF9uikxDYlYrw.text: Service was absolutely awful. Waitress had a terrible memory clearly and continuously asked what we ordered..... and the wait to get our drinks/food was well over an hour. Food was awful. TERRIBLE CHOICE.

Rz8apFTgig8JO6o6RWJPOA.text: The service was a little iffy. No water refills the entire time. The food was great though. Los Nachos were a great appetizer to share with the table. The Big Ass Burrito is probably the best burrito I have had, but it was a little heavy on the tortilla side. My first bite was only tortilla which was a disappointment. The rest of the burrito made up for it though. Only Mexican restaurant that I've ever been to that didn't serve chips and salsa.

PzeS-pDLRhSfed67ULFZUA.text: Chips and salsa were really awesome. They were pretty busy though and dinner took about 25 minutes. Fun atmosphere though.

AeRLoPv2L7sakGvccewOpQ.text: Prickly pear margarita and cheese dip were great. Potato and cheese tacos on kids menu were really good but we got the quesadilla on kids menu and they were really greasy
